The PIL has accused the board of working against the interests of the nation by overlooking the “fundamental flaws in the alignment” which prevented the project from progressing more than 10% in seven years. Though the project was due to be completed in 2007, all that has been opened so far is the section in the flat terrain of the Kashmir valley while making little headway in dealing the engineering challenge of crossing the Himalayan barrier.
According to the PIL, Chopra went out of his way to persuade the board to retain the flawed alignment because he had been involved in its planning and execution in the crucial first four years of the project.
summary: The Railway Board has found itself compelled to address safety concerns regarding the Kashmir valley connectivity project due to judicial intervention and a Public Interest Litigation (PIL). A Delhi High Court order prompted the board to invite the petitioner, Prashant Bhushan from the Centre for Public Interest Litigation (CPIL), to present his safety-related viewpoints on the project. Bhushan had previously accused two board members, Rakesh Chopra and Shri Prakash, of concealing safety risks associated with their preferred "slope skirting alignment." Bhushan's PIL emphasized the need for a straighter, shorter alignment to mitigate landslide risks in the Himalayan terrain, as initially proposed by S.K. Vij in 2008 but later reversed by Chopra. The PIL criticized the board for failing to address fundamental alignment issues, causing significant delays in the project's completion. The Railway Board now faces scrutiny over its decision to retain the contentious alignment, despite earlier assurances regarding passenger safety made by Railway Minister Mamata Banerjee. The PIL argues that the board's actions have hindered the project's progress, which was originally scheduled for completion in 2007. While a portion of the project in the Kashmir valley has been completed, challenges associated with crossing the Himalayan terrain remain largely unresolved. The PIL contends that Chopra's involvement in the project's planning and execution during its initial stages influenced the board's decision to maintain the problematic alignment. The board must address these concerns in response to judicial directives.

headline: Indian teams struggle
article: The Indian men’s and seniors team, with a patchy performance, were languishing in the 14th position as the biennial World bridge championships got underway at Sao Paulo in Brazil on Sunday. Holder Norway, which won its maiden Bermuda Bowl (for men) in 2007, is on top with 180 Victory Points (VPs), out of a possible 225 VPs, after nine rounds.
summary: The above article is based on how India struggles to win the championship which was held at Sao Paulo in Brazil. Out of 225 Victory Points, Norway is on top with 180 Victory Points, after 9 rounds.

headline: Degree certificates delayed, Anna univ graduates worried
article: CHENNAI: An inordinate delay in conducting the annual convocation of Anna University in Chennai has left thousands of graduates, who had passed out of engineering colleges in May last year, anxious and worried. The university normally conducts the convocation and awards degrees to the graduates latest by November every year. However, there is no word on the convocation for the 2008-09 batch of students, although it is the fag end of January now. "Many of our students who graduated in the previous batch keep calling us to find out if we have any news about the convocation. We are unable to answer them. Our staff had approached the university but the authorities merely informed them that the convocation could not be scheduled due to some technical reasons," said a principal of a leading self-financing engineering college in Kancheepuram district. The scene was more or less similar in many other colleges too. "The delay is intriguing. I find no reason for not conducting the convocation," observed a dean of a college. Students, particularly, tho-se who have gone abroad for higher studies are the worst hit as some universities there insist that they furnish the degree certificate at the earliest for verification. "Although I had produced the provisional certificate and the consolidated marksheet for the four-year study period, the university officials are insisting on the convocation certificate since most Indian students receive it by December," said Balakumar, who is pursuing an MBA programme in a US university. Inquiries with senior professors of the Anna University revealed that the event was being delayed as the office of the governor-chancellor has not yet given the mandatory date for conducting the convocation. "As per rules, the date for the convocation can be finalised only with the consent of the chancellor of the university. Only after getting this date can the university go ahead and print the 70,000-odd graduation certificates, which have to be then manually signed by the controller of examinations or the registrar. The degree certificates must bear the date of the convocation in print. For some reason, senior officials of the university have not been able to get the date from Raj Bhavan. We don't know if Raj Bhavan officials are upset over something or if the university has failed to toe their line on some issue," a senior professor and syndicate member of the university told Times of India. However, when contacted, Anna University vice-chancellor P Mannar Jawahar said the office of the governor-chancellor was expected to give a date in February for the ceremonial event. "It will be held soon," he assured.
summary: The delay in conducting Anna University's annual convocation in Chennai has caused distress among thousands of 2008-09 engineering graduates. Traditionally held by November, there has been no communication about the convocation. University staff have been informed of technical difficulties as the reason behind the delay. Students, particularly those pursuing higher education abroad, face challenges as some foreign universities require degree certificates for verification. The delay seems to result from the governor-chancellor's office not providing a date for the convocation, which is essential for printing the graduation certificates. Senior university officials have not been able to obtain this date, leading to speculation about potential disagreements with Raj Bhavan, the governor's residence. Anna University's vice-chancellor anticipates a convocation date from the governor's office in February.

headline: Many still await CAT call for Phase-II
article: HYDERABAD: Here is yet another CAT-2009 goof-up. Even as the organizers — IIMs and Prometric —announced that the Phase-II of CAT-2009 would be held on Jan 30 and 31, many in the city are yet to be informed about their exam dates. The candidates, who appeared for the test during the first phase from November 28 to December 8 but were unable to complete it due to technical snags, were advised to appear for the online test again. While the IIMs announced the dates for the second phase, many applicants here have not yet been intimated. The candidates were expected to be informed of their new test dates and centres before Jan 23 but there are many from the city who have not received any information so far. Students complained that they are making frantic calls to Prometric toll-free number for assistance but in vain. “During the first phase, all the candidates at the centre from where I appeared were told that our test was cancelled due to server problems. But my test has not been rescheduled and Prometric representatives were not able to explain why I have been denied a chance to reappear for the test,” said a candidate. “On enquiry, I was told by Prometric that my test will be rescheduled but they have not given me the timing and centre details so far. Everyday I make calls but they are not in a position to help me out,” another student said. According to some coaching centres here, students have been intimated of their test dates even as late as Janaury 27. “There are students who have got test dates three days later than the stipulated day of the release of the schedule. The students should not get worked up about this. They should, however, be in constant touch with the IIMs and Prometric officials,” said Jaideep Singh Chowdry, spokesperson, Time coaching centre.
summary: The Phase-II of CAT-2009, organized by IIMs and Prometric, was scheduled for January 30 and 31 for candidates who couldn't complete the first phase due to technical issues. However, many candidates in Hyderabad remained unaware of their exam dates despite the scheduled announcement. They were expected to receive the new test dates and center information by January 23 but still hadn't been informed. Annoyed candidates reported making multiple calls to the Prometric toll-free number without resolution. Some received their test dates as late as January 27, causing anxiety. Coaching centers advised students to stay in touch with IIMs and Prometric officials for updates.

headline: CAs have fun at this do organised by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India in Lucknow
article:
It was party time for CA students in Lucknow. After studying hard, the students partied equally hard at the recently organized youth fest for CAs. 

Organized by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India, Lucknow chapter, the event saw various colorful competitions like rangoli, collage and poster making. “Through this fest we want to tell the world that CAs Bhi Masti karte hain. Woh Khali padhai hi Nahi karte,” said Rishabh Lamba. 

Wait and watch: However, the most awaited part of the evening was the selection of Mr and Miss CA which was adjudged by Anju Narain, Diksha Singh and Shikha Srivastava. While Arun Nair was chosen as Mr. CA, Pritika was Miss CA. But the most popular guy around was Avichal Kapur, chairman of the student body of ICAI, Lucknow, who is behind the fest. Students were spotted happily posing for a pic with him.
summary: CA Students present in Lucknow celebrated at a youth fest organized by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. This event presented various competitions like rangoli, collage and poster making. Arun Nair and Pritika were chosen as Mr. and Miss CA, while Avichal Kapur, the student body chairman, was the behind the fest.

headline: Boy seeks birth certificate, handed ‘date of death’
article: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: K Muhammed (13) had applied to the City Corporation for his birth certificate. This is what he received: his ‘date of death’ courtesy a typo by a corporation clerk. A sixth standard student in a school on the city’s outskirts, Muhammed had filled in the application form for the certificate earlier this month. He got the certificate on January 18. Though the first page mentions it as Birth Certificate, the second page where the details appear was full of mistakes. According to the document, the date of death of the boy was December 1, 1997 (which was actually his date of birth) and the place of death, a government hospital in the city. Even the date of grant of the certificate was wrongly mentioned as June 8, 2008. The corporation blames it on clerical error as there was a heavy rush for both birth and death certificates. They also offered to rectify the same. However, the family claims that even on an earlier occasion when they applied for the birth certificates of Muhammed and his younger sister Thasni, the corporation had given them a girl’s certificate. This time, his mother Sabeena is in no mood to relent.The family was said to be planning to seek compensation for the insensitiveness and mental agony caused to them by the corporation.
summary: A 13-year-old, K Muhammed, applied for a birth certificate from the City Corporation but received one with a clerical error, stating his "date of death" as December 1, 1997, instead of his birth date. The certificate also erroneously mentioned the place of death and the date of grant. The corporation attributed the mistake to a heavy workload and offered to rectify it. However, the family, which had experienced issues with birth certificates before, is considering seeking compensation for the distress caused.

headline: Oppn wants to destroy Sanatan Dharma: Modi
article: PM Modi claimed Thursday in poll-bound MP that the INDIA bloc is making an “attempt to destroy Sanatan Dharma”, his first public statement on the controversy triggered by DMK politician Udhayanidhi Stalin’s call for its “eradication”. The PM urged Indians to thwart what he saw as the bloc’s “hidden agenda” to push the country into a 1,000 years of slavery”.
summary: Prime Minister Modi asserted on Thursday, during his visit to the poll-bound state of Madhya Pradesh, that the INDIA bloc is engaged in a deliberate endeavor to dismantle the fundamental principles of Sanatan Dharma. This marks his initial public declaration regarding the controversy sparked by Udhayanidhi Stalin, a politician from the DMK, who advocated for the complete eradication of Sanatan Dharma. The Prime Minister implored the Indian populace to actively counteract what he perceives as the bloc's concealed ulterior motives, which aim to subject the nation to a millennium of enslavement.

headline: In Chhattisgarh line-up full of big guns, Congress’s message to BJP
article:
Among its first list of 30 candidates are CM Bhupesh Baghel, Deputy CM T S Singh Deo and several Cabinet ministers. Congress has fielded Girish Dewangan, a close ally of Baghel, to face former BJP CM Raman Singh in Rajnandgaon. The Congress on Sunday declared its first list of 30 candidates in Chhattisgarh, including 19 of the 20 constituencies at stake in the first phase on November 7. While eight sitting MLAs have been dropped, top leaders and ministers have been retained.

With this, the party underlines the advantage it seemingly has over a BJP still struggling to find its feet and sends the Opposition party the message that it is the favourite to retain power come December 3, when the results will be announced. Of the 90 Assembly seats, the Congress won 68 in 2018 and the BJP won 15. After several bypolls, the Congress’s tally is 71 present and the BJP’s is down to 13.

Of the 14 heavyweights whose candidature have been declared are Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel (Patan), Deputy CM T S Singh Deo (Ambikapur), Speaker Charan Das Mahant (Sakti), and Cabinet ministers Amarjeet Bhagat (Sitapur-ST), Umesh Patel (Kharsia), Jai Singh Agarwal (Korba), Shivkumar Dahariya (Arang-SC), Anila Bhendia (Dondi Lohara-ST), Tamradhwaj Sahu (Durg Rural), Ravindra Choubey (Saja), Guru Rudra Kumar (Nawagarh-SC), Mohammad Akbar (Kawardha), Mohan Markam (Kondagaon) and Kawasi Lakhma (Konta).
There are some big names among the eight MLAs denied tickets. In Kanker, former IAS officer Shishupal Shori has been replaced by former MLA Shankar Dhruv while in Dantewada the party has replaced Devati Karma, the wife of Mahendra Karma who had started the Salwa Judum anti-Naxal militia, with their son Chavindra. Maoists killed Mahendra and several senior Congress leaders in the 2013 Jhiram Ghati attack in Sukma. Devati won the 2013 election but lost to the BJP’s Bhima Mandavi five years later. But after Mandavi was killed in a 2019 Naxal attack, Devati won the ensuing bypoll against Mandavi’s wife.
summary: The Congress on Sunday declared its first list of 30 candidates in Chhattisgarh, including 19 of the 20 constituencies at stake in the first phase on November 7. While eight sitting MLAs have been dropped, top leaders and ministers have been retained Chhattisgarh Congress president Deepak Baiis the Lok Sabha MP from Bastar, has been fielded from Chitrakot that he won in 2018 but vacated the following year to contest the parliamentary elections.

headline: Extradition of Laik Ali may be sought
article:
The Minister of States, Sardar Patel, told Parliament today that Government were considering the question of making representation to the Pakistan Government to hand over Mir Laik Ali to the Hyderabad Government. When asked if the "Commonwealth agency" would be requested to make efforts to send back Laik Ali, the Sardar replied it was premature to make any such move.
 The question of extradition of Mir Laik Ali who has escaped from custody to Pakistan was raised by Mr. K. Hanumanthayya through a short-notice question.
 Sardar Patel was asked whether any representation had been made to the Government of Pakistan to hand him over to the Government of Hyderabad.
Sardar Patel said the matter was under consideration.
  Mr. Mahavir Tyagi: May I know whether an enquiry has been instituted into the circumstances of his escape?
  Sardar Patel: An enquiry has been made and the matter is 'sub-judice'.
Mr. C. M. Poonacha: In view of the fact that Pakistan and India are members of the Commonwealth, will the Commonwealth agency be requested to make efforts to send back Laik Ali?
 Sardar Patel: It is premature now to make any such move.
 Mr. H. V. Kamath: Is there any understanding or agreement between India and Pakistan with regard to extradition of persons under detention or under-trial prisoners?
Sardar Patel: There is no inter-Dominion agreement but there is a legal position.
summary: Above is the article based on a criminal Laik Ali, who has escaped from custody to Pakistan. Sardar Patel, who was the minister of states, was asked whether any representation had been made to the Government of Pakistan to hand him over to the Government of Hyderabad. He replied that the matter was under consideration and an enquiry has been made and the matter is 'sub-judice'. When he was asked whether there was any understanding or agreement between India and Pakistan with regard to extradition of persons under detention or under-trial prisoners?, he replied that there was no inter Dominion agreement but there was a legal position.

headline: In Rohit Sharma's India, pieces of what Virat Kohli left behind as Pakistan steamrolled in lop-sided World Cup bummer
article:
This may be Rohit Sharma's Indian team but certain lingering pieces of Virat Kohli's tenure cannot go unnoticed.November of 2021 was tumultuous time in Indian cricket, perhaps its most strenuous chapter since the 2013 spot fixing scandal. The Virat Kohli vs Sourav Ganguly feud was out in the open for public consumption after India's most successful Test captain was sacked from ODIs. Although Kohli had given up T20I captaincy, he was keen to continue in one-dayers hoping to win the World Cup at home. But Ganguly and BCCI had other plans, and Kohli eventually succumbed, his thoughts not aligning with the board's.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma discuss while leaving the field after India bowled out Pakistan for 191.(AP)
Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma discuss while leaving the field after India bowled out Pakistan for 191.(AP)

With India fresh off a World Cup elimination, the baton passed to Rohit Sharma. He was expected to give India what Kohli couldn't – an ICC silverware – but pretty soon, even the most successful IPL captain realised that leading India is far more challenging than Mumbai Indians. Rohit and Rahul Dravid were given a team Kohli and Ravi Shastri nearly raised from scratch, so when most of them went absent due to injuries, India were not ready for the repercussions – such as failing to qualify for last year's Asia Cup final and a defeat to Bangladesh which no one saw coming.

We're now on WhatsApp. Click to join.
When Kohli left, Mohammed Siraj was giving Ishant Sharma stiff competition as India's third pacer in Tests, Kuldeep Yadav was away in the wilderness and Jasprit Bumrah was fatigued. Two years down the line, all three of their fortunes have swung the entire arc. Siraj is the world's No. 1 ODI bowler, Kuldeep is this year's second-highest wicket-taker and Bumrah is even more menacing than before. India at their full strength can ransack oppositions at will, and after a testing year-long-wait, Rohit is finally at a space where he can enjoy this luxury. But he wouldn't have been in this position had he not played a role in nourishing the emotionally-damaged, mentally-wrecked Kuldeep and making a full-of-promise Siraj realise his ODI pedigree.
summary: The Virat Kohli vs Sourav Ganguly feud was out in the open for public consumption after India's most successful Test captain was sacked from ODIs  Although Kohli had given up T20I captaincy, he was keen to continue in one-dayers hoping to win the World Cup at home. But Ganguly and BCCI had other plans, and Kohli eventually succumbed, his thoughts not aligning with the board's.With India fresh off a World Cup elimination, the baton passed to Rohit Sharma.

headline: Vaccinate more, Centre tells States
article: COVID-19 is not over yet and with the rise in cases in some States, it is important to be alert and not forget COVID appropriate behaviour, said Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Monday after a review meeting with State Health Ministers. Flagging the decrease in testing, he urged the States to strengthen surveillance and focus on genome sequencing. The Minister directed the States to ensure increased focus on COVID vaccination coverage for school-going children and administering precautionary dose to the elderly. He added that there should be no wastage of COVID-19 vaccines at any cost.
summary: On Monday, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya held a review meeting with State Health Ministers and reminded everyone that COVID-19 is still a concern. He empathetically urged people to remain vigilant and not forget COVID appropriate behavior, especially with the rise in cases in some states.The Minister expressed concern about the decrease in testing and encouraged the States to strengthen surveillance and focus on genome sequencing. He also directed the States to prioritize COVID vaccination coverage for school-going children and administering precautionary doses to the elderly. The Minister emphasized that every COVID-19 vaccine was valuable and should not be wasted under any circumstances. Let us all work together to keep ourselves and our loved ones safe during these challenging times.

headline: Beatles stolen tapes may hit stalls by 2007
article: The tapes, dubbed as "Get Back" sessions, were recorded on January 1969, in a damp room at Twickenham Studios. Fans of the legendary British band The Beatles may be able to get their hands on the tapes of their final recording sessions as soon as 2007, it has been revealed. And, the new comes straight from the horse’s mouth itself, for Neil Aspinall, the band’s first road manager and now head of the Apple Corps estate was the one to divulge the information. Aspinall was speaking at the trial of 55-year old Nigel Oliver who stole tapes of The Beatles' final recording sessions that which contained more than 200 one-off performances and unique covers. "These tapes have huge commercial value. They've got over 80 hours or more of sound footage on them of The Beatles recording and chatting about everything. There's lots of very unknown stuff and music on there that they wouldn't have recorded in a normal session. For example, they covered over 200 songs on these tapes, songs of the day such as Bob Dylan," the Daily Mail quoted him, as saying. The "Get Back" sessions, as the tapes have been dubbed, were recorded on 2 January 1969, in a damp room at Twickenham Studios, and show the band arguing, singing to contemporary songs and jamming to unreleased tracks as they work on their last album.
summary: Neil Aspinall, The Beatles' former road manager and head of Apple Corps, reveals that stolen tapes from the band's final recording sessions in 1969 might become available to fans as soon as 2007. The tapes, known as the "Get Back" sessions, contained over 200 unique performances and covers, including unreleased tracks and over 80 hours of audio, capturing The Beatles' conversations, arguments, and music experimentation in the Twickenham Studios room. The revelation came during the trial of Nigel Oliver, who had stolen the tapes, highlighting their significant commercial value and the historical treasure trove of rare Beatles recordings they represented.

headline: India takes up stapled visa issue with China
article: India has asked China not to discriminate against visa applications filed by its nationals on grounds of domicile and ethnicity. In response to a question on a report published in The Hindu on Thursday, Foreign Office spokesperson Vishnu Prakash said: “It is our considered view and position that there should be no discrimination against visa applicants of Indian nationality on grounds of domicile or ethnicity. We have conveyed our well-justified concern to the Chinese government in this regard.”
summary: The officials of India had asked the chinese officials that Indian citizen passports should not be biased based on grounds of domicile and ethnicity. This concern was well justified with chinese government.

headline: Six former TDP MLAs eager to join party: BJP
article: BJP district president J. Ankala Reddy welcoming a TDP worker from Rapthadu into the party fold in Anantapur on Friday. Six former MLAs of the TDP from the district are in touch with our Central leadership, and a decision on admitting them into the party will be taken in the next one month, according to J. Ankala Reddy, BJP district president. Addressing the media here on Friday, Mr. Ankala Reddy said, with the crushing defeat of the TDP in the recent elections, a majority of the second-rung leaders were eager to join the BJP.
summary: The district president of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), J. Ankala Reddy, extended a warm welcome to a Telugu Desam Party (TDP) worker from Rapthadu who has decided to join our party in Anantapur on Friday. Additionally, it has come to our attention that six former Members of Legislative Assembly (MLAs) from the TDP in the district have been in contact with our Central leadership. A decision regarding their admission into the BJP will be made within the next month. Mr. Ankala Reddy, the district president of the BJP, made these statements during a press conference held on Friday. He further stated that following the TDP's significant defeat in the recent elections, a majority of their second-tier leaders have expressed a strong desire to join the BJP.

headline: Petrol may be de-rationed in Southern states from Sep 1.
article:
According to present indications, petrol may be completely de-rationed in the entire State of Madras, Mysore. Travancore-Cochin Union, Hyderabad and West Bengal with effect from Sept. 1.
 A proposal to this effect had been circulated to State Governments by the Government of India and the States had been asked to submit their views before Aug. 26.
The Madras Government, it is gathered, have expressed itself in favour of complete de-rationing in the entire State.
 In this State, it may be remembered; petrol has already been de-rationed in respect of Madras City, Chingleput and Port Cochin.
The present proposal of the Government of India, it is gathered, will not affect a few other States like Bombay for the present.
 Petrol has already been de-rationed by Governments abroad (England, Australia, Newzealand, etc.). Further it is stated that now it is now possible to secure petrol from the soft currency areas, thus enabling the Government of India not to waste dollars on this account.
 As a result of complete de-rationing, Madras authorities estimate that petrol consumption in this State would increase by about 50 percent.
summary: In the above article, it is said that petrol may be de-rationed from September 1 in entire state of Madras, Mysore. This proposal was circulated by Government of India to all state governments, where it had been asked to submit their views before August 26. Almost all states was expressed favour. By that time,  Petrol had already been de-rationed by Abroad Governments. As a result of complete de-rationing, Madras authorities estimate that petrol consumption in this State would increase by about 50 percent.

headline: Operation Ajay: Two flights bring back 471 Indians from Israel
article:
Two flights from Tel Aviv carrying a total of 471 Indians landed in the national capital on October 15.One flight was operated by Air India and another by SpiceJet.

A total of four flights have been operated under Operation Ajay, which was launched by the government to facilitate the return of Indians who wish to come back from Israel, where an intense conflict is going on with militant group Hamas.External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Sunday said the third flight with 197 passengers landed at the Delhi airport in the morning.

The fourth flight with 274 passengers onboard touches down in the national capital, he said in posts on social media platform X and also shared pictures of passengers.

Two chartered flights from Tel Aviv, operated by Air India, came with a total of more than 435 passengers on Friday and Saturday.
summary:
There is war going in  Isreal and India are trying to rescue the indian citizen from the wars 
and india is also helping the isreal.
A total of four flights have been operated under Operation Ajay, which was launched by the government to facilitate the return of Indians who wish to come back from Israel, where an intense conflict is going on with militant group Hamas.

headline: Trinamool Cong leader arrested by CBI
article:
KOLKATA: CBI on Thursday arrested Trinamool Congress leader Sunidhi Chattaraj and a retired customs official Kanchan Kumar Sanyal under charges of creating false evidence and posessing assets disproportionate to income respectively.
Both were chargesheeted and produced at the City Metropolitan Magistrate's court during the day, CBI sources said. The arrest followed a 2003 raid at the Kolkata residence of Sanyal, a former deputy commissioner of customs, in which CBI had recovered Rs 88 lakh in cash.
Chattaraj, a former MLA from Siuri in Birbhum district of West Bengal, had then claimed that the money belonged to him and he had entrusted Sanyal with it.
Chattaraj, a former MLA from Siuri in Birbhum district of West Bengal, had then claimed that the money belonged to him and he had entrusted Sanyal with it.
summary: Trinamool Congress leader Sunidhi Chattaraj and retired customs official Kanchan Kumar Sanyal were arrested by the CBI. Chattaraj, a former MLA, claimed that Rs 88 lakh found at Sanyal's Kolkata residence in 2003 was his and that he had given it to Sanyal. Sanyal was charged with having assets disproportionate to his income. Both were produced in court after being charged.

headline: Mamata withdraws resignation
article: Railway Minister Mamata Banerjee and Minister of State for External Affairs Ajit Kumar Panja today withdrew their resignations after a written assurance from Prime Minister Atal Behari Vajpayee to again look into the issue of the recent hike in petroleum prices and take “appropriate action” after his return from Mumbai. Addressing a press conference at her residence here, Ms Banerjee read out a letter from Mr Vajpayee, faxed to her this afternoon, and said on the basis of his written assurance, they had decided to withdraw their resignations with immediate effect. “As the Prime Minister himself has talked to me twice and even written a letter promising me to relook and take appropriate action regarding the sudden hike in the prices of petroleum products, including that of LPG and kerosene, which are largely used by the commonman, we have decided to reciprocate his noble gesture and rejoin the Cabinet,” Ms Banerjee said. She also quoted the Prime Minister’s letter: “I fully share your concern and sentiment about the effect of the price hike on the common people. Even though government has tried to minimise the burden of price increase on consumers, it cannot be disputed that the hike does cause hardship to the common citizens. We are closely watching the trend in international oil prices and I assure you that the entire issue will be given a re-look and appropriate action taken after I return from Mumbai subsequent to my knee surgery”. Ms Banerjee claimed that a written assurance from none other than the Prime Minister himself was tantamount to a victory for the common man for whom both she and her party — Trinamool Congress-stood. To a query, she clarified that her decision would hold only till Mr Vajpayee recovered from his knee surgery after which the latter had promised to relook into the issue. “At present I want to express my sincere thanks and gratitude to the Prime Minister, who, despite his illness, took serious steps to settle the issue, which was of prime concern for all,” Ms Banerjee, referring to her telephonic talks with Mr Vajpayee on October 4 as well as today. “I am doubly grateful to him because despite his illness, the Prime Minister also inquired about the latest flood situation in the state and sympathised with the large number of affected people,” she said, adding the Prime Minister had also conveyed his warm wishes to the people of Bengal on the joyous occasion of Durga Puja in his letter. “Hence, I am resuming my duty as Railway Minister from today,” she said.
summary: Railway Minister Mamata Banerjee and Minister of State for External Affairs Ajit Kumar Panja today withdrew their resignations after the prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee had given written assurance to the ministers to look into the matter of rising price in petroleum product. She was thankful to prime minister that besides his knee injury, he is concerned for the minister's resignation.

headline: Explained: How Israel-Palestine conflict can have deep impact on India's petrol, diesel prices
article:
The conflict between Israel and Palestine could have a massive impact on crude oil rates, which could lead to an increase in the petrol, diesel prices in India.While India has shown its unabashed support for Israel after the surprise terror attack launched by Palestine-based group Hamas, the Indian economy is likely to take a major blow if the crisis worsens and the war between the countries continues.
Israel is retaliating to the Hamas terror attacks by bombing Gaza in an effort to end the siege of the military group in the conflicted area, but the high defence measures is draining the economy of the country, impacting its trade and business.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharama said on Friday that the concerns regarding a spike in petrol and diesel prices are back in India in the midst of the Israel-Hamas war. The FM said that there are uncertainties in the global petrol market, and hinted at the prices going up soon.As it doesn’t seem like the operation by the Israeli defences will die down anytime soon, here is all you need to know about how much the petrol prices in India can rise, and what will be its impact on the overall inflation in the country.

First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Gita Gopinath, while speaking to NDTV, said that if the Israel conflict became bigger, it could have a major impact on oil prices across the globe, inflation and the world GDP.
summary:
The Israel-Hamas clash has left over 3700 people dead as the conflict entered its ninth day on Sunday. Israel has asked the people of Gaza to evacuate to other parts of the conflicted area as it is expected that the IDF will launch an on-ground military operation soon.
Crude oil prices are already on the rise and experts are warning traders against investing in Indian Oil and ONGC shares in the coming days due to an expected exponential rise in petrol prices. It is expected that the prices will rise by 10 percent if the Israel conflict doesn’t get resolved.
