"balasaheb has asked me to go. but there would be no public meetings at all," he informs. refusing to comment on the present congress-ncp government in the state, thackeray, however, did make a point about the state of uneasiness amongst cops. "if this government lasts for more than a year, the first flash of agitation would come from the police. there is too much interference and exchange of big bucks for top posts." asked about the allegations of heavy loans taken by the previous bjp-ss government, which has brought to the state to bankruptcy, thackeray added, "yes, we did borrow. but the money was used for flyovers, the expressway between mumbai-pune and the krishna valley project. these projects will start paying back soon." like his uncle, raj thackeray is also a firm believer of his own concept of dictatorship. "please do not get me wrong. this democracy has failed to give us basic things like roads, water, power and food. there is famine in marathwada and we are opening cybercafes in mumbai. how long can we ignore the harsh reality? with a population of over a billion, china is way ahead of us. in india, we just talk or go to court. we need one strong leader who will guide and discipline us to bring in change." raj's rules on his relationship with uddhav: everything is fine between us, my brother and i are very close on sanjay nirupam's outburst against the pmo: he will have to issue an apology, no doubt on allegations that he attempts to copy his famous uncle: it's genetic, nothing else. copycats do not last for long a world leader he greatly admires: lee kuan yew, former pm of singapore on the bjp-shiv sena rift: it is being talked about for the past ten years. both parties have come together for the cause of hindutva and will pass this bad phase too.
summary: Raj Thackeray, a Shiv Sena leader, admits to being in "political hibernation" due to being targeted for his statements and actions. He plans a comeback with a state-wide tour to meet Sena leaders but without public meetings. He expresses concerns about unease in the police force under the current government and believes a strong leader is needed for development. Thackeray defends the previous government's loans, emphasizing their use for critical infrastructure projects.

headline: Niki Lauda shows up at F1
article: Three time world champion, legendary F1 racer Niki Lauda, was spotted on Day 2 of the F1 Indian GP at the Buddh International Circuit. There was a flurry of clicks from F1 fans in the paddock. When asked about the film Rush, in which Lauda’s rivalry with James Hunt has ben depicted, Lauda said, “I saw the movie and it feels great that it is doing well. I think 80% of the film and my role is real.” About F1, Lauda added, “Today, F1 is a huge sport and has gained a lot of popularity all over the world. Also, with time, a lot of things have changed, and so have the drivers. There are many new drivers today because they need not worry about getting killed. It’s much easier today, but this is a normal development for F1.”
summary: Niki Lauda 3 times world champion was spotted at F1 Indian GP. He was asked about the accuracy of the movie Rush based on his real life competition with  rival James Hunt he said it is about 80% accurate. He also commented on the current state of F1 how it is flourishing , the improved safety and the increase in general popularity.

headline: Karnataka won't allow saffronisation of education
article: mysore: education minister h vishwanath on monday said here, karnataka was opposed to the "crude attempt being made by the human resource ministry to communalise the education system and rewrite history to suit the interests of a narrow segment of the indian polity". the minister was speaking on behalf of the karnataka government at a seminar on, "saffronisation of education" organised by sahamath, a voluntary organisation in new delhi on monday, and the copy of his speech was released here. in his speech, the minister said, a multi-party system prevailed in the country. "we cannot allow our education system to be infiltrated by any one political ideology." "the prevailing consensus is reflected in the preamble of the constitution and in other provisions like article 51a of the constitution, and it cannot be subverted or replaced by the ideology of a party, least of all rss," he warned, adding, any effort to reverse the idea reflected the preamble was fraught with dangers against a federal structure. questioning the urgency of the ncert to push through a curricula based on a new document on education, the minister said, it appeared the document was prepared under rather compelling circumstances. "ncert owes an answer to the nation. is the decision backed by narrow political considerations?" he asked. in the name of nationalisation, the bjp-led government wants to saffronise the education system, he added. after saffronisation of education in uttar pradesh and rajasthan, vishwanath said, the latest news of saffronisation of the curriculum came from neighbouring goa. " based on an order, 53 schools in goa have been handed over overnight to vidhya bharati network, a rss-linked organisation which is teaching distorted versions of history in hundreds of schools run by it in up and rajasthan. the minister urged all secular forces and organisations to reject such efforts of saffronisation and restore secular, democratic traditions in india.
summary: Karnataka's Education Minister, H. Vishwanath, expressed opposition to attempts to "communalize the education system" and rewrite history to suit a specific political ideology. He warned against allowing a single political ideology to infiltrate the education system and emphasized the importance of upholding the nation's prevailing consensus, as reflected in the Constitution's preamble and Article 51A. Vishwanath questioned the urgency behind the introduction of a new education document by the NCERT and suggested that it might be politically motivated. He also criticized the saffronization of education in Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Goa, urging secular forces and organizations to reject such efforts and preserve India's secular, democratic traditions.

headline: Fear, myths cloud citizens’ minds ahead of Covid jab in Gujarat
article: AHMEDABAD: Fighting a combination of misinformation and myths clouding the minds of the public ahead of the Covid vaccination drive is becoming a major challenge for civic health authorities. Myths ranging from side effects or adverse effects of the vaccine to talk that people who are vaccinated need to be put under electronic surveillance for between 30 minutes and 28 days and religious beliefs that fat from certain animals are used for the vaccine, is proving to be major hindrance. In municipal health surveys, citizens from areas like Sarkhej, Maktampura, Behrampura, Danilimda, Rakhial and Gomtipur are refusing to register for the vaccine, thanks to a flood of false messages circulated on social media. Gyasuddin Shaikh, the MLA from Dariapur, says, “Fear of the vaccine is one reason. Then there are false reports being circulated which claim that the vaccination drive may harm a particular community. There are reports of use of fat from certain animals. This is being circulated on WhatsApp and hence people are against registering. Once the ingredients of the vaccine are made public, more and more people will come forward.” Mirza Haji Asarbeg, a former municipal councillor from Maktampura, said, “People in my area are afraid and its true. There is distrust and there are misinformed people who spread messages on side effects. Messages that appear in the form of news reports with side effects being reported during trial stage are being shared. We have requested people to only rely on trustworthy news sources. In several societies people were not allowed to give their data to health authorities,” says Haji. He is worried that if the misinformation is not fought several people including children and the elderly and those with comorbidities will be left out. Iqbal Shaikh, also a former municipal councillor, said, “Said the corporation asking for data like the PAN details, voter IDs or even driving licences has created fear of the National Register of Citizens and that this data would be used for it and they would be chased later."
summary: The spread of myths and misinformation in the public minds regarding Covid Vaccination has becoming a major challenge for the civic health authorities of Ahmedabad, Gujarat. False information such as animal fat used in the making of vaccine circulating through social media like a flood along with the fear of leaking private information asked during the registration are inducing fear and distrust in the hearts of citizens making them against the vaccination drives. This could put the elderly, children and those with comorbidities more in danger if the spread has not been controlled.

headline: Manmul exports milk powder to Nepal
article: mandya: the president of mandya district federation of milk producers association (manmul), javaregowda, flagged off the second consignment of 150 tonne of milk powder, being exported to nepal, on monday. manmul which has one of the three milk powder processing units of karnataka milk federation (kmf) had struck an export order for 300 tonne of milk powder last month. the first consignment of 150 tonne was flagged off by the kmf from bangalore last month. this export order is considered a milestone in the history of kmf. however, this export order will not fetch any profit to either kmf or manmul. it will balance the loss, which would have been inevitable if the powder was not sold before the expiry date. managing director of manmul, ravi kumar kakade, directors k. krishna, raju and narayan were present on the occasion of flagging off the consignment.
summary: Mandya District Federation of Milk Producers Association (MANMUL) has sent the second consignment of 150 tonnes of milk powder to Nepal. This export order, part of a total 300 tonnes, helps prevent losses due to powder expiration and is a significant milestone in the history of the Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF). The export won't generate profits but will offset potential losses. The consignment was flagged off by MANMUL's President, Javaregowda, and attended by other officials.

headline: Bombay Times The Incomplete WOMAN?
article: 75 years of fending for the complete man, raymonds head honcho gautam singhania tells nupur mahajan, it is time to set sights on women the complete man has realised that there is a woman by his side, and she needs to be dressed just as well. yes, raymond's has curtailed its fetish for men and ventured into women's wear. gautam singhania, cmd, raymond's, having created successful brands like parx, manzoni and park avenue, has today corporatised pret by launching a designer range, that tells you to be... be is a store that is partial to women, with 70 per cent of the apparel catering to their fancy. eight designers have been roped in and are sketching up a frenzy with exclusives that line the store and affordability the key. the first of the stores opened its shutters in delhi only last week and gautam singhania, fresh from the curtain-raiser, conceals his excitement with savoir-faire. "we are present in all segments of men's wear. women comprise 50 per cent of the market and we needed to tap it. with be we have achieved a twin objective: corporatising fashion and venturing into women's wear." the fashion industry is chaotic, but that, we know, is yesterday's headline. with be, raymond's has created a label that brings to the indian consumer a range of designer wear under one roof, at prices that are affordable. "i believe that indian designers have immense potential, but what they lack is systems and procedures. designers have been confronting issues of branding, retailing and distribution _ be will take care of all that." singhania is on a roll. women's wear is a domain untapped, no label yet a status symbol and be wants to carve itself into that desired niche. the store is a heady mix of ethnic, fusion and western wear, and arjun khanna, ashish soni, aparna suneja, puja nair, manju and bobby grover, priyadarshini rao, rajesh pratap singh are the wanna bes! but gautam has yet not struck the full stop. "over two years we plan to open 100 stores and the first six are soon to follow. we needed eight designers for the first store and i am looking at 20 designers for the following six." gautam is a hard task-master, not satisfied by weight of the names, as that for him is but a stepping stone. "we identified these eight as they met our criterion, now they need to meet the demand. if not, we'll have a new set." but how has he managed to get this self-centred lot to set their egos aside and come under one brand name? "there is a multi-branding, with the be label and the designer's name on the tag. also a conscious effort to retain individuality and avoid clash. but what is at the core, is a trade secret," he says matter-of-factly. of course he won't spit out the details. gautam's struck a home run with be and the ifs and buts are a well-guarded secret. and surprisingly, though it is his brainchild, he's not on a high. "it's just the beginning of a learning curve, the whole concept is so new, we don't know what to expect. but we will deal with the problems as they arise." he promises the next store to be in home-town mumbai and prices, for now, in the range of rs 700-7000, to come down as the volumes increase. new wardrobe, anyone?
summary: Raymond's, known for catering to men's fashion, has now entered the women's wear market with its new venture, "be." The "be" store features a range of designer wear for women, with 70% of the apparel tailored to their preferences. The move is an attempt to corporatize fashion and expand Raymond's presence in women's fashion. The store offers designer collections from eight fashion designers, and more stores are planned for the future. The range includes ethnic, fusion, and western wear, and prices start at Rs 700 and go up to Rs 7,000.

headline: Notice to government on removal of encroachments
article: bangalore: the karnataka high court on tuesday ordered issuance of notices to the state government and other respondents on a writ petition filed by a. narayana kulala and and 14 residents of shankaranarayana (dakshina kannada district) seeking a direction for removal of encroachments and unauthorised constructions on both sides of the haladi-kollur state highway and for the upkeep of the same. the issuance of notices were ordered by the division bench comprising chief justice p.v. reddi and justice n.k. patil. the petitioners contended that according to the highway rules on either side of the state or the national highway, a margin of 40 metres of land had to be maintained. "the margin land has fallen into the hands of encroachers. the authorities had not taken any action to the representations made by the petitioners," they added. notice to govt over work tenders: division bench comprising chief justice p.v. reddi and justice n.k. patil ordered issuance of notices to the state government and other respondents on a writ petition filed by mouneshwara and suresh, both residents of hirekerur on haveri district challenging the validity of the tender notification issued by the town panchayat towards work relating to upper tank - the main source of drinking water. the main grievance of the petitioners was that the tender notification included some of the works that had already been completed and the same is illegal and against public interest.
summary:
The Karnataka High Court has issued notices in response to two writ petitions. The first petition, filed by A. Narayana Kulala and 14 residents of Shankaranarayana in Dakshina Kannada district, seeks the removal of encroachments and unauthorized constructions along the Haladi-Kollur state highway and proper maintenance of the highway. The petitioners argue that the highway rules require a 40-meter margin of land on either side of state or national highways, which has been encroached upon.

The second notice was issued based on a writ petition filed by Mouneshwara and Suresh, residents of Hirekerur in Haveri district. They challenge the validity of a tender notification issued by the town panchayat for work related to the upper tank, a primary drinking water source. The petitioners claim that the tender notification included works that had already been completed, which they consider illegal and against public interest.

headline: Amitabh Bachchan participates in Swach Bharat Abhyan
article:
Actors like Salman Khan and Hrithik Roshan got to the streets and actively participated in the new cleanliness drive initiated by our Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The actors were spotted on the streets of Mumbai helping the common man clean the dirty areas and now, similarly it was legendary actor Amitabh Bachchan’s turn to extend his support towards this initiative.

Amitabh Bachchan was spotted in a jumpsuit, participating in the Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan and helping the cleaners in the vicinity. While his ongoing quiz show Kaun Banega Crorepati’s eight season is coming to an end, Bachchan, prior to the shoot schedule, decided to get involved in the cleanliness drive. In fact, the evergreen star posted about participating in it before he put up the pictures on his Twitter handle. “And before the finale .. it was ‘Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan’ .. went on the streets and broomed and collected dirt to clean up the place.” However, post the campaign, the actor did not waste any time in giving us a glimpse of his support towards the initiative and posted about the experience saying, “The ‘Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan’ .. personalized !! Let everyone deserve to be involved..”
Amitabh Bachchan has been shooting for the Bejoy Nambiar directorial titled Wazir which also stars Farhan Akhtar and Aditi Rao Hydari in lead roles. Apart from that, he will also be seen in his friend and filmmaker R. Balki’s film Shamitabh where he will be starring opposite Dhanush and Akshara Haasan.

Amitabh Bachchan was spotted in a jumpsuit, participating in the Swacch Bharat Abhiyaan and helping the cleaners in the vicinity. While his ongoing quiz show Kaun Banega Crorepati’s eight season is coming to an end, Bachchan, prior to the shoot schedule, decided to get involved in the cleanliness drive. In fact, the evergreen star posted about participating in it before he put up the pictures on his Twitter handle. “And before the finale .. it was ‘Swach Bharat Abhiyaan’ .. went on the streets and broomed and collected dirt to clean up the place.”
summary: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has joined the cleanliness drive initiated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai. Bachchan, who is currently shooting for the Bejoy Nambiar directorial Wazir, participated in the Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan initiative, helping cleaners in the area. He posted about his participation on Twitter before the campaign's finale. Bachchan also expressed his support for the initiative, stating that everyone deserves to be involved. As the eight-season quiz show Kaun Banega Crorepati comes to an end, Bachchan expressed his support for the initiative and urged everyone to participate. He will also star in R. Balki's film Shamitabh.

headline: Three time world champion, legendary F1 racer Niki Lauda, was spotted on Day 2 of the F1 Indian GP at the Buddh International Circuit. There was a flurry of clicks from F1 fans in the paddock. When asked about the film Rush, in which Lauda’s rivalry with James Hunt has ben depicted, Lauda said, “I saw the movie and it feels great that it is doing well. I think 80% of the film and my role is real.” About F1, Lauda added, “Today, F1 is a huge sport and has gained a lot of popularity all over the world. Also, with time, a lot of things have changed, and so have the drivers. There are many new drivers today because they need not worry about getting killed. It’s much easier today, but this is a normal development for F1.”
article: NEW DELHI: The English translation of Peter Sauber's last name is 'clean' and that's exactly the image the no-nonsense 68-year-old owner of Sauber F1 team maintains. Beginning his life as an electrician, Sauber turned into a car salesman in Hinwil, Switzerland. The Swiss entrepreneur built up his team in his home country and has weathered some rough times over the course of 40 years. The year 2010 saw him return to the pit wall after buying back the business from BMW at the end of 2009. Sauber speaks exclusively to TOI about his journey through the world of motorsports and F1's foray into India. Excerpts: You have been involved with motorsports for over four decades now. What keeps the passion burning? Motorsport in general and Formula One in particular are a unique combination of top level, professional sports, high tech and circus. This is a combination which is unique and fascinating. What are the challenges in running a successful F1 team? Give us an insight into the life of an F1 team principal. In our case we are talking about a private team, and for us it's important to have a good infrastructure, good people and good partners who are the basis for a solid foundation. Concerning my role as a team principal, I have to say that it is maybe a bit different from some of my colleagues: I'm leading the team at the race track, but I'm not involved in the day-to-day business in the factory in Hinwil. This is the responsibility of our CEO Monisha Kaltenborn. A couple of years back when BMW pulled out of F1, It was a turbulent time for the team. What prompted you to take complete control of the team and in hindsight do you think it was the right decision? From a pure business point of view it didn't really make sense to buy the company. However, there were two aspects which were important to me. On the one hand there were many employees in the company who had spent 15, 20 or even more years in the company and had helped to build everything up. I felt responsible for these people. And on the other hand there was this high tech factory in Hinwil which would have been closed. This would have been the end of Formula One in Switzerland. And, yes, it was the right decision, because it would have been wrong not to try it. In 2008, Sauber was competing with the top two team for positions on the podium. What does the team need to do to reach that same level? During the BMW era, we were a proper works team which means that we had much higher resources. At that time the team had 430 employees compared to 280 today. And the budget was much higher than it is today. Money is no guarantee to have success, but without a comparable funding, it's not realistic to compete on the same level as the current top teams. You have been struggling to catch Force India in the middle of the field. Where do you think the team is lacking? Force India made a big step forward by the middle of the season when they were able to make the outboard blown diffuser work. That put us in a defensive position for some races. However, in Suzuka we introduced a very comprehensive aero package which brought us a significant step forward. We are now back in a position where we can fight on the same level with them. F1 is coming toIndia for the first time and your CEO — Monisha Kaltenborn — also happens to be born in India. What have you heard from her about the country and are looking forward to the opportunity to explore a new F1 destination? Obviously Monisha told me a lot about India, and I'm curious to see all that. It will be my first visit to India. I think it's very important for Formula One to be present in India. The Formula One calendar 2011 consists of 19 races in 18 countries, and I think the fact that India is part of this exclusive circle shows the importance of the country. How would you sum the progress of the team so far from last year? After BMW pulled out of Formula One we went through a very difficult time. So the first task was to get stability back which happened in the course of last year. We now have a solid foundation from which we want to move forward step by step. Last year we finished eighth in the Constructors' Championship, and now we are fighting for sixth. What are the aims of the team towards the end of season ? By the middle of the season we were in sixth position with quite a big gap to Toro Rosso and Force India behind us. In the meantime, we lost sixth position, and it's our clear goal to get this position back.
summary: Peter Sauber, owner of the Sauber F1 team, discusses his long-standing involvement in motorsports, the challenges of running an F1 team, and the decision to buy back the team from BMW in 2009. He acknowledges the need for good infrastructure, people, and partners to succeed in F1. During the BMW era, they were competitive with more resources. Sauber also talks about the team's struggle to catch Force India and the recent aero package that brought them back in the fight. He expresses his anticipation for Formula One's entry into India and the importance of this new destination on the F1 calendar.

headline: Bajrang Dal activists arrested over priest attack
article: hane: eighteen bajrang dal activists were arrested on tuesday in connection with the attack on a priest at st. john baptist church in thane on monday night. three of them, who the police say were the principal instigators, have been remanded to police custody for three days, while the rest have been remanded to judicial custody till august 21. they have been charged under section 120 (b) of the indian penal code, which deals with criminal conspiracy. bajrang dal activists, meanwhile, have called for a thane bandh on wednesday in protest. the priest, father oscar mendonca, had been manhandled by a mob of 50-odd persons around 8.30 p.m. the mob, belonging to the rashtriya swayamsevak sangh (rss) and the bajrang dal, were returning after attending a condolence meeting in front of thane railway station. the meet, where fiery speeches were apparently delivered, was organised to condole the reported killings of four sangh activists in tripura two years ago. according to thane police commissioner s.m. shangari, soon after the meet, the group dashed off to the st. john baptist church, where they manhandled fr mendonca, who was returning from a dentist's appointment. he ran into the church premises for cover but could not open the door of the house and was beaten up by the mob. he suffered injuries on his head and legs and was hospitalised at the thane civil hospital. the attack has been strongly condemned by all quarters. following the assault, cardinal archbishop ivan dias visited thane to take stock of the situation. he also visited fr mendonca at the hospital. speaking to newspersons, cardinal dias condemned the attack, terming it a ``barbaric act'', that too in a civilised city like mumbai. ``the offence is very serious as a person anointed by god was attacked. it is nothing but sacrilege. we hope that the government gives us justice,'' he said. speaking to this newspaper, mr shangari said the culprits would be brought to book and stern action taken against them. the commissioner said that all churches had been provided with protection, adding that he, however, did not see any negative fall-out as police action had already been initiated. meanwhile, the assault has evoked strong reaction from the catholic community, which is feeling apprehensive after the attack. many convent schools in thane, including the st. john baptist school, remained closed on tuesday. schools are likely to remain closed next monday as well. president of the youth wing of the nationalist congress party jitendra awhad met the thane police commissioner in this regard and handed over a memorandum demanding a ban on bajrang dal. he told this newspaper that bajrang dal activists were spreading communalism and ``disturbing the homogeneous structure of society.'' the indian christian congress has also condemned the assault on fr mendonca, calling it ``madness'' to assault ``an innocent priest in mumbai because some rss activists were killed two years in tripura, as alleged by them.'' bajrang dal activists have their own story to tell. office-bearer of the vishwa hindu parishad at thane, vikram bhoir told this newspaper that wednesday's bandh was to protest the fact that no action had been taken following the killings of sangh workers in tripura. ``for just two slaps, 18 of our people are arrested, while there is no action at all when four of our activists are killed,'' he said. justifying the bajrang dal's behaviour, mr bhoir further said that rss and dal activists had gone to the baptist church to submit a letter in protest to the tripura killings. ``however, we were pushed around and therefore some of our people hit back,'' he claimed.
summary: Eighteen Bajrang Dal activists were arrested for attacking a priest at St. John Baptist Church in Thane. Three of them, believed to be the main instigators, were remanded to police custody for three days, while the others were sent to judicial custody until August 21. They were charged with criminal conspiracy under section 120 (b) of the Indian Penal Code. In response, Bajrang Dal activists called for a Thane bandh (strike) in protest. The mob, which belonged to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and the Bajrang Dal, assaulted Father Oscar Mendonca, a priest, after attending a condolence meeting. This meeting was organized to mourn the reported killings of four Sangh activists in Tripura two years earlier. Following the attack, Cardinal Archbishop Ivan Dias visited Thane, condemning the assault as a "barbaric act" in a civilized city like Mumbai. Many schools in Thane, including the St. John Baptist School, remained closed, and there were calls to ban the Bajrang Dal. The Bajrang Dal defended their actions, claiming they went to the Baptist Church to submit a letter protesting the Tripura killings and were provoked. They criticized the arrest of their members for two slaps while no action was taken for the alleged killing of four of their activists.

headline: No plan to join NDA, says Pawar
article: mumbai: nationalist congress party president sharad pawar has vehemently denied that he had any plans to join hands with either the shiv sena or the bharatiya janata party (bjp). pawar, who is on a tour of the marathwada region, announced in aurangabad that there was no plan either to join the national democratic alliance in new delhi or the shiv sena-bjp alliance in maharashtra. he also ruled out any threat to the ncp legislature party. referring to the possibility of a few ncp mlas resigning, he said that all those who wanted to leave could quit the party. however, he added that as far as he knew no one wanted to do so. criticising the nda government, he said it was one of the ``weakest governments'' to have ruled the country. he also criticised congress president sonia gandhi for ``total failure'' as the opposition leader in the lok sabha. ``most of the time, she is silenced by the more vocal nda members,'' he said. mr pawar held series meetings in aurangabad and interacted with party workers to get a feed-back about the prevailing political atmosphere on the eve of the zilla parishad and municipal corporation elections. the local self-government bodies in aurangabad-jalana will elect a member to the state legislative council in august. mr pawar said the ncp would put up a candidate since the congress had already fielded a candidate from nasik despite the fact that the ncp member of the council had retired.
summary: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) President Sharad Pawar has firmly denied any plans to join forces with either the Shiv Sena or the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). While on a tour of the Marathwada region, he stated there were no intentions to join the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in New Delhi or the Shiv Sena-BJP alliance in Maharashtra. Pawar also dismissed any threat to the NCP legislature party. Regarding the possibility of some NCP MLAs resigning, he remarked that those wishing to leave the party were free to do so, but he was unaware of anyone wanting to do so. Pawar criticized the NDA government as one of the "weakest governments" to have ruled the country and found fault with Congress President Sonia Gandhi's performance as the opposition leader in the Lok Sabha, claiming she was often silenced by more vocal NDA members. He held meetings in Aurangabad and interacted with party workers ahead of the zilla parishad and municipal corporation elections.

headline: Dabangg music has attitude
article: Music composer duo Sajid and Wajid, who have given chart-bursting music to the Arbaaz Khan production, are spoilt for choice to pinpoint which is their favourite song. From Tere Mast Mast Do Nain sung by Rahat Fateh Ali Khan to Malaika Arora Khan’s dance number Munni Badnaam to the title track Hud Hud Dabangg and even Humka Peeni Hai, all have been widely appreciated by the audiences and reviewers alike. After a long time, the songs have become one of the prime USPs of a film that is sure to drive audiences to the theatres.
summary: Music composer duo Sajid and Wajid, who have given chart-bursting music to the Arbaaz Khan production, are spoilt for choice to pinpoint which is their favourite song. From Tere Mast Mast Do Nain sung by Rahat Fateh Ali Khan to Malaika Arora Khan’s dance number Munni Badnaam to the title track Hud Hud Dabangg and even Humka Peeni Hai, all have been widely appreciated by the audiences and reviewers alike. After a long time, the songs have become one of the prime USPs of a film that is sure to drive audiences to the theatres.

headline: One billion SMSes expected today
article: BANGALORE: Come December 31 evening, 150 million mobile phones in India will send out over a billion New Year SMS greetings. That will be equivalent to almost every citizen in the country receiving an SMS that day. "Paper greetings have given way to personalised, sharply addressed, instantaneous, powerful, warm, fresh, touchy and convenient communication making SMS the most-favoured and cost-effective medium of communication," says Samuel Selvakumar, director (operation-south) Hutch. Telecom service providers have augmented their network and have taken steps to avoid traffic choke. "They have been consciously investing in expanding the SMS network and capacity by providing dedicated signalling channels," says Arun Tanksali, chief technology officer, Jatayu Software, a mobile technology firm.
summary: On December 31 in India, an estimated 150 million mobile phones will send over a billion New Year SMS greetings, which is equivalent to every citizen receiving an SMS. Telecom providers have expanded network capacity to handle the surge in SMS traffic.

headline: Railway electrification signals delay
article: danapur: the deadline announced by railway minister nitish kumar for the completion of the railway electrification up to mughalsarai by the end of december this year now seems impossible to meet since the colour signalling and non-interlocking works are yet to be started between danapur and mughalsarai. in all probability, the project can be completed not before december next year, said a railway official at danapur. according to sources, the contract for the colour signalling work was given to a renowned firm which completed the work only up to danapur. unfortunately, it has not yet started the third phase of the project from danapur to ara. some terms of the old contract, which were not acceptable to the firm, are said to be the reason behind it. besides, the non-interlocking (ni) work is yet to start between danapur and mughalsarai. keeping in view the time-consuming nature of the ni, it could take a minimum of one year. the ni, which requires full alertness and safety, takes one month to cover a distance of only 10 kilometres. thus the long distance between danapur and mughalsarai will certainly take more than a year, said a railway official. meanwhile, the railway electrification (re) department has declared the closing period for the danapur re office. the staff strength of the office, which stood at 750, has been reduced to 403. it will further come down to 293 by the end of december this year. it will be pruned to 200 next year to curtail expenditure. according to sources, a large number of railway employees working in other divisions of the railways had opted for the re office at danapur. as their services are no longer required, they are being sent back to their original places of posting. the decision has been taken in view of the fact that the work load at the danapur re office is not what it used to be. moreover, the danapur re office will be closed by the end of december 2002. it might continue to function for three more years if the fund for the patna-gaya electrification project is sanctioned in the coming rail budget, source said.
summary: The railway electrification project from Danapur to Mughalsarai, initially set for completion by the end of December this year, is unlikely to meet the deadline due to delays in color signaling and non-interlocking works. The color signaling contract was awarded to a firm, which has only completed the work up to Danapur and has not yet started the third phase to Ara due to disagreements over contract terms. The non-interlocking work between Danapur and Mughalsarai, a time-consuming process, has also not commenced and may take over a year to complete. Additionally, the Railway Electrification (RE) department is reducing staff at the Danapur RE office in anticipation of its closure by December 2002, with the workload diminishing and funds dependent on the coming rail budget.

headline: Day Two at Lakme India Fashion Week
article: mumbai: it's that time of the year. indian designers have gathered to pit their training, hard work and skills against each other to see who is the best. the bi-annual olympiad of the rag trade, the , is under way. fresh from new york, london and milan, the designs have now come to mumbai. yes, you read it right. many of those very designs which graced the catwalks of high fashion outlets on international ramps are now being showcased here. ``there is nothing new here,'' claimed some of the buyers, who spoke to this paper. according to them, many of the creations and designer labels showcased on the second day were `has-beens'. while some customers waited, credit cards in hand, to see what the designers would tempt them with, other than the country's fashion editors and a selection of store buyers, there appeared to be few signs of the investors who were supposed to be on the hunt for the next big thing. actually, the likelihood of the next big thing actually going bust seemed more evident. the prospect has caused a bizarre trickle-down effect. in order to stay ahead of the curve, fashion designers had decided to showcase a collection of pret-a-porter (ready to wear) lines for a target audience. the trouble was, there was no audience. every piece that was sent down the runway on the second day of the show was apparently scrutinised by no more than a few like-minded designers, colleagues from the fashion industry and models. that seemed to be it. spin doctors have been pushing fashion week as a trade-oriented event which would take on a `serious business orientation'. but there was little evidence of `serious business' as in deals translating into hard cash. so, what went wrong? nothing, claims sumeet nair, executive director, the fashion design council of india. ``the business is there. lots of big names are supposed to be coming in today,'' he said, shuffling a couple of papers. the names, though, are all under wraps. ``we do not give them out. and one has to understand that a concept such as this can only take off when the idea is established in the next four to five years.'' a senior designer, speaking on condition of anonymity, pointed out that they were treading a thin line between cult and commercial, while trying to keep a sense of cool. ``the clothes that are shown here are beautiful. these designers are on the fashion map and the word wearable has entered the lexicon of their reviews. now, we have to wait for the business,'' she chuckled. although some of the designers have been in business for years, their efforts were collectively dismissed as a ``watery collection, merely aping the west'' by an italian fashion journalist who decided to hang up his boots on the second day itself. in the fickle world of fashion, a designer is only as good as his or her last collection. the next couple of days could be make or break time.
summary: The bi-annual fashion event, Lakme India Fashion Week (LIFW), is in progress in Mumbai, with designers presenting their collections fresh from international runways. However, some buyers and attendees have expressed disappointment, considering many showcased designs as "has-beens." The event aims to become trade-oriented, but it appears to lack a substantial investor and buyer presence. The executive director of the Fashion Design Council of India, Sumeet Nair, has defended the event, stating that business is expected to pick up in the coming years. While some designers have made efforts to create ready-to-wear lines, concerns remain about the need to balance creativity and commercial viability.

headline: Rift among militants in J&K widening
article: NEW DELHI: Rift between local and foreign militants operating in Jammu and Kashmir has widened. Indicator to this is a recent clash between Hizbul Mujahideen and Lashkar-e-Taiba cadres, leading to eight deaths- six belonging to Hizbul group and two to LeT in Marwa in Doda district.Intelligence sources said on Friday, that there were clashes earlier too but the recent clashes indicate a wider rift among militant groups like the Hizbul Mujahideen based on local supporters and the Lashkar-e-Tabia groups comprising primarily foreign elements. "Ever since the Pakistan based United Jehadi Council issued an order on January 12 this year, that all external militant groups will try to infiltrate local ''Tanzims'' (militant outfits based in Jammu and Kashmir) and will work under the command of local leaders, the differences between groups have been growing," a senior home ministry official told the Times of India on conditions of anonymity. With local leaders calling the shots has led to a lot of heart burning among the foreign mercenaries and militants operating in Jammu and kashmir. The LeT which largely comprises such elements considers the Hizbul and other local elements unfit to carry on the jehad. "The so called local militants are not cut out to carry out jehad," a captured foreign militant had told a security official recently. Although the exact cause of the Doda clash between LeT and Hizbul was still not known, sources said that Marwa in Doda district is a dense interior area with Peer Panjal on the one side and Anant Nag on the other. There is less presence of security forces here as a result the militant groups find it a resting or peaceful place for hiding safely in the difficult terrain. Traditionally in this area tussle for supremacy among militant outfits has been going on. The January 12 order from across the border has ignited the fire further, sources said. In the past financial matters, influence on local population and some times even ego tussle over a local girl had been the sources of inter and intra fights among different militant outfits. The rift between LeT and the Hizbul began with the then Hizbul leader, in the valley Majid Dar unilaterally declaring ceasefire in July 2000. This announcement was vehemently opposed by Pakistan based LeT militant outfit and also Pakistan based Hizbul leader Salah-Ud-din as well. Pakistan government''s announced resolve to check militant infiltration from the other side, has apparently dipped the flow of infiltration and has even brought about some gap in communication among the militant ranks causing lack of clear directives here from their Pak based high commands. Ofcourse the Pakistan Jamat-e-Islami chief Rashid Qureshi has contradicted Pakistan President Parvez Musharaff''s announcement and has asserted that jehad will continue and militants from there will continue to infiltrate into Kashmir. In time to come this rift among local and outside militant outfits is like to widen further, sources stressed.
summary: Tensions are escalating between local and foreign militants in Jammu and Kashmir, as exemplified by a recent clash between Hizbul Mujahideen and Lashkar-e-Taiba operatives, resulting in eight casualties. The conflict is attributed to differences between groups like Hizbul Mujahideen, mainly composed of local supporters, and Lashkar-e-Taiba, comprising foreign elements. The discord has been exacerbated by orders from the United Jehadi Council in Pakistan, instructing foreign militant groups to collaborate with local outfits under local leadership. This shift has created resentment among foreign militants, who consider local counterparts unfit for jihad. The rift's exact cause in the Doda clash remains unclear, but the struggle for supremacy among militant groups in the region has historical roots.

headline: Rescued lioness dies
article: bangalore: a 17-year-old lion, which arrived on sunday with four tigers and a lioness breathed its last on tuesday morning. the body was sent to the university of veterinary sciences for post mortem and the reports are awaited, according to bannerghatta national park officials. officials at the bnp felt that the lion was suffering from ulcer gastritis for at least three to four years. ``the animal was brought to the rescue centre under sedation. it also had deep maggot infested wounds near the stomach,'' director of the national park g vidyasagar said, decrying the central zoo authority for shifting the animal in such a condition. on arrival at the rescue centre, the animal was administered drips.
summary: A 17-year-old lion, which arrived at Bannerghatta National Park with four tigers and a lioness, passed away on Tuesday. The lion had been suffering from ulcer gastritis for several years, and it had deep maggot-infested wounds near the stomach. The body of the lion was sent for a post-mortem examination at the University of Veterinary Sciences, and the results are pending. Bannerghatta National Park officials criticized the Central Zoo Authority for transferring the lion in such a condition and administered drips upon its arrival at the rescue center.

headline: Day two at Lakme Fashion Week
article: mumbai: it's that time of year again. indian designers have gathered to pit their training, hard work and skills against each other to see who is the best of the best. the bi-annual olympiad of the rag trade, the lakme fashion week, is under way. fresh from new york, london and milan, the designs have now come to mumbai. yes, you read it right. many of those very designs which graced the catwalks of high fashion outlets on international ramps are now being showcased here. ``there is nothing new here,'' claimed some of the buyers, who spoke to this paper. according to them, many of the creations and designer labels showcased on the second day were `has-beens'. while some customers waited, credit cards in hand, to see what the designers would tempt them with, other than the country's fashion editors and a selection of store buyers, there appeared to be few signs of the investors who were supposed to be on the hunt for the next big thing. actually, the likelihood of the next big thing actually going bust seemed more evident. the prospect has caused a bizarre trickle-down effect. in order to stay ahead of the curve, fashion designers had decided to showcase a collection of pret-a-porter (ready to wear) lines for a target audience. the trouble was, there was no audience. every piece that was sent down the runway on the second day of the show was apparently scrutinised by no more than a few like-minded designers, colleagues from the fashion industry and models. that seemed to be it. spin doctors have been pushing fashion week as a trade-oriented event which would take on a `serious business orientation'. but there was little evidence of `serious business'__as in deals translating into hard cash. so, what went wrong? nothing, claims sumeet nair, executive director, the fashion design council of india. ``the business is there. lots of big names are supposed to be coming in today,'' he said, shuffling a couple of papers. the names, though, are all under wraps. ``we do not give them out. and one has to understand that a concept such as this can only take off when the idea is established in the next four to five years.'' a senior designer, speaking on condition of anonymity, pointed out that they were treading a thin line between cult and commercial, while trying to keep a sense of cool. ``the clothes that are shown here are beautiful. these designers are on the fashion map and the word wearable has entered the lexicon of their reviews. now, we have to wait for the business,'' she chuckled. although some of the designers have been in business for years, their efforts were collectively dismissed as a ``watery collection, merely aping the west'' by an italian fashion journalist who decided to hang up his boots on the second day itself. in the fickle world of fashion, a designer is only as good as his or her last collection. the next couple of days could be make or break time.
summary: Lakme Fashion Week, the bi-annual event where Indian designers showcase their work, has kicked off in Mumbai. However, it seems the event is struggling to attract buyers and investors. Many attendees have noted that some of the designs on display are not as cutting-edge as expected, with some buyers claiming they've seen it all before. Despite the presence of fashion editors and store buyers, there's a lack of investors looking for the next big thing. The event aimed to be trade-oriented, but it has yet to show significant evidence of deals translating into business success. Organizers are hopeful that the concept will establish itself in the coming years.

headline: State Cabinet offers new year bonanza to backward classes
article:
Mumbai: The State Cabinet in its first meeting of the new year on Tuesday decided to give government guarantee for loans worth ₹325 crore to the corporations set up for the betterment of backward communities and people with disability.

The government will now stand guarantee for loans worth ₹50 crore to Sant Rohidas Leather Industries and Charmakar Development Corporation Limited, ₹70 crore to Maharashtra State Handicapped Finance and Development Corporation, ₹70 crore to Lokshahir Anna Bhau Sathe Development Corporation Limited, and ₹135 crore to Mahatma Phule Backward Class Development Corporation Limited.
summary: state cabinet gives loans worth 325 crore

headline: The paradox in Chidambaram’s budget
article: Here is a paradox worth paying attention to. Finance minister P. Chidambaram was able to keep the fiscal deficit for 2012-13 within the target he had set himself because total spending by the government was around ₹ 60,000 crore less than budgeted.One would have expected him to build on this austerity, even though it was led by curbs on capital spending rather than subsidy cuts. However, in the budget he presented on Thursday, the finance minister has indicated he will increase public spending faster than the underlying economy is expected to grow in nominal terms.There are no prizes for guessing why we have seen a strategic switch from austerity to profligacy: there is a national election due in 2014.
summary: Finance Minister P. Chidambaram's 2012-13 fiscal deficit was within his target due to a decrease in government spending. However, in his budget, he plans to increase public spending faster than expected, indicating a strategic shift from austerity to profligacy due to a 2014 national election.

headline: Tax raids on Shamken group
article: new delhi: the income tax raids at sainik farms and 26 other places in delhi and adjoining areas against the shamken group of companies has reportedly exposed rs 75 crore in tax evasion. the searches, which began on wednesday, were still continuing. according to sources, shamken group is engaged in manufacturing and processing textile fabrics, coir mattresses and garments. the group also does job work for branded garments companies like lacoste and van heusen. the searches showed the group was engaged in massive over-invoicing of exports to launder money generated through unaccounted sales. "the group had floated dummy companies in dubai and the cis countries to facilitate the process. by resorting to over-invoicing, the group had claimed higher duty drawback than was due and exemption under the 80 hhc of the income tax act," a senior official said. sources said the searches yielded share certificates worth about rs 15 crore from a dda flat in delhi; rs 15 lakh has been seized and eight bank lockers sealed. the sources claimed duplicate challan books were found at the shamken factory at noida, where work for branded items is being done. "we have proof that this company was involved in unaccounted marketing of branded items." a preliminary discrepancy of rs 60 crore in the stocks located at the company's various factories has been found. "however, a clear picture will emerge when the searches are completed at all the factories and godowns of the company," said a source.
summary: Income tax raids on Shamken Group of companies, including searches at Sainik Farms and 26 other locations in Delhi and adjoining areas, have reportedly uncovered Rs 75 crore in tax evasion. Shamken Group is involved in textile fabric manufacturing, coir mattresses, and garment processing, providing job work for brands like Lacoste and Van Heusen. The searches revealed a scheme involving over-invoicing of exports to launder money, with dummy companies in Dubai and CIS countries. Share certificates worth around Rs 15 crore were found, and a preliminary stock discrepancy of Rs 60 crore was detected in various factories.

headline: 2 militants shot dead in Manipur
article: imphal: two militants were killed by assam rifles in a gun battle at salungpham village in manipur's thoubal district on wednesday, police source said. the gun battle lasted about four hours, the sources said, adding one hand grenade, one modified g-3 rifle, one wireless set and seven empty cases were recovered from the spot
summary: In Manipur's Thoubal district, two militants were killed in a four-hour gun battle with Assam Rifles. The security forces recovered a hand grenade, a modified G-3 rifle, a wireless set, and seven empty cases from the site.

headline: I am hoping to play better than last year: Hyeon Chung
article:
At the 2018 Australian Open, when the then 21-year-old Hyeon Chung reached the last four, he became the youngest Grand Slam semifinalist since Marin Cilic in 2010, also at Melbourne. That Chung had beaten both Alexander Zverev and Novak Djokovic en route made the world sit up and take notice.

The South Korean couldn’t build on the result, especially in the second half of the season, ravaged as he was by a string of injuries. But as he steps into 2019 at the Tata Open Maharashtra, he was quietly confident.
summary: A young south Korean tennis player Hyeon Chung to give his best in the next upcoming tounaments

headline: Madhavrao Scindia dead
article:
New Delhi, September 30
Congress leader and scion of Gwalior royal family Madhavrao Scindia along with seven others including four journalists, died when the private plane carrying them crashed in a paddy field near Motta Railway station in Mainpuri district, 200 km from Kanpur.

Mr Scindia was to address a public meeting at Kanpur this evening as part of Privartan Yatras being organised by the Congress in Uttar Pradesh.

The 10-seater VT-6FF plane belonging to Jindal group, carrying eight persons, caught fire after it nose-dived into a field.

Among those killed were Mr Scindia’s secretary Rupinder Singh, and journalists — Anju Sharma (Hindustan Times), Sanjiv Sinha (The Indian Express), Ranjan Jha (Aaj Tak) and Gopal Bisht (cameraman). Plane’s pilot Ray Gautam and co-pilot Ritu were also killed.


Home Minister L.K.Advani today said bodies of all eight victims of the air crash had been extricated. The body of the eighth victim, Rupinder Singh, private secretary to the late leader, could be recovered about four hours after the crash as it was trapped between the wings of the aircraft, Mr Advani said.

The public meeting which Mr Scindia was to address this afternoon was cancelled abruptly while speeches were being made.

According to Civil Aviation Minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain, the plane left New Delhi at 12.49 pm and was to reach Kanpur at 1.50 pm. However, it lost contact with the Lucknow Air Traffic Control at 1.30 pm.

Uttar Pradesh Principal Secretary (Home) Naresh Dayal said that senior civil and police officials had rushed to the site of the mishap. Inclement weather and poor visibility appeared to have been among the causes of the crash.

Senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar and Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dixit, who were to accompany Mr Scindia to the Kanpur rally, had an escape as they did not board the plane for personal reasons. Mr Scindia’s son, who was in Mumbai, is reaching Delhi.

A pall of gloom descended on Mr Scindia’s Safdarjung residence and the AICC office here after the news of the mishap landed. Congress president Sonia Gandhi, her daughter Priyanka Vadra, Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dixit were among party leaders who rushed reached Mr Scindia’s house.

Home Minister L.K. Advani, Minister for Law, Justice and Company Affairs Arun Jaitley also visited Mr Scindia’s residence.

Meanwhile, the Director General Civil Aviation has ordered an inquiry into the mishap.
summary:
Eight people, including four journalists and Congress leader Madhavrao Scindia, perished when a private jet with them crashed in a rice field close to Motta Railway station in the Mainpuri district, 200 km from Kanpur. Others who died are Mr Scindia’s secretary Rupinder Singh, and journalists — Anju Sharma (Hindustan Times), Sanjiv Sinha (The Indian Express), Ranjan Jha (Aaj Tak) , Gopal Bisht (cameraman), plane’s pilot Ray Gautam and co-pilot Ritu.
 Mani Shankar Aiyar, a senior member of the Congress, and Sheila Dixit, the chief minister of Delhi, escaped for not having boarded the plane for private reasons. L.K. Advani, the minister of the interior, and Arun Jaitley, the minister of law, justice, and corporate affairs, paid a visit to Scindia's home. The Director General Civil Aviation has ordered an inquiry into the mishap.

headline: What Chhetri & Co. can expect in their Asian Cup opener
article:
I know about 10 players from this Thai squad on a personal level. Many of them are playing at Buriram while some have played here previously and moved on. They are a very tight-knit side; they spend a lot of time together, especially the boys in and around Bangkok.

There’s a complete contrast between the former coach (Kiatisuk ‘Zico’ Senamuang) and the current coach (Milovan Rajevac, who took over in 2017).
summary: the indian team will have an advantage over many teams like the thai in the upcoming ASEAN games

headline: Open defecation continues unabated
article:
New research on the impact of the Swachh Bharat Mission in the rural parts of four northern States shows that while open defecation has fallen and toilet ownership has increased, the percentage of people who owned toilets but continued to defecate in the open has remained unchanged between 2014 and 2018.

This indicates that the Mission has been more successful at toilet construction than at driving behaviour change, according to the authors of the study, being released by the research institute for compassionate economics (r.i.c.e.) and the Accountability Initiative of the Centre for Policy Research next week.
summary: Gov. doing a great work in the mission of Swach Bharat Mission like in some northern states

headline: Smartphone apps are helping researchers detect depression
article:
Rising rates of depression in teens and young adults have prompted researchers to ask a provocative question: could the same devices that some people blame for contributing to tech-age angst also be used to detect it?

The idea has sparked a race to develop apps that warn of impending mental health crises. Call it smartphone psychiatry or child psychology 2.0.
summary: to fight against depression in young generation researchers have developed apps to detect it

headline: Hold Pak accountable: PM
article:
New Delhi, September 30
Prime Minister Atal Behari Vajpayee today asserted that Pakistan must be held accountable for continuing to sponsor terrorism in India. He said the government would intensify diplomatic initiatives to remind the leading nations of the international anti-terror coalition partners to redeem their pledge in this direction.

“While our security forces will have to continue their good work on the ground to get the better of militancy, we will intensify our diplomatic initiatives to remind the leading nations...to combat and defeat terrorism everywhere, irrespective of the cause it espouses,” Mr Vajpayee said. He added, “Which means, Pakistan must be held accountable for its continued sponsorship of terrorism in India.”

He was speaking at the conference of DGPs and IGPs at Vigyan Bhavan, here.

Stating that terrorism had failed to find any place in the conscience of human society and that what had been rejected by society could not have an enduring life, the Prime Minister said “those who continue to support it (terrorism) will doubtlessly get isolated from the rest of humanity.”

However, Mr Vajpayee pointed out that before terrorism actually died and disappeared from the world as a political instrument, it would continue to commit many more depredations.

“Therefore, we have to become more vigilant against this menace, and more determined to stamp it out,” the Prime Minister said while lauding the role of security forces in tackling militancy in the country.

The terrorist attack on India’s Parliament House, preceded by the attack on the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly building in Srinagar, the carnage of innocent men, women and children in Kaluchak, Kasim Nagar and, most recently, the bloody sacrilege at the Akshardham temple in Gandhinagar — all these were signs of our enemy’s desperation, he said.

“Needless to say, a good part of this desperation owes to the growing successes gained by our security forces in turning the heat on terrorist outfits and infiltration from across the border...I would like to specifically recognise the signal contribution of the police in conducting successful anti-terrorist operations,” he said.

Referring to Jammu and Kashmir, the Prime Minister exhorted confidence that the state would leave the nightmare of militancy behind and return to peace, normalcy and development.

“We have seen it happen in Punjab, where the police and security forces, with the cooperation of the people, ultimately overcame the challenge of militancy,” he said.

Mr Vajpayee said the manner in which the people of Jammu and Kashmir were braving terror and participating in the poll once again demonstrated that the bullet could not defeat the ballot in a democracy.

“In Jammu and Kashmir, we had pledged to hold free and fair elections to the state Assembly. The polling in the first two rounds so far has borne out this commitment. There was a widespread fear psychosis created by terrorist organisations backed by Pakistan. There were killings of candidates and political activists, intimidation of voters, calls for poll boycott. However, the people of the state braved all this to once again demonstrate that the bullet cannot defeat the ballot in a democracy,” he said.

He added that he would be failing in his duty if he did not compliment the state police, various paramilitary forces, the Army and intelligence agencies for doing a difficult and challenging job well.
summary: In reference to terrorist attack on India’s Parliament House, preceded by the attack on the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly building in Srinagar, the carnage of innocent men, women and children in Kaluchak, Kasim Nagar and, most recently, the bloody sacrilege at the Akshardham temple in Gandhinagar, Prime Minister Atal Behari Vajpayee asserted that Pakistan must be held accountable for continuing to sponsor terrorism in India. He was speaking at the conference of DGPs and IGPs at Vigyan Bhavan and lauded lauding the role of security forces in tackling militancy in India. He said the manner in which the people of Jammu and Kashmir were braving terror and participating in the poll once again demonstrated that the bullet could not defeat the ballot in a democracy.

headline: World Bank Group President Jim Yong Kim to step down on February 1
article:
In a surprise move, World Bank President Jim Yong Kim on Monday announced that he will step down from his position on February 1 - much before the end of his term in 2022.

Kim, 58, has been in this position for over six years now.
summary: world bank president to step down on feb 1 from his position

headline: India secures extradition of bookie Sanjeev Chawla
article:
India secured another legal victory in the U.K. as a judge at the Westminster Magistrates’ Court has said that the extradition of alleged bookie Sanjeev Chawla can proceed, and referred the case to Home Secretary Sajid Javid for a final decision.

The development came at a procedural hearing on Monday before District Judge Rebecca Crane.
summary: UK judge at the westminster magistrates court that the extradition of alleged bookie Sanjeev Chawla can proceed , it is an legal victory for india

headline: Navy’s new air base in north of Port Blair
article:
Later this month, the Indian Navy will commission a new airbase 100 miles north of Port Blair in the strategically located Andaman and Nicobar islands.

“The base, INS Kohassa , will be commissioned by Navy Chief Admiral Sunil Lanba on January 24,” spokesperson Capt D.K. Sharma said.
summary: Indian Navy will commision a new airbase near port Blair located in A&N islands

headline: AP's SOS for more power
article: NEW DELHI, Sept. 30. Andhra Pradesh is seeking more power from the Ramagundam super thermal station in view of the severe drought it is facing. The Chairman of the Andhra. Pradesh State Electricity Board Mr. N. Tata Rao today telephoned the Chairman of the National Thermal Power Corporation in this connection. The Chairman of the NTPC, Mr. M. L. Shishoo told Mr. Tata Rao. that the third unit of 200 MW in the Ramagundam complex had been declared under commercial operation and if adequate coal supplies were maintained. there should be no difficulty in power generation. Mr. Shishoo told reporters this afternoon that NTPC was aware t that the period October March will be 'critical' for the entire Southern region in view of the severe drought in the region. A basic problem faced by the NTPC, he said was the unsteady coal supplies from the pits, NTPC units had to operate even with coal stocks of three days and less when normally a stock of four weeks should be available. Mr. Shishoo said he could not blame any particular agency for the tardy coal supplies bekause drilling mining, loading and trans- port were involved in this. 'In so far as we are concerned we have built up the infrastructures for un- loading as well as handling in our plants, he said and added that most of these supplies from the pierheads to the station were by merry-go-round railways. Mr. Shishoo admitted that the NTPC was also facing the problems of mounting arrears from the State electricity boards to wards power charges and also non-supply of powers to those States which had a share in the Central generation. 'We are trying to sort out these matters he said. According to the NTPC chief, the total arrears from the electricity boards amounted to Rs 161.54 crores of which the outstanding from Andhra Pradesh amounted to Rs 23.16 crores which was the highest among the beneficiary electricity boards linked with Ramagundam. The dues from Karnataka amounted to Rs 10.93 crores and those from Tamil Nadu Rs 4.83 crores.
summary: Andhra Pradesh is urgently requesting increased power supply from the Ramagundam super thermal station due to the severe drought it is currently experiencing. The Chairman of the Andhra Pradesh State Electricity Board, Mr. N. Tata Rao, contacted the Chairman of the National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) Mr. M. L. Shishoo for this purpose who assured that the third unit of 200 MW at the Ramagundam complex is fully operational and can continue power generation with consistent coal supplies. NTPC is aware of the critical period between October and March due to the severe drought in the Southern region, and they face challenges with unstable coal supplies and mounting arrears from electricity boards.

headline: Guru Nanak Jayanthi
article: Sikh devotees across the country marked the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak on Nov. 2, 2009. The day was marked by religious observances at the Golden Temple in Amritsar, Sikhism's holiest shrine, and at gurudwaras all over India. Sikhism was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak.
summary: The above article says that Sikh devotees nationwide celebrated Guru Nanak's birth anniversary on November 2, 2009. The Golden Temple in Amritsar, Sikhism's holiest shrine, and gurudwaras across India held religious observances to commemorate the occasion. Sikhism, established in the 15th century, was founded by Guru Nanak.

headline: Delivery of justice to 1984 anti-Sikh riots victims started only after 2014: Amit Shah
article:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said justice to the victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots started being delivered only after the Narendra Modi government assumed office in 2014.
Addressing a programme of the Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee here, Shah said 300 cases related to the 1984 riots were reopened and compensation of Rs 5 lakh was given to the family of each of the victims after 2014."No one can forget the riots of 1984. No one was punished in those riots until the Modi government assumed office. Many inquiry commissions were formed but did not yield results. But Modi formed SIT, reopened 300 cases and started sending those who were guilty to jail,” he said.The home minister said that after so many years, the process of giving compensation of Rs 5 lakh to the kin of the 3,328 victims was done by the Modi government.Paying glowing tributes to the Sikh gurus and the Sikh community, he said the Sikhs move forward taking both religion and karma equally and when it is an issue of sacrificing one's life for religion, a true Sikh never looks back.He said that from the days of independence struggle to the security of the country now, the sacrifice of Sikh brothers is unparalleled.
Shah paid tributes to the Sikh gurus and said: "I bow my head to the Guru tradition of the Sikh religion. Guru tradition of 10 generations of Sikh Panth has set before the world an excellent example of struggle and sacrifice against injustice and barbarity before the invaders."
summary: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that justice for victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots began after the Narendra Modi government took office in 2014. After reopening 300 cases, the Modi government sent those guilty to jail. Shah paid tribute to the Sikh community, stating that Sikhs prioritize both religion and karma, and that their sacrifices are unparalleled. He praised the Guru tradition of the Sikh religion, which has set an excellent example of struggle and sacrifice against injustice and barbarity.

headline: SC modifies order in case against RCom chief
article:
The Supreme Court has revised its January 7 order in a contempt petition filed by Ericsson India against Reliance Communication Ltd. (RCom) chairman Anil Dhirubhai Ambani to clarify that “personal appearance of the alleged contemnor(s) is not dispensed with” in the next hearing scheduled five weeks later.

The earlier version of the order had read “personal appearance of the alleged contemnor(s) is not dispensed with.” On January 7, a Bench of Justice Rohinton F. Nariman and Justice Vineet Saran had asked Mr. Ambani and other respondents to file a reply in four weeks.
summary: SC modifies order against reliance filed by Ericsson India

headline: Centre aims for 20% cut in air pollution by 2024
article:
The Centre has launched a programme to reduce particulate matter (PM) pollution by 20-30% in at least 102 cities by 2024.

The National Clean Air Programme (NCAP), which was formally unveiled on Thursday, is envisaged as a scheme to provide the States and the Centre with a framework to combat air pollution. “This is our war against pollution across the length and breadth of the country,” said A.K. Jain, a senior official in the Union Environment Ministry.
summary: programme launched by centre to reduce air pollution by 20-30% in atleast 102 cities by 2024

headline: Dhoni, Gambhir shortlisted for ICC awards
article:
Indian skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni and opener Gautam Gambhir got twin nominations, while Yuvraj Singh and Virender Sehwag were shortlisted for the ODI Player of the Year category of the ICC Annual Awards to be announced on October 1 in Johannesburg.
Gambhir, Dhoni, Australian pacer Mitchell Johnson and Englishman Andrew Strauss have been shortlisted for the Sir Garfield Sobers trophy for Cricketer of the Year after voting by an independent 25-member academy.
summary: The article discusses Indian cricket captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni and opener Gautam Gambhir received double nominations for the ICC Annual Awards, including the ODI Player of the Year category. Yuvraj Singh and Virender Sehwag were also shortlisted for the ODI Player of the Year award. Additionally, Gambhir, Dhoni, Australian bowler Mitchell Johnson, and English cricketer Andrew Strauss were named as contenders for the prestigious Sir Garfield Sobers trophy for Cricketer of the Year following voting by a 25-member academy. The award winners were set to be announced on October 1 in Johannesburg.

headline: Saved from marriage in the nick of time
article: Six child marriages were stopped in Dharmapuri district on Tuesday by the district administration. The marriages were planned on Wednesday in different villages.  District Collector P. Amutha said in a statement on Tuesday night said that she was informed over phone about the impending child marriages. On the basis of available information, she took swift action to stop them from taking place.
summary: According to the above article, the district administration in Dharmapuri halted six planned child marriages scheduled for the following day in various villages. District Collector P. Amutha acted swiftly to prevent these child marriages upon receiving information about them via phone. The interventions were made to ensure the protection and welfare of the minors involved.

headline: Two Convicts killed in jail break bid
article: VISAKHAPATNAM, Apr. 3. Two convicts were killed and at least 18 other convicts were severely injured in the Central Jail here best evening when jail guards opened fire on few hundred convicts attempting to break open the gates and run away. The trouble, it is learnt. started With five or six convicts fighting among themselves The jail warders promptly intervened to restore peace in the jail. Then all of sudden, it was alleged several of convicts lodged in the fall beat the warders and tried to escape from the jail. The jail guards then opened fire as a result of which two convicts were killed and at least 15 others Injured. The injured were later admitted into the King George Hospital in Visakhapatnam. According to an official report of the incident received in Hyderabad this morning, 38 convicts received injuries. The Deputy inspector Doctor-General of Police and Joint Collector visited the jail.
summary: In Visakhapatnam's Central Jail, two convicts were killed and 18 severely injured as jail guards fired on hundreds of inmates attempting to escape. The incident began with a fight among several convicts, leading to violence against warders, prompting the guards to open fire. A total of 38 convicts were injured in the incident.

headline: Sonia gives up Press Club of India membership
article: Congress president Sonia Gandhi has given up honorary membership of the Press Club of India (PCI) which was extended to her on August 21. She returned the membership card after warring groups of PCI tried to politicise the issue. In a letter addressed to the Press Club, Congress media department chairman, Janardan Dwivedi, said: “In view of the ongoing controversy in PCI, Ms. Gandhi is giving up her honorary membership with immediate effect.”
summary: The above article says that congress president Sonia Gandhi has decided to relinquish her honorary membership of the Press Club of India (PCI), which was granted to her on August 21. The decision came after internal disputes within the PCI attempted to politicize the matter. Janardan Dwivedi, Congress media department chairman, conveyed in a letter to the Press Club that, due to the controversy within PCI, Ms. Gandhi was terminating her honorary membership immediately.

headline: BNCA to host programme on unmanned aerial vehicles
article:
The Maharshi Karve Stree Shikshan Sanstha's Dr. Bhanuben Nanavati college of crchitecture for women will host a national level quality improvement program on unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) on February 3 and 4 from 10 am to 5pm. The two day national conference will explore various opportunities and use of UAV in various built environment applications.
A statement issued by the college said that, the program will be graced by Air Commodore Ranbir Singh Dagar, Suresh Shahadadpuri, director, Enercomp Solutions, Ahmedabad, Prathap NM, young scientist and CEO, Aerowhale Space and Technologies, Karnataka, Anurag Kashyap, principal, BNCA among many others.
The key highlights of the conference include revolution in the survey industry from theodolites to drones, scenario of drones and its application in India and its adaptability, potential applications of drones and satellite imagery incorporation, DGCA regulations for use of UAV, legal roadmap and future use of drone in various sectors and building drones through e-waste and its usage.
summary: The Dr. Bhanuben Nanavati College of Architecture for Women in Pune will be hosting a national-level program on unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV). The two-day conference will focus on exploring the various opportunities and applications of UAVs in the built environment. Key speakers include Air Commodore Ranbir Singh Dagar, Suresh Shahadadpuri, Prathap NM, and Anurag Kashyap. Topics to be discussed include the revolution of drones in the survey industry, the regulatory framework for UAV use, and future applications of drones in various sectors.

headline: Champawat police arrests smugglers with leopard skin
article: Champawat police arrested three people with a leopard skin on Saturday night at Banbasa on Nepal Border. Police suspect the skin was being smuggled to Nepal. After receiving a tip-off, Champawat Police, which was searching vehicles on Gadigoth – Banbasa road, stopped a car. Police recovered the hind skin of a leopard from the car, said superintendent of police (SP) Champawat Lokeshwar Singh.
