exaggerated. So here also I think that while clearly it is something
which would have a huge and a detrimental impact on Indian companies,
it is not as if this is the only yardstick on which they or this is
the only route on which they depend for their business.
A lot of the companies, in fact, have been witnessing a change in the
composition of their workforce not necessarily because of immigration
but more because of business dynamics. Today, companies are being
asked to deliver more in terms of business value, more in terms of
organisational transformation of the clients and not just in terms of
an IT deliverable or for network or a management of a system or
writing a software code.
So the demand of the moment of the client is to use technology but
deliver a business value, a mix of skills that you tends to include a
lot of domain people which typically would be people who are hired
locally because – a) that is not a skill which is in short supply
and b) that is a part of the mix that is required. So this ratio of
visa based workers to local workers has been changing because the
nature of the business itself has been changing.
So 50 per cent people having to depend more than 50 per cent on visa
workers is also something which is more relevant for the era which is
just behind us where they were asked to deliver more on technology
services. Those skills were not available in the US and therefore
there was little option but to depend more on visa workers. Now that
things are changing, this ratio is coming down anyway and in this
definition once company is using less than 50 per cent of visa workers
and they are not covered by this legislation.
So this is the perspective I think which we need to keep in mind and
this transition is happening at its own pace and this kind of
legislation as I said is a long road, the US already has shown a
preference for comprehensive immigration as opposed to this kind of
piecemeal immigration, so let us see.
Connect with Experts - Wealth creation made easy
summary: Data shows there will be over a million unfilled IT jobs in the US by 2018 due to a lack of skilled workers. A proposed bill to restrict Indian companies from hiring H1-B visa holders would negatively impact them as many rely heavily on foreign hiring. However, the IT sector is adapting to changing demands by hiring more local staff and focusing on transformational work over just code writing.

headline: China's military establishes first national security think tank
article:
Synopsis
CHINA'S PLA ESTABLISHED ITS FIRST THINK TANK FOR NATIONAL SECURITY
STUDIES WITH AN AIM TO INTEGRATE MILITARY AND CIVILIAN RESOURCES TO
PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE CENTRAL GOVT.
PTI
BEIJING: China's People's Liberation Army today established its first
think tank for national security studies with an aim to integrate
military and civilian resources to provide advice to the central
government. 
The research center for national security studies, set up at the
National Defense University of the People's Liberation Army (PLA),
will promote interdisciplinary studies, provide advice for the central
government and military commission, issue annual reports, and hold
regular high-end seminars. 
Ren Tianyou, vice head of the center's leader group and director of
the university's strategic teaching and research division, said the
university will integrate military and civilian resources to provide
advice on policy. 
The center will be operated under guidance of the central government
and the PLA headquarters, state-run Xinhua news agency reported. 
The think tank is the latest result of China's focus on national
security. 
 Since 2013, the country has also established the National Security
Commission, issued a national security strategy guideline and adopted
the National Security Law.
summary: China's military established its first think tank for national security studies at the National Defense University. It aims to integrate military and civilian experts to provide policy advice to China's central government and military commission on security issues. The think tank reflects China's increased focus on national security strategies and policy.

headline: Gujarat lost 66 lions in one year
article:
THE GUJARAT GOVERNMENT HAS ACCEPTED ON THE FLOOR OF THE STATE ASSEMBLY
THAT 66 LIONS HAD DIED IN THE PAST ONE YEAR AND, OF THESE, 55 HAD DIED
OF NATURAL CAUSES.
TNN
AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat government has accepted on the floor of the
state assembly that 66 lions had died in the past one year and, of
these, 55 had died of natural causes.
In reply to a question of Una MLA Punja Vansh, the forest and
environment minister Ganpat Vasava, said that between May 1, 2013 and
April 31, 2014, a total of 66 lions had died in Amreli, Gir Somnath
and Junagadh districts. Of these, 55 had died natural deaths.
The minister further stated that of the 66 lions which had died, 29
were cubs, 16 were lionesses and the rest 21 were lions. The maximum
number of lion deaths - 33 - had occurred in Amreli. Gir Somnath was
next with 19 deaths and the third was Junagadh where 14 big cats had
died. Of the 33 lions which had died in Amreli, 14 were cubs and 13
male lions, said the minister.
Meanwhile, officials in the forest department said that the 29 lion
cubs which had died were in the age group of 0-2 years. They had lost
their lives either during fighting within a pride, while the big cats
were capturing territory or had been devoured by other lions. Citing a
study, he said that only around 56% cubs survive till the age of three
when they leave their pride in search of new territory and pride.
The high survival rate in Gujarat's Gir sanctuary was highlighted in a
study conducted by experts from Wildlife Institute of India, titled
'Reproductive Strategy and Behaviour of Male Asiatic Lions.' The study
also reveals that the survival rate of cubs is lowest in the first
year of birth but gradually increases in the second and third year.
 The next lion census will be conducted in May 2015.
summary: The Gujarat government acknowledged in the state assembly that 66 lions had died in the past year in areas surrounding the Gir sanctuary, with 55 dying of natural causes. The majority were cubs, underscoring the high mortality rate for young lions due to attacks within prides and territory disputes between males.

headline: Global economy to pick up pace next year: Mohamed El-Erian, Pacific Investment Management
article:
MOHAMED EL-ERIAN, THE NEWPORT BEACH, CALIFORNIA-BASED ASSET MANAGER
SAID THE WORLD ECONOMY IS LIKELY TO EXPAND 2.5 PC TO 3 PC IN 2014.
Bloomberg
The world economy will enjoy faster growth next year, as improvement
in the US and the euro area offsets slowdowns in China and Japan, said
Mohamed El-Erian, chief executive officer of Pacific Investment
Management Co.
The Newport Beach, California-based asset manager said the world
economy is likely to expand 2.5 per cent to 3 per cent in 2014, up
from 2.3 per cent this year. US growth will accelerate to 2.25 per
cent to 2.75 per cent from 1.8 per cent.
“The US economy is healing,” he said in an interview yesterday.
“Household balance sheets are in a better place.”
Pimco, which manages $1.97 trillion in assets, sees Chinese growth
slowing to 6.75 per cent to 7.25 per cent from 7.8 per cent over the
last 12 months, according to El-Erian. Japan’s economy will expand 1
per cent to 1.5 per cent, down from 2.4 per cent in 2013.
He said it’s virtually certain the Federal Reserve will begin
moderating its asset purchases by the end of March, with a 50-50
chance of a move next week. He said the Fed is likely to couple any
tapering announcement with a cut in the interest rate it pays on
banks’ excess reserves and a strengthened commitment to keep
monetary policy easy for an extended period.
 The euro-area’s economy will expand by 0.25 per cent to 0.75 per
cent in 2014, after contracting 0.4 per cent this year, he said.
 JOB MARKET
 The Pimco executive said he was heartened by the broad-based
improvement in the US job market last month. Payrolls increased by
203,000, while the unemployment rate fell to 7 per cent from 7.3 per
cent in October, the Labor Department reported on Dec. 6. The
employment-to-population rate also rose while hourly earnings
increased.
“The breadth of improvement was notable,” El-Erian said.
The Fed’s “hyperactive” monetary policy has given the US economy
time to mend after its deepest recession since the Great Depression,
according to El-Erian.
The Fed is buying $85 billion of bonds per month. It has also promised
to keep its target for the federal funds rate near zero at least as
long as unemployment remains above 6.5 per cent and forecast inflation
is not above 2.5 per cent.
“You’re looking at a transition where the Fed will remain engaged
but will alter its policy mix,” by gradually reducing its bond
buying while strengthening its forward guidance on short-term interest
rates, he said.
He said he expects the Fed to cut the 0.25 per cent rate it pays
commercial banks on excess reserves as part of that transition. While
such a move wouldn’t have a “dramatic impact,” it would
underscore the Fed’s commitment to keeping rates low, he said.
MUSHROOMING RESERVES
Banks’ reserves have mushroomed as the Fed purchased securities from
them in its bid to lower long-term interest rates. Banks currently
have more than $2 trillion in extra cash at the Fed, according to data
from the central bank.
summary: The chief executive of Pimco asset management said the world economy is likely to expand 2.5-3% in 2014, up from 2.3% this year, as improvements in the US and Europe offset slowdowns in China and Japan. He believes the Fed will begin tapering bond purchases by end-March and cut interest on bank reserves to underscore its easy monetary policy commitment.

headline: Western Railway (WR) will be able to open sixth line on a 12km stretch between Khar and Goregaon by March 2023 and the entire corridor by 2025.
article:
MUMBAI: Western Railway (WR) will be able to open sixth line on a 12km stretch between Khar and Goregaon by March 2023 and the entire corridor by 2025.
Once the entire sixth line is opened by 2025, authorities may be able to increase the number of WR services by up to 20%. WR's general manager Ashok Kumar Misra said, "We have set a target to open the Khar-Goregaon stretch by March 2023."
At present, a fifth line exists from Borivli to Santacruz and from Mahim to Mumbai Central. The missing link between Mahim and Khar is due to a lack of space. Railways has now decided to redesign the alignment for the Harbour line in this portion to create space for the fifth and sixth lines. Work under a Resettlement and Rehabilitation scheme in coordination with the MMRDA is likely to remove encroachers on other stretches, especially Borivli, Goregaon-Andheri, and Vile Parle.
summary: Western Railway is set to open a new railway line between Khar and Goregaon by March 2023 and the entire corridor by 2025. This could lead to a 20% increase in train services. Currently, there is a fifth line from Borivli to Santacruz and from Mahim to Mumbai Central, but a missing link between Mahim and Khar is a problem. To address this, the railways will redesign the alignment for the Harbour line to make space for the fifth and sixth lines. They are also working on a Resettlement and Rehabilitation scheme to remove encroachers in various areas like Borivli, Goregaon-Andheri, and Vile Parle in coordination with MMRDA.

headline: Western Railway’s sixth line likely to open by 2023, services to increase by 20 per cent
article:
The Railways have already deposited Rs 11.51 crore in 2015 for the resettlement and rehabilitation of 14 structures in Borivali and 3 in Vile Parle. (Express file photo)
The Western Railway (WR) is constructing a sixth track between Borivali and Mumbai Central in two phases. The first stretch of the Khar-Goregaon track is expected to open by March 2023; whereas the entire corridor is scheduled to open by 2025, WR General Manager Ashok Kumar Misra said on Friday.

Once the sixth track is opened for operations, it will increase the number of train services by 20 per cent, the Western Railway said. However, encroachments on railway land need to be cleared, which the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is taking care of, Misra said.

At present, there are five lines on which daily train services are run from Borivali to Santacruz and from Mahim to Mumbai Central. There is a missing link between Mahim and Khar due to a lack of space. The Railways have redesigned the alignment for the Harbour Line in this portion to create space for the fifth and sixth lines.
summary: The Western Railway is building a sixth track between Borivali and Mumbai Central in two phases. The first part, from Khar to Goregaon, should be ready by March 2023, and the entire route is expected to be open by 2025. When the new track is operational, it can increase train services by 20%, but there's a problem with encroachments on railway land. The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is working to clear these obstructions. Currently, there are five train lines from Borivali to Santacruz and from Mahim to Mumbai Central, but there's a gap between Mahim and Khar due to space issues. The Railways are changing the alignment of the Harbour Line to make room for the fifth and sixth lines.

headline: Mumbai: Much-awaited Khar-Goregaon railway stretch to open by 2023, passenger count to see 20 percent jump
article:
Mumbai: The first phase of the Borivli-Mumbai Central project of the Western Railway (WR), the Khar-Goregaon stretch, will be operational by March 2023. Phase two— the Goregaon-Borivli section— will be opened by March 2024 and the entire Mahim to Borivli corridor will be functional by March 2025, the railway authorities said. With the completion of the sixth line, the WR is expected to see a 20 percent jump in passenger count.
"The work is going on and we have set a target to open the Khar-Goregaon stretch by March 2023," WR's general manager Ashok Kumar Misra said. However, the project faces some hurdles with regard to land acquisition and resettlement. The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is already working on it, Misra added.

Some settlements and encroachments in Borivli, Goregaon-Andheri, and Vile Parle areas need to be cleared for the project and the Railways have already deposited Rs 11.51 crore with the MMRDA in 2015 to start the resettlement and rehabilitation. However, some locals wanted to be relocated to the western suburbs only and they had not accepted the alternate allotment of tenements offered at Mankhurd. Of the 358 who have received allotments between Khar and Borivali, only 260 have accepted and vacated the space.

Currently, the WR services run on the fifth line from Borivali to Santacruz and from Mahim to Mumbai Central. The railway was unable to connect Mahim and Khar due to a lack of space. However, with a redesign of the alignment, the WR was able to find space for the fifth and sixth lines.

Meanwhile, Western Railway officials said there has been an increase in suicides on tracks. According to Misra, the increasing number of suicides has been disturbing and also affects train operations. The numbers were five in 2019, eight in 2020, 11 in 2021 and 18 in 2022.
summary: The Western Railway is working on a project to add a sixth train line between Borivli and Mumbai Central. The Khar-Goregaon part of this project is set to open by March 2023, with the Goregaon-Borivli section planned for March 2024. The whole Mahim to Borivli corridor should be operational by March 2025. This expansion could lead to a 20% increase in passenger numbers. However, there are challenges related to land acquisition and resettlement, with some locals still needing to be relocated. To make space for these new lines, the railway has redesigned the alignment of the Harbour Line. Unfortunately, there has been a disturbing increase in suicides on the tracks, affecting train operations. The numbers rose from 5 in 2019 to 18 in 2022.

headline: 3 things PM Modi, Google CEO Sundar Pichai discussed during their virtual call
article:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacted with Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai virtually and discussed the company’s plans to participate in expanding the electronics manufacturing ecosystem in India.

From UPI to made in India Chromebooks, Pichai emphasised Google’s commitment to contribute to the development trajectory of India.

Chromebooks in India
Modi appreciated Google’s partnership with HP to manufacture Chromebooks in India. Recently, HP and Google announced a partnership under which the companies will manufacture Chromebooks in India.

The partnership will not only push the companies’ joint vision to support the digital education ecosystem in the country but also provide more students a chance to enhance their learning by means of affordable, safe, and high-quality computing devices.


The Chromebooks will be manufactured at the Flex Facility near Chennai, where HP has been producing a range of laptops and desktops since August 2020.

Fintech operations centre in Gujarat
Pichai also announced the opening of our global fintech operation centre in Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT) in Gandhinagar.

"It was an honour to meet PM Modi during the historic visit to the US. We shared with the prime minister that Google is investing $10 billion in India's digitisation fund. We are announcing the opening of our global fintech operation centre in GIFT City, Gujarat," Pichai said.

Modi welcomed Google’s plans to open its global fintech operations centre in Gujarat.

AI and UPI
Modi acknowledged Google’s 100 languages initiative and encouraged efforts to make AI tools available in Indian languages. He also encouraged Google to work on AI tools for good governance.

The PM also invited Google to contribute to the upcoming global partnership on the AI summit, which will be hosted by India in December 2023 in New Delhi.

Pichai also informed the PM about the company’s plans to improve financial inclusion in India by leveraging the strength and reach of GPay and UPI.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a virtual meeting with Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Google and Alphabet. They discussed Google's plans to boost electronics manufacturing in India. Pichai highlighted Google's commitment to India's development, including making Chromebooks in India through a partnership with HP. These Chromebooks will support digital education and provide affordable, safe, and high-quality computing devices for students. Pichai also announced the opening of a global fintech operation center in Gujarat. Modi welcomed this initiative and encouraged Google to work on AI tools in Indian languages and for good governance. He also invited Google to participate in the upcoming global partnership on the AI summit in India. Pichai shared Google's plans to enhance financial inclusion in India through GPay and UPI.

headline: PM Modi, Google chief Sundar Pichai discuss firm’s manufacturing expansion
article:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday virtually interacted with Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai and discussed Google’s plan to expand its electronics manufacturing capabilities in India.

According to an official statement issued by the Indian government, the Prime Minister appreciated Google’s partnership with Hewlett Packard (HP) to manufacture Chromebooks in India.

Google recently started producing its Chromebook laptops in India through a partnership forged with HP, in a major boost to the country’s electronics manufacturing ambitions.

The move puts Google among the most high-profile names to kickstart manufacturing in India as companies across the world look to diversify their supply chains in the wake of turbulent geopolitical times.

The Chromebooks — laptops that run on Google’s Chrome operating system — will be manufactured at the Flex facility near Chennai, where HP has been producing a range of laptops and desktops since August 2020. The production has started from October 2 and will cater to the demand for affordable PCs in India, mainly from the education sector.

Chromebooks are among the most popular laptops used in educational institutions worldwide, but are yet to find mainstream traction in India, where laptops running on the Windows operating system continue to rule the roost.

The move will help Google compete more effectively with Windows computers from companies such as Dell, Lenovo, and Asus.

While India has a big domestic demand for laptops and computers, almost all of it is currently being fulfilled by imports from China, something New Delhi wants to change as soon as possible.

India has seen an increase in imports of electronic goods and laptops/computers in the last few years. During April-June this year, the import of electronic goods increased to $6.96 billion from $4.73 billion in the year-ago period, with a share of 4-7 per cent in overall imports.

The highest share of imports is in the category of personal computers, including laptops and palmtops, under which imports from China stood at $558.36 million in April-May this year as against $618.26 million in the year-ago period. China accounts for roughly 70-80 per cent of the share of India’s imports of personal computers, laptops.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi chatted with Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai over a video call about Google's plans to expand electronics manufacturing in India. The PM was pleased with Google's partnership with Hewlett Packard (HP) to make Chromebooks in India, which will be produced in a facility near Chennai. These Chromebooks will cater to the demand for affordable PCs in India, particularly in the education sector. While Chromebooks are quite popular globally in schools, they're not as common in India, where Windows laptops are more prevalent. This move will help Google compete with established Windows PC brands. India aims to reduce its reliance on electronic imports, especially from China, which currently satisfies most of the country's demand for laptops and computers. This aligns with India's efforts to boost domestic manufacturing and reduce imports.

headline: PM Modi meets Google CEO Sundar Pichai, discusses plans to expand India's electronics manufacturing ecosystem
article:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday engaged in a virtual conversation with Sundar Pichai, Chief Executive Officer of Google and Alphabet.

The discussion centered around Google's endeavors to bolster the electronics manufacturing sector in India, as detailed in an official press release. Notably, Prime Minister Modi commended Google's collaboration with HP to produce Chromebooks within the country, signifying progress in the 'Make in India' initiative.

The Prime Minister acknowledged Google's noteworthy '100 languages initiative' and advocated for the localization of AI tools into various Indian languages. He further encouraged Google to concentrate its efforts on AI tools that can enhance the quality of governance, reinforcing the importance of technology for the betterment of India.

In addition, PM Modi received information about Google's forthcoming establishment of its global fintech operations center at the Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT) in Gandhinagar. The Prime Minister was apprised of Google's intentions to augment financial inclusion in India by harnessing the power and reach of GPay and the Unified Payments Interface (UPI). This reaffirms Google's commitment to contributing to India's developmental trajectory.

Furthermore, Prime Minister Modi extended an invitation to Google to participate in the upcoming Global Partnership on AI Summit, slated to be hosted by India in December 2023 in New Delhi. This event underscores India's role in advancing artificial intelligence on the global stage and represents a collaborative effort to shape the future of AI technology.

The conversation between Prime Minister Modi and Sundar Pichai underscores the significance of public-private partnerships in driving innovation and technological growth in India, while also enhancing the nation's global influence.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently had a virtual meeting with Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Google and Alphabet. The conversation revolved around Google's efforts to boost electronic manufacturing in India, particularly the 'Make in India' initiative. Modi appreciated Google's partnership with HP to make Chromebooks in India and the company's '100 languages initiative,' which he encouraged. He also invited Google to work on AI tools to improve governance and extended an invitation to the Global Partnership on AI Summit in India. Additionally, Pichai shared plans for a fintech operations center in Gujarat, aiming to enhance financial inclusion in India. This conversation highlights the importance of public-private collaborations in India's tech growth and global influence.

headline: LinkedIn Layoffs: Read the full email sent to employees fired from their job
article:
LinkedIn laid off over 600 employees in its latest round of job cuts

LinkedIn sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent steps taken by the company in order to 'improve agility and accountability'
Those impacted by the layoffs will get a calendar invite with the title: 'Required Attendance: R&D Role Reductions'
In the email, the company claimed that they are taking the step with the long-term plans of the company in mind.
Microsoft recently laid off around 700 employees, continuing the trend of layoffs in 2023. The professional networking platform has removed employees from engineering, talent, and even finance. The maximum number of layoffs happened in the company’s R&D wing amounting for 563 roles. LinkedIn sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent steps taken by the company in order to 'improve agility and accountability'. In the email, the company claimed that they are taking the step with the long-term plans of the company in mind.

The letter sent by LinkedIn to its employees was accessed by Business Insider. The letter says those affected by the layoffs will get a calendar invitation with the title "Required Attendance: R&D Role Reductions". During the call, the employees will be told how they will get support from the company. 

Read the entire letter below:

Team,
We did not expect to share this important update with you all in the midst of such challenging times but in the spirit of clarity, Tomer and I wanted to share some news regarding changes we are making to our orgs. As we continue to execute on our FY24 plan, we need to also evolve how we work and what we prioritize so we can deliver on the key initiatives we've identified that will have an outsized impact in achieving our business goals. This means adapting our organizational structures to improve agility and accountability, establishing unambiguous ownership, and driving improving efficiency & transparency through reduced layering.

These decisions result in the reduction of 563 roles across R&D. Broken down, there are 137 Engineering management roles and 38 Product roles being reduced. Additionally, there will be 368 role reductions across our Engineering team in an effort to better align resources to our FY24 plan, and we will open a small number of new roles to fill critical gaps in our ambitious roadmap.

For those who are directly affected by these changes, you will receive a calendar invitation within the next hour, titled "Required Attendance: R&D Role Reductions". This meeting will provide you with detailed information on how we we will support you through this transition.

If you do not receive this invitation, expected communication from your Product or Engineering Executive leader soon with specifics pertaining to your organization and how we will collectively navigate through these changes.

Tomer and I made these decisions with deep consideration towards the long-term needs of our business and with the acknowledgement that every affected individual has played a valuable role in the growth and success of LinkedIn. In the coming days, our focus will be on supporting each other and discussing the ways we will move forward, with our vision, mission and values as our guides. Today, it is imperative that we support our colleagues navigating this transition. Let's continue to embrace empathy and understanding through these difficult times and use these as a cornerstone for the support we provide each other.
summary: LinkedIn, a professional networking platform, has laid off over 600 employees, with the majority of the cuts happening in its Research and Development (R&D) department. This move is part of an effort to improve agility and accountability within the company and align resources with their long-term plans. Those affected by the layoffs will receive a calendar invitation titled "Required Attendance: R&D Role Reductions" to discuss how they will be supported during the transition. The company emphasized the importance of supporting each other during this challenging time. Microsoft, which owns LinkedIn, has also recently laid off around 700 employees as part of a trend of job cuts in 2023.

headline: LinkedIn, the job search platform, is laying off over 600 employees LinkedIn laid off 716 employees in May earlier this year, as the company made changes to its Global Business Organisation (GBO).
article:
LinkedIn is cutting its workforce short once again.
Story Highlights
LinkedIn has laid off over 600 employees in the fresh round of job cuts.
In May earlier this year, the job cuts affected over 700 employees.
Microsoft-backed LinkedIn did not detail the reasons for the layoffs.
Microsoft-owned LinkedIn, a job search-focused social media platform, on Monday announced that it will cut about 668 jobs across the company’s engineering, product, talent and finance teams. The layoff represents about 3 percent of the total workforce and comes for the second time this year. The company has not given the reasons for the layoff, but said it will continue “to invest in strategic priorities.” LinkedIn previously reported it had 19,500 employees across 36 offices globally, but there is no update on how many are left after the job cuts.
summary: LinkedIn, a social media platform owned by Microsoft, is undergoing its second round of job cuts this year. The company is set to lay off approximately 668 employees from various departments, including engineering, product, talent, and finance. This accounts for around 3% of its total workforce. The company hasn't provided specific reasons for the layoffs but mentioned a commitment to investing in strategic priorities. LinkedIn had around 19,500 employees across 36 global offices before these job cuts, and it's unclear how many will remain after this round of layoffs.

headline: US engineering giant Emerson to buy Virgo Valves for 450 million dollars
article:
MUMBAI: American engineering giant Emerson Group will purchase Pune-based unlisted Virgo Valves and Controls, which makes valves for oil drilling, for about $450 million, said a person with direct knowledge of the development, signaling the continued interest by overseas strategic investors in Indian companies.

"Virgo's leadership in the engineered, on-off valve market is a great strategic fit within our business and strongly complements our Fisher control valve business," said Steve Sonnenberg, Emerson's executive vice-president and head, Emerson Process Management segment.

The deal will provide an exit option to Virgo's two founders Mahesh Desai and Balasubramanian after more than two decades along with their private equity investor Tano Capital, while the new acquisition will complement the $24-billion Emerson's Fisher control valve business used in various engineering verticals.
Tano Capital had picked up a stake of 10% stake in Virgo Engineers for $13 million in 2006 valuing the company at $130 million.
The company had attempted to list on the Indian stock exchanges in 2008 and 2010 but failed as it didn't receive what it considered a fair value. Desai and his partner Balasubramanian, both former engineers from Larsen & Toubro, built the company up from scratch and now own four factories in India, the US, Italy and Germany with 900 employees. It supplies products to oil and gas, power and mining companies in 72 countries. Desai owns 32% stake, while 28% is with Balasubramanian. The rest is held by various investors.
"The alliance with Emerson and, in particular, the Fisher line of products, is a continuation of our growth as a global brand," said Desai, co-founder and chairman of Virgo. Of the company's $250 million revenue, 80% comes from overseas. Bankers and consultants expect more strategic inbound deals for Indian companies that make niche products.
"The valuation at which this deal is being done is in line with what any high-quality growth business would get globally. We continue to see a lot of strategic interest in the industrials space from European, Asian and US investors," said Preet Mohan Singh, executive director and head, industrials, at domestic investment bank Avendus Capital.
Inbound deals to India doubled in the first half of calendar year 2013 from a year ago. Between January and June 2012, there were 76 inbound deals worth $2.97 billion as against 65 deals worth $4.11 billion this year, according to data provided by Grant Thornton India, a global consultancy service.
Some consultants said the rupee's depreciation has heightened the interest of overseas investors. The rupee has depreciated nearly 22% between January and August, but has recovered 9% since then. "India's attractiveness is always compared to other destinations for such global strategic players and on a medium- to long-term perspective, India continues to be attractive. With the rupee depreciating, it has helped a lot of inbound buyers to firm up their decisions," said an investment banker.
summary: Emerson, a US engineering company, is buying Virgo Valves and Controls, an Indian firm making special valves for oil drilling, for about $450 million. Virgo's founders and their investor will sell their shares. Emerson believes Virgo's valves will be a good addition to their business. This deal is seen as a step in Virgo's global growth. Most of their $250 million revenue comes from other countries. The number of foreign companies investing in India doubled in the first half of 2013 compared to the previous year. The rupee's depreciation has made India more interesting to foreign investors.

headline: LinkedIn lays off 668 employees in second cut this year
article:
Oct 16 (Reuters) - Microsoft's (MSFT.O) LinkedIn said on Monday it would lay off 668 employees across its engineering, talent and finance teams in the second round of job cuts this year for the social media network for professionals amid slowing revenue growth.

The cuts, which affect more than 3% of the 20,000-strong staff, add to the tens of thousands of job losses this year in the technology sector in the face of an uncertain economic outlook.

"While we are adapting our organizational structures and streamlining our decision making, we are continuing to invest in strategic priorities for our future and to ensure we continue to deliver value for our members and customers," LinkedIn said in a blog on Monday.

The tech sector has laid off 141,516 employees in the first half of the year compared with about 6,000 a year ago, according to employment firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas.

LinkedIn makes money through ad sales and by charging for subscriptions to recruiting and sales professionals who use the network to find suitable job candidates.

In the fourth quarter of its fiscal 2023 year, LinkedIn's revenue increased 5% year-on-year, compared to 10% in the previous quarter.

Microsoft has cited a slowdown in hiring along with a decline in advertising spending as headwinds for LinkedIn, although it continues to add new members to its community of 950 million.

LinkedIn in May decided to cut 716 jobs across sales, operations and support teams to streamline its operations and remove layers to help make quicker decisions.
summary: Microsoft's LinkedIn is undergoing a second round of job cuts this year, with 668 employees being laid off from its engineering, talent, and finance teams. These cuts affect over 3% of its 20,000-strong staff and are attributed to slowing revenue growth. The technology sector, as a whole, has seen a significant number of job losses this year due to economic uncertainty. Despite these layoffs, LinkedIn is focused on investing in strategic priorities and delivering value to its members and customers. Microsoft has cited factors such as a slowdown in hiring and reduced advertising spending as challenges for LinkedIn, even though it continues to grow its user base. Earlier this year, LinkedIn cut 716 jobs to streamline its operations.

headline: Govt crushes AI strike; 17 union men sacked, several suspended.
article:
NEW DELHI/MUMBAI: The government on Wednesday crushed the two-day-old strike by Air India unions that was launched 72 hours after the horrific crash at Mangalore and affected about 30,000 passengers.
The union leaders, who were protesting against a gag order, withdrew the strike in the face of a tough management and a Delhi high court order that termed the action illegal and directed the 14,000-odd workers to resume duties immediately.
The AI management, meanwhile, has launched a massive crackdown on the powerful unions. It had by 9pm either dismissed or suspended about 50 union leaders and sources said more action could follow through the night.
The move came even as civil aviation minister Praful Patel said that the unions had gone a bit too far and that the AI management had a free hand in dealing with the issue. By Thursday afternoon, the airline had issued a statement saying that it had never issued a gag order based on which the employees had gone on strike.
AI said the recent order merely reiterated its July 2009 communication, which had said "...all concerned employees are advised to desist from going public with their statements that have the potential of harming the company's revenue earning possibility" or they would face disciplinary action.
The striking staff, led by Air Corporation Employees Union office bearers and All India Engineers Association, was scheduled to meet AI CMD Arvind Jadhav at the AI headquarters at 3pm on Wednesday. The meeting, however, kept getting postponed till the HC order was finally announced after which the management stated there was no need for a conciliatory meeting and striking employees would face 'termination' if they did not return to work immediately. AI has reportedly lost Rs 12.5 crore during the agitation.
In the court, Justice Rajiv Sakdher issued a notice to the striking employees union and posted the matter for further hearing on July 13. The ex-parte order was passed on a petition moved by the airline's holding company, NACIL, alleging that the strike by the employees was illegal as the reconciliation process was on.
The company submitted in court that the strike was violative of sections 22 and 24 of the Industrial Disputes Act and that it had caused 50% loss to the airline since Tuesday.
While the staff went back to work on Tuesday night itself, operations are expected to normalize in two to three days as clearing the backlog would take time. The airline is roping in extra staff and is contemplating deploying large aircraft on busy routes to deal with the stranded passengers.
The HC also directed the unions to not go ahead with their proposed strike from May 31. The unions had on May 15 served a mandatory 14 day notice to the management for resorting to strike protesting delay in payment of salaries by a week. NACIL had also moved a vacation division bench of the Bombay high court early in the day. The judges directed NACIL to give "proper notice to respondent unions" and posted the matter for hearing on May 28.
The move to crush the strike - which started on the issue of a Kingfisher engineer being asked to clear a relief IA aircraft for take off from Mangalore on Saturday after bringing in coffins and the deceased's relatives - was set in motion by a livid government on Tuesday night itself. With thousands of passengers stranded across the country, Patel spoke to Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and finance minister Pranab Mukherjee. Both leaders gave Patel the go-ahead to take appropriate action to end the stir.
summary: The Indian government quickly stopped a two-day strike by Air India unions, which began just 72 hours after a tragic crash in Mangalore, affecting around 30,000 passengers. The union leaders, protesting a restriction on speaking out, ended the strike due to strong management and a court order. The airline's management took stern action, dismissing or suspending about 50 union leaders. The government supported the management's actions. The strike was sparked by a dispute involving a Kingfisher engineer in Mangalore. The government intervened to prevent further disruptions and get flights back on track.

headline: Kashmiri girl wins world kickboxing gold
article:
SRINAGAR: Tajamul Islam,13, is the first Kashmiri girl to have represented India and won the gold medal - in the under-14 age category - in World Kickboxing Championship held at Cairo in Egypt on October 22 . She was born in Tarkpora, a remote village in north Kashmir's Bandipora district, 56km from Srinagar.
A Class 7th student of Army Goodwill School in Bandipora, Tajamul defeated Argentina's Lalina in the final. "I had represented India in Italy in 2016 too, in the under-9 category. Players from 90 other countries had participated in that championship," Tajamul told TOI, after returning home. Tajamul said that the championship started on October 18 and concluded on October 24. "I won my gold on October 22. Thirty players from India participated in various age/weight categories," she said.
According to Tajamul, she played four bouts in the event - she fought two against players from host country Egypt while her third and fourth bouts were with rivals from France and Argentina respectively. Talking about the final bout, Tajamul said that her rival was very quick in making her moves. "But I kept my cool and it paid off," she said.
Tajamul is the third of the five children of her parents. "My father Ghulam Mohammad Lone is a businessman based in Mumbai but he is back home these days," she said. Tajamul dreams of becoming an orthopaedic surgeon. "I want to break as well as join the bones by becoming a 'bone and joint' doctor," Tajamul laughed. Tajamul is also a brand ambassador of Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP) scheme. "My mummy always encouraged me and she impressed upon my father to allow me to play the game," she said. "I feel proud of my daughter. The news of her winning the gold has spread in the area," Tajmul's father said.
"Tajamul got into kickboxing in 2014 when she joined a local academy, which trains young boys and girls in martial arts in Bandipora" , her father said.
summary: Tajamul Islam, a 13-year-old girl from Kashmir, made history by winning a gold medal in World Kickboxing Championship's under-14 category in Cairo, Egypt on October 22. She hails from a remote village in north Kashmir and is the first Kashmiri girl to represent India in kickboxing. Tajamul, a Class 7 student, defeated an opponent from Argentina in the final match. She previously represented India in Italy in 2016. Tajamul played four bouts in the championship and showed exceptional skill and composure, especially in the final. She aspires to become an orthopaedic surgeon and is also a brand ambassador for the Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP) scheme. Tajamul's achievement has brought pride to her family and community. She started kickboxing training in 2014 at a local academy in Bandipora.

headline: Human-shield major back under glare
article:
Srinagar: The army officer who was at the centre of a human- shield controversy in Kashmir last year was briefly detained by state police after he was found in a hotel with a girl on Wednesday.

No wrongdoing involving Major Leetul Gogoi, a decorated officer, has been established so far in the hotel incident.

Some hotel employees said the Kashmiri girl appeared to be a minor but police said the girl told them she was 19.

The army has ordered an internal probe. Valley police chief S. P. Pani has also ordered an inquiry.

An army officer said: " We have asked the commander of the army unit where Gogoi is posted to send a detailed report. It is still not clear why Maj. Gogoi had booked a hotel room for a day where he had called a woman. We need to first know his side of the story before making any official statement. " In April 2017, Maj. Gogoi had tied a Kashmiri civilian to his jeep as a human shield against stone- throwers.

On Wednesday, a defence source said Gogoi was handed over to his army unit, 53 Rashtriya Rifles, as there was no " cognisable " offence against him.

A hotel employee said Gogoi had booked a room through the website bookings.

com at the hotel in Srinagar ' s Nawpora locality.

The management became suspicious when they found the girl and another Kashmiri, the driver of their vehicle, accompanying the officer.
summary: A decorated army officer, Major Leetul Gogoi, was briefly detained by state police after being found in a hotel with a girl. No wrongdoing has been established in the incident, and the army has ordered an internal probe. The valley police chief S. P. Pani has also ordered an inquiry. The army has asked the commander of the army unit where Gogoi is posted to send a detailed report. Gogoi was handed over to his army unit, 53 Rashtriya Rifles, as there was no " cognisable" offence against him. Gogoi had booked a room through the bookings.com website in Srinagar's Nawpora locality.

headline: Taliban ' s lost parivar found
article:
ANITA JOSHUAAND DEBRAJ DEB New Delhi/ Agartala: Victorious BJP supporters have accomplished what Indian communists never could: make Vladimir Lenin trend in the country.

As a video clip of Lenin ' s statue being toppled in Tripura where the Left was voted out after 25 years leaped from one phone to another and crossed the border, a social media user in Bangladesh wondered: " Have Islamists won in Tripura? Why are they breaking statues? " The reference seemed to be to the destruction of the Bamiyan Buddha statues in Afghanistan in 2001 by the Taliban.


But filmmaker Rakesh Sharma differed with those who compared the " Hindutva vigilantes " to the Taliban. " They ' re pioneers, not copycats! Even when it comes to demolitions.


The Taliban destroyed Bamiyan Buddha statues in March 2001, while Hindutva cadre- kar sevaks demolished Babri Masjid in 1992, more than eight years earlier! " BJP parliamentarian Subramanian Swamy also sought to draw a distinction by saying the Lenin statue in Tripura was " not broken " and his party would send it to the office of the CPM, where communist leaders can worship him.


" Lenin was a foreigner. He was, in a way, a terrorist because of the number of people he killed there ( in Russia) after imposing dictatorship there.

And ( you) want the statue of such a person erected in our country? " PTI quoted Swamy as asking.

South Tripura SP Manchak Ipper said Ashish Paul, the driver of the payloader used to topple the statue, had been arrested. Chief ministerdesignate Biplab Kumar Deb said he had not seen the video clip but added that nobody indulging in violence would be spared.

With a constitutional figure and some politicians seemingly endorsing the statue operation, Sangh parivar supporters removed a Lenin bust in Sabroom in South Tripura and set a new goal: bring down Periyar statues in Tamil Nadu.

E. V. Ramasamy or Periyar had pioneered the self- respect movement in Tamil Nadu. A TV channel reported that at least one statue was vandalised in Vellore and two suspects were arrested.


H. Raja, the BJP ' s national secretary, and S. G. Suryah, who calls himself an RSS swayamsevak , posted across social media platforms that Periyar ' s statues would be brought down. The post later disappeared. The BJP was quick to distance itself from Raja ' s post by calling it a personal opinion.

Fellow- travellers of the Sangh parivar wondered why India should offer space for a Lenin statue when it had been brought down across the erstwhile Soviet Union after its collapse. The counter was why what was done after the collapse of a regime should be repeated after a change of guard through the ballot box.


Rakesh Sinha, who heads an RSS- backed think- tank, said the Sangh was not responsible for " people ' s anger " and blamed the CPM ' s " authoritarianism, coercion and the use of state and party apparatus against masses " . What happened in Tripura stood out in contrast to how earlier governments dealt with colonial statues after Independence.

Historian Narayani Gupta, who was a member of the Delhi Urban Arts Commission, told The Telegraph that most of the colonial era statues were either removed to parks from their vantage locations and some were sold to Canada and Australia. They mostly went into neglect but there was no vandalism as such.
summary:
As a video clip of Lenin ' s statue being toppled in Tripura where the Left was voted out after 25 years leaped from one phone to another and crossed the border, a social media user in Bangladesh wondered: " Have Islamists won in Tripura?
The reference seemed to be to the destruction of the Bamiyan Buddha statues in Afghanistan in 2001 by the Taliban.
But filmmaker Rakesh Sharma differed with those who compared the " Hindutva vigilantes " to the Taliban. "
With a constitutional figure and some politicians seemingly endorsing the statue operation, Sangh parivar supporters removed a Lenin bust in Sabroom in South Tripura and set a new goal: bring down Periyar statues in Tamil Nadu.
A TV channel reported that at least one statue was vandalised in Vellore and two suspects were arrested.
H. Raja, the BJP ' s national secretary, and S. G. Suryah, who calls himself an RSS swayamsevak , posted across social media platforms that Periyar ' s statues would be brought down.

headline: 10 illegal houses demolished in Jamshedpur
article:
Continuing with it’s effort to make Government land free of illegal constructions, the local administration on Sunday demolished as many as 10 houses and under-construction compound wall razed in Bagan Area under Sidhgora police station area of the city. Both the houses and compound wall were set up in an unauthorised way on the land under Tata Steel lease area.

The newly appointed Dhalbhum sub-divisional officer Suraj Kumar, along with the demolition squad comprising deputy superintendent of police (headquarters-I) KN Mishra, officer-in-charge of Sidhgora police station Rajdev Singh and,  about 50 armed policemen and four excavators were involved in the job.

The team pulled down the compound wall being set up around a plot of land measuring more than two acres.

The administration asked all the small vendors, including meat stall and other shops for removing their make-shift structures. Subsquently the squad took a turn toward a locality called China Garden and Shiv Singh bagan area in Agrico under the same police station area.

At China Garden, the administration partially demolished an under-construction three-storeyed building, which belonged to one Bhupendra Singh. The team also demolished a newly built house which belonged to BJP activist Bipin Kumar Singh and later they evicted as many as seven houses in Shiv Singh bagan.

Notably, all the which were demolished were located at a distance of less than one kilometre away from the residence of BJP leader and Chief Minister Raghubar Das.

“We want to continue with our drive to make city encroachment free. We had complaint by the Tata Steel against the land encroachers. We had served notice prior to the drive so that the unauthorised persons may remove their house-hold belongings from their places,” said the Dhalbhum SDO Suraj Kumar.  He said they would lodge FIR against those who had tried to encroach upon the vacant Tata Steel land.

“There were some initial protests before. There is a matter of 86 bustees set up on Tata lease area in the city.  The matter is now pending at a higher level of the State Government for consideration. But as per law no one can set up new houses in any of these 86 bustees,” the Dhalbhum SDO said.

The increasing encroachment on the Government and Tata Steel lease land area particularly on busy market areas has become a matter of concern for the district administration.

Kadma, Bistupur, Sakchi and Jugsalai, which are the busiest areas of the town, over fifty fruit vendors and vegetable sellers have encroached the road and there are always a traffic jam as the fruit vendors have occupied one forth portion of the road, making difficult to move the heavy vehicles.
summary:
Continuing with it's effort to make Government land free of illegal constructions, the local administration on Sunday demolished as many as 10 houses and under-construction compound wall razed in Bagan Area under Sidhgora police station area of the city.
The team also demolished a newly built house which belonged to BJP activist Bipin Kumar Singh and later they evicted as many as seven houses in Shiv Singh bagan.
Notably, all the which were demolished were located at a distance of less than one kilometre away from the residence of BJP leader and Chief Minister Raghubar Das.
 He said they would lodge FIR against those who had tried to encroach upon the vacant Tata Steel land.
There is a matter of 86 bustees set up on Tata lease area in the city.
The increasing encroachment on the Government and Tata Steel lease land area particularly on busy market areas has become a matter of concern for the district administration.

headline: Shuttlers bag silver medal at the National Games
article:
Thane's top doubles badminton players Akshay Dewalkar and Jishnu Sanyal bagged the silver medal at the recently held 34th National Games 2011 held at Ranchi, Jharkhand.
In the quarter finals both got a walkover from the local Jharkhand pair. In the semi finals they defeated Mohit Kamat and Venkatesh Prasad of Karnataka in a well contested match at 21 - 14 / 21 - 17.
In the finals they were against the Kerala pair of Arun Vishnu and Alwyn Francis. Dewalkar and Sanyal losing the first game at 14 - 21 came back strongly in the second game but lost closely at 24 - 26 and had to be satisfied with the silver medal.
Dewalkar said, "Disappointed, true as we would have loved to win the tournament but we fought to the best of our ability and as the scores show the second set was contested extremely closely. One who played better on the day, won, and that is that. We hope to win in the next nationals which are to be held in a few months."
Dewalkar is ranked number one and Sanyal number four in the men's doubles as per the latest ranking issued by the Badminton Association of India. Both have represented the Indian team at various International Championships including the World Badminton Championships. They had won the bronze medal at the SAF games held in Colombo. They have also won the Junior National Championships and several other national tournaments.
On the National level, Dewalkar teams up with Vishnu who was his opponent in this final.
summary: Thane's top doubles badminton players, Akshay Dewalkar and Jishnu Sanyal, secured the silver medal at the 34th National Games in 2011 held in Ranchi, Jharkhand. They received a walkover in the quarter-finals and defeated a Karnataka pair in the semi-finals. However, in the finals against the Kerala pair of Arun Vishnu and Alwyn Francis, they narrowly lost the second game and settled for silver. Dewalkar expressed disappointment but acknowledged the close contest. He looks forward to the next nationals. Dewalkar is ranked first and Sanyal fourth in men's doubles according to the latest Badminton Association of India rankings. They've represented India in various international championships and won bronze at the SAF Games in Colombo. They've also clinched the Junior National Championships and several other national tournaments. At the national level, Dewalkar usually partners with Vishnu, his opponent in this final match.

headline: Patients hit as nurses go on strike
article:
Patients admitted in the Doon hospital are facing inconvenience due to nurses' strike in the hospital as they are not getting treatment on time which is risky for their health. To boycott evening and night shift duties, nurses have decided to work only in day shift from Monday.

A patient BM Bangwal admitted in the hospital from past four days said that the need of nurses are generally at the night time and if nurses will not work during night, who will take care of the patients in case of emergency.

This is the main problem for those patients who are serious and need nurse every time for watching drip or for vaccination. He also said that behaviour of the nurses is also not good as they don't care patients properly. Even in day shift nurses are not performing their duty seriously.

Another patient Rahul, who is admitted in general ward of Doon hospital, said that it has become routine of doctors or nurses to go on strike and no one serious about their duty.

He asked that what will a patient does in case of emergency without nurse. Nurses are attending day shift and refused working in night but nurses requirement get double during night shift in place of day shift, he added.

He said that government hospitals are meant for middle class and poor people who can't afford private clinics or hospitals, but due to this strike, doctors and nurses are playing with patients' lives.

Another patient Hari Kishore said that the nurses are mainly needed during the night time as there are various problems which can be solved by a professional only.

He also said that patients who are coming from outside Dehradun are facing more inconvenience due to daily strike as they are not getting treatment on time and due to this they are becoming more sick and weak. The hospital department will only perform their work properly unless & until some serious tragedy happens, Kishore added.

Vijayata another patient said that the work of the nurses is to take care of the patients and for that only they were appointed in the hospitals but now as they are on strike it is not good for the patients who are admitted in the hospital.

She also said that patients have to survive during emergency which can also results in some kind of misfortune.

Prem Pratap Singh a local resident said that my wife is admitted in the hospital and if the nurses will not work at night, who will take care of the patients at the time of some emergency

Everyday different departments in hospitals are going on strike one by one which is becoming a major issue for the patients. Employees in government Hospital now don't want to work that is why they are generating different issues daily, Singh added.
summary:
Patients admitted in the Doon hospital are facing inconvenience due to nurses' strike in the hospital as they are not getting treatment on time which is risky for their health.
To boycott evening and night shift duties, nurses have decided to work only in day shift from Monday.
Vijayata another patient said that the work of the nurses is to take care of the patients and for that only they were appointed in the hospitals but now as they are on strike it is not good for the patients who are admitted in the hospital.
Prem Pratap Singh a local resident said that my wife is admitted in the hospital and if the nurses will not work at night, who will take care of the patients at the time of some emergency. Everyday different departments in hospitals are going on strike one by one which is becoming a major issue for the patients.

headline: Prepare timely for Corona vaccination of children: CM
article:
In a video conference, Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan told in the Collector-Commissioner conference that Corona cases are increasing in neighboring states in Mantralaya today. Cases are increasing almost everywhere. We should be fully prepared for its control. Medical Education Minister Vishwas Sarang, Chief Secretary Iqbal Singh Bains, Additional Chief Secretary Mohammad Suleman, senior officers of various departments and Collector Commissioner were present in the meeting.

Chouhan said that 307 new cases have been reported in the state. Cases are coming up in all the four metros. Now gradually it is likely to spread everywhere. Our strategy is to admit the patient to the hospital if there is no space at home. All the ministers in charge should pay attention to this. Build a Covid Care Center. Prepare one Covid Care Center each in the districts. Home isolation patient should be given advice on what to do to be careful. Disseminate the message on a wider scale. There have been 9 cases of Omicron in the state, all of whom have recovered.

The Chief Minister gave necessary instructions to the Indore Collector regarding the strategy to control Corona. Instructions were given regarding activation of Covid Care Center, Fever Clinic, testing etc. Indore is the most alert and challenging. Cases will increase rapidly, so proper arrangements should be ensured.

Chouhan said that all other collectors should also make arrangements after making full preparations. Let there be no shortcoming from your side. Arrange meetings of Covid Crisis Management Committees. So far 94.8 percent eligible persons have got first dose and 91 percent have been administered with second dose in the state. Vaccinations should continue.

Chouhan said that preparations should be made for the vaccination of children in the 15 to 18 year age group. Ensure vaccination in all cities simultaneously. Vaccination is to be done rapidly from January 3 on a war footing. Ensure vaccination of 15 to 18 year old children in the form of a Maha Abhiyan. Get involved in this work with priority. There should be an appeal for vaccination during the launch. It is up to the choice of 60-year-olds to get a booster dose.

Chouhan said that fever clinics should be started. At present there are active cases in 20 districts. Crisis Management Committee meetings should be arranged in places where there have not been held so far.

Information should be taken from the ministers in charge. People should be encouraged to wear face masks. Roko-Toko campaigns should continue. Crowded places should be avoided. The poor should continue with their livelihood, their economic condition should not be affected. The arrangements of the Covid Care Center should be good. Oxygen, PSA plant should be functional, also check the arrangement of LMO tank. Medicines were arranged for a month. The duration of Chief Minister empaneled hospitals has been extended till 31 March 2022. Ensure mapping of beds. Arrange beds in private and government hospitals. Check out all the essentials. Contact tracing has to be done.

Chief Minister Shri Chouhan said that discussion should be held with schools to vaccinate children. The target is to vaccinate 48 lakh children of the state. MPs, MLAs, public representatives all have to be involved in this work.
summary:
In a video conference, Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan told in the Collector-Commissioner conference that Corona cases are increasing in neighboring states in Mantralaya today.
Chouhan said that 307 new cases have been reported in the state.
There have been 9 cases of Omicron in the state, all of whom have recovered.
So far 94.8 percent eligible persons have got first dose and 91 percent have been administered with second dose in the state.
Chouhan said that preparations should be made for the vaccination of children in the 15 to 18 year age group.
Vaccination is to be done rapidly from January 3 on a war footing.
Ensure vaccination of 15 to 18 year old children in the form of a Maha Abhiyan.
The target is to vaccinate 48 lakh children of the state.

headline: Sonia calls for secular spirit to end violence.
article: latur: expressing grave concern over the increasing incidents of violence and hatred spread in the name of religion all over the world, congress president sonia gandhi has stressed the need for preserving the true spirit of secularism. ms gandhi, who was addressing a public meeting after inaugurating the vikas co-operative sugar factory at niwali village near here on monday morning, said that presently the atmosphere in the world was vitiated by violence, hatred and destruction and emphasised that violence was not an answer to these problems. during her 12-minute-long speech, the leader of the opposition also launched a scathing attack against the bharatiya janata party (bjp) and the national democratic alliance government. she charged that the bjp had betrayed the people who had voted the party to power. "during its two-year rule, the main ruling party at the centre has ruined the country's economy, it has sold public sector industries to the private sector and was also responsible for the increased unemployment in the country," she alleged. the bjp had time and again criticised and indulged in character assassination of former prime ministers pandit nehru, indira gandhi and rajiv gandhi, the congress president charged, and alleged that soon after coming to power, this party had forgotten all the issues it had raised during the elections. ms gandhi had especially flown here to inaugurate the new sugar factory headed by amit deshmukh, eldest son of chief minister vilasrao deshmukh. among others who attended the function were chief minister deshmukh, maharashtra pradesh congress committee president govindrao adik, congress treasurer motilal vora, former lok sabha speaker shivraj patil, former union home minister s. b. chavan, mumbai regional congress committee president murali deora and former chief minister shivajirao patil-nilangekar. in his speech, chief minister deshmukh said that incidents like the recent riots in malegaon were the result of "anti-social tendencies" and asserted that his government had taken the necessary steps to improve the situation in the sensitive town. he has also appealed to people to preserve the spirit of respecting all religions. at the public meeting, shivraj patil handed over a cheque of rs 25 lakh on behalf of the latur district congress committee, to ms gandhi, towards the party's national fund. with the opening of the new factory, the number of co-operative sugar factories in latur district is five; there are seven others. the vikas sugar factory established at the cost of rs 28 crore has the capacity to crush 1,800 to 2,000 metric tonnes of sugarcane daily.
summary: Sonia Gandhi, Congress President, expressed concern over global religious violence. She emphasized the importance of true secularism at the inauguration of the Vikas Co-operative Sugar Factory in Niwali village, Latur. Gandhi criticized the BJP and the government, accusing them of economic damage and privatization. Chief Minister Deshmukh addressed recent Malegaon riots and urged religious respect. At the event, a Rs 25 lakh contribution was made to the party's national fund. The new factory can process 1,800 to 2,000 metric tonnes of sugarcane daily, adding to Latur's five co-operative sugar factories.

headline: Woman gangraped in Agra
article:
A 25-year-old wife of a coaching institute owner was gang-raped at knife point in a moving car at Agra on Wednesday while another woman was raped and murdered in Pratapgarh. local police registered both the cases but failed to lay a trap on the accused.

In Agra, one Gaurav Gupta aka Shameem, a native of Dewla hamlet of Sadar Bazar in Agra, knew the wife of a coaching institute owner. On Wednesday, he called her at Bhagwan Talkies for some work. When the woman reached there, Gaurav Gupta, asked her to come in his car and they would have a cup of tea and discussed some matter. The accused later took the car and stopped it near SN Medical College campus. The women was shocked when suddenly, Gaurav Gupta’s friend identified as Arvind, who was also in the car whipped out a knife and threatened to kill her if she would raise an alarm. later the accused raped the woman one by one in moving car and finally they abandoned her but not before threatening her with life if she will reveal the incident to anyone. later the victim somehow reached home and revealed the trauma to her husband who subsequently went and lodged a case with the New Agra police station. The cops said that they sent the woman for medical examination and also conducted raids but failed to arrest the accused who were found absconding.

Meanwhile in another case, body of a woman who was raped and murdered was found lying in Phatanpur locality of Pratapgarh. According to reports, a local resident of Bairampur hamlet of Phatanpur saw a nude body of a women lying on the corner of the road on Thursday morning. The victim, who was in her early twenties seems to be gang raped and later strangulated to death. The accused later dumped her body to conceal the crime. The cops of Phatanpur police reached the spot and sent the body for post-mortem examination. They also get a case registered in the matter and efforts were made to maintain her identity so that the cops could close down on the killers.
summary:
A 25-year-old wife of a coaching institute owner was gang-raped at knife point in a moving car at Agra on Wednesday while another woman was raped and murdered in Pratapgarh.
local police registered both the cases but failed to lay a trap on the accused.
The women was shocked when suddenly, Gaurav Gupta's friend identified as Arvind, who was also in the car whipped out a knife and threatened to kill her if she would raise an alarm.
later the accused raped the woman one by one in moving car and finally they abandoned her but not before threatening her with life if she will reveal the incident to anyone.
Meanwhile in another case, body of a woman who was raped and murdered was found lying in Phatanpur locality of Pratapgarh.
The victim, who was in her early twenties seems to be gang raped and later strangulated to death.

headline: 28 Raipur villages to get clean, safe drinking water
article:
As many as 28 villages in Raipur district will be getting clean and safe drinking water soon.

The Chhattisgarh Government will launch Rs42.90 crore ‘Community Water Supply Project’ in the villages.

The water supply to the villages would be ensured from Kharun River’s Bhairwa Anicut. The project is to be implemented by Public Health Engineering Department (PHED) in joint collaboration with NABARD.

The villages to receive water supply from the project are – Bhairwa, Panderbhatta, Bhaismunda, Murra,Parsatrai, Baratnara, Charoda, Tanda, Mohandi, Godi, Nagargaon, Akoli, Mandhar, Gidhouri, Tivariya, Kapsada, Devri, Akoli, Manohara, Mehersekha, Kukera, Kuthrail, Maloud, Mauhagaon, Silyari, Taresar, Raita and villages of Dhardiwa region.

It may be recalled that the PHED in joint association with NABARD will also launch a ‘Community Water Supply Project’ in Tamnar development block of Raigarh district.

 The project would provide relief to people of three villages mainly Kasdol, Godi and Tamnar where ground water levels had been depleting fast.

 The project would comprise constructing an Anicut on Kelo river in Kasdol village to reach water in the three villages.

 The State government has approved more than Rs2.97 crore for the project.

 Notably, the State Government has previously approved a total of 11 tap water projects involving a cost of Rs3.47 crore in Raigarh district.

 The projects have been approved under National Rural Drinking Water Programme.

The regions where the projects is to be implemented are—three villages in lailunga Development Block,  Two villages each in Dharamjaigarh and Barakela development blocks and one village each in Sarangarh, Tamnar,  Kharsia and Gharghoda development blocks.

The tap water projects when ready would be operated and maintained by respective Panchayat bodies.

 Chhattisgarh was ranked first in the country for providing domestic water connection in 2014-15 under the NationalRural Drinking Water Programme (NRDWP), officials stated.

This was the State's second major achievement after bagging first position in the country for installing solar pumps. 

The Central Government had given a target of 30,000 water connection for the year 2014-15 under the programme the objective of which is to provide pure drinking water to rural people to protect them from water borne diseases.

The State has provided 88,000 domestic water connections in 10 months of 2014-15 and this is more than 50 per cent of total domestic connections provided in the State in past 42 years. In total, the number of domestic connections provided in rural areas has crossed the figure of 2.50 lakh, officials stated.

 The PHED is providing safe and clean drinking water to the residents of 1,145 habitats in the State, officials stated.

 Earlier, the people in various districts had been getting drinking water with excess iron, hard water and fluoride content, they stated.

 The State Public Health Engineering Department (PHED) has installed 33,327 hand pumps during the past two-and-half years in the State till the month of August this year.

During the period, a total of 1000 power operated pumps were also installed, officials stated.

The Department carried out digging of a total of 40,016 bore wells in the State out of which 34,978 were successful.

PHED is providing safe and clean drinking water to the residents of 1,145 habitats in the State, officials stated.

 Earlier, the people in various districts had been getting drinking water with excess iron, hard water and fluoride content, they stated.

 Water purification plants have been installed to limit iron and fluoride contents and R.O. (Reverse Osmosis ).

 State PHED Minister Ramsevak Paikra  had initiated the works on nine 'Nal-Jal' Yojanas ( Tap water projects) at a cost of Rs276.67 crore.

 The PHED has installed as many as 251 new solar powered pumps in various districts in rural pockets of Chhattisgarh, officials stated.

 The Department also installed a total of 8,950 new hand pumps during 2014-15 under the National Rural Drinking Water Mission in the rural pockets of the State.

 There were a total of 10,373 tube wells dug up by the Department in the entire State out of which 8,950 wells were declared successful.

 During the last financial year, 1,034 new hand pumps were established in rural schools and 1,881 in Anganwadis.

 As many as 141 new tube wells were dug in the urban pockets of the State out of which 126 were declared successful during the last financial year.

Notably, Chhattisgarh ranks first in the country in terms of providing drinking water through solar powered pumps, officials stated.

 Out of the total number of solar pumps installed in the entire country in financial year 2013-14, nearly 90 per cent of the solar pumps were installed in Chhattisgarh itself, they claimed.

 An amount of Rs65.28 crore has been spent on 6503 pure and safe drinking water schemes by the Public Health and Engineering Department (PHED)  during the past six years in Bastar district.

About 6449 drinking water schemes have been already completed and people are getting safe and pure drinking  water, officials stated.

The drinking water projects have been sanctioned during the fiscal 2009-10 and 2014-15. The projects include installation of 6372 hand-pumps, 91 spot source scheme, 39 Nal- Jal yojana and one water procurement project.

 The PHED spent Rs54.72 crore on installation of hand-pumps in Bastar district, Rs5.77 crore on Nal-Jal yojana, Rs3.80 crore on spot source scheme and RsOne crore on water procurement project.
summary:
As many as 28 villages in Raipur district will be getting clean and safe drinking water soon.
The Chhattisgarh Government will launch Rs42.90 crore 'Community Water Supply Project' in the villages.
The State Public Health Engineering Department (PHED) has installed 33,327 hand pumps during the past two-and-half years in the State till the month of August this year.
The Department carried out digging of a total of 40,016 bore wells in the State out of which 34,978 were successful.
The PHED has installed as many as 251 new solar powered pumps in various districts in rural pockets of Chhattisgarh, officials stated.
Notably, Chhattisgarh ranks first in the country in terms of providing drinking water through solar powered pumps, officials stated.

headline: Crucial victory for Awadhe Warriors
article:
P. Kashyap brought the adoring fans to their feet as he survived five matchpoints to defeat Sourabh Verma 14-15, 15-13, 15-14 and registered a crucial victory for Awadhe Warriors against Ahmedabad Smash Masters in the Vodafone Premier Badminton League at the Babu Banarasi Das Stadium here on Tuesday.

It was too good a script to be upset as Awadhe Warriors crawled back from difficult positions in the first two matches to stay ahead, winning in a thrilling fashion at the wire.
summary: Awadhe warriors won the match against ahmedabad smash masters in the vodafone primier badminton league at BBD stadium.

headline: Monsoon records shortfall from normal
article:
The Monsoon rain has fallen short of normal this year, as the season bids adieu to the region.

According to the Met Department, Haryana and Punjab has recorded a rain deficit of minus 25 and minus 21 respectively during this monsoon. Chandigarh — the joint capital city of Punjab and Haryana has however recorded a slight departure from normal monsoon rainfall with shortfall of just 11 per cent.

Every year, the Monsoon season begins with the onset of rains in June and ends in September. This year, the southwest Monsoon had entered some parts of Haryana falling in the National Capital Region on July 2, but had turned weak thereafter halting its further advancement into the region.

“The southwest Monsoon has begun to withdraw. Compared to the previous years, the monsoon rainfall in the region has remained close to normal this time. Punjab and Haryana has recorded a rain deficit of 21 and 25 per cent respectively while Chandigarh has recorded a slight deviation from the normal monsoon rainfall,” said Surender Pal, Director Met Department, while talking to The Pioneer.

On the whole, Haryana received 343.9 mm rains against normal of 458.9 mm recording a deficit of 25 percent.  The neighbouring State of Punjab recorded 386.4 mm rains recording a departure of 21 per cent from the normal rains of 490.3 mm in monsoon, said he.

Chandigarh has received 752.8 mm rainfall against normal of 842.7 mm, he added.

In agrarian State of Punjab, Ferozepur recorded highest rain deficit of 83 per cent followed by Sangrur with minus 52, Tarn Taran with minus 50. The Monsoon rain exceeded by 43 per cent in Kapurthala which recorded 600.5 mm rains and it exceeded by 35 per cent against the normal in Moga district which received 474.4 mm rain.

 In neighbouring Haryana, Panchkula, Fatehabad and Gurugram received lowest rainfall during this monsoon. The district where deficit is more than 50 per cent are Panchkula with 57 per cent deficit, Fatehabad with 51 per cent rain deficit. Among other districts, Gurugram recorded deficit of minus 48, Panipat minus 40, Ambala minus 39. Kaithal recorded lowest rainfall deficit of minus two receiving monsoon rains of 375.5 mm.
