last year, Punjab and Haryana had recorded rain deficit of minus 28 and minus 27 respectively.
summary:
The Monsoon rain has fallen short of normal this year, as the season bids adieu to the region.
According to the Met Department, Haryana and Punjab has recorded a rain deficit of minus 25 and minus 21 respectively during this monsoon.
Chandigarh — the joint capital city of Punjab and Haryana has however recorded a slight departure from normal monsoon rainfall with shortfall of just 11 per cent.
On the whole, Haryana received 343.9 mm rains against normal of 458.9 mm recording a deficit of 25 percent.
In agrarian State of Punjab, Ferozepur recorded highest rain deficit of 83 per cent followed by Sangrur with minus 52, Tarn Taran with minus 50.
In neighboring Haryana, Panchkula, Fatehabad and Gurugram received lowest rainfall during this monsoon.

headline: Fears over FRDI Bill misplaced, says government
article:
In yet another clarification about the Financial Regulatory and Deposit Insurance (FRDI) Bill, the government has said depositors will be given preferential treatment in the event of liquidation of a bank, and the controversial bail-in clause will be used only with the prior consent of depositors.

The clarification also said the bail-in clause would not be applied to public sector banks, and it would be a tool of last resort — when a merger or acquisition is not viable — in the case of private sector banks. The government reiterated its implicit guarantee for the solvency of public sector banks.
summary: on FRDI bill gov. gives another clarification regarding the depositors and the bail in clause

headline: VHP sets to revive 'Ram temple' in Ayodhya issue
article:
The long smouldering issue of Ram Janmabhoomi Temple in Ayodhya is all set to be revived by the saffron brigade as the elections in the State as well as at the Centre draw closer.

The central India unit of Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) announced to initiate a massive propaganda in the region to generate support for a fresh round of agitation to build Ram temple at the controversial site of Babri mosque in Ayodhya.

The announcement was made by VHP State Secretary Rajesh Tiwari in the State capital on Thursday. The announcement comes in pursuance to the proposals finalised by VHP’s Kendriya Margadarshak Mandal which met at the Sangam in Allahabad earlier this month.

Tiwari informed that the Parishad will initiate a door-to-door campaign of chanting the ‘Ram Vijay Mahamantra’ from April 11. The campaign will be continued till May 13.

 “VHP workers will go door-to-door in every village of the region to encourage people to conduct regular jaap of the mahamantra. This will increase the spiritual power of Hindus. This spiritual power will enable us to construct the Ram temple in Ayodhya,” Tiwari said.

 “We have conducted such campaigns for chanting the mahamantra earlier as well. It was due to the spiritual effect of this mantra that Allahabad High Court gave a judgement in our favour,” he added, referring to the court’s judgement in September 2010 in which it partitioned the controversial site into three parts.

Tiwari also remarked that the Ram temple issue is an emotional and civilizational issue for the Hindus and that it cannot be resolved by courts.

Besides the Ram temple issue, Tiwari informed that the Parishad will also initiate campaigns for stopping cow-slaughter, cleaning river Ganga and for providing protection to women.
summary:
The long smouldering issue of Ram Janmabhoomi Temple in Ayodhya is all set to be revived by the saffron brigade as the elections in the State as well as at the Centre draw closer.
The central India unit of Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) announced to initiate a massive propaganda in the region to generate support for a fresh round of agitation to build Ram temple at the controversial site of Babri mosque in Ayodhya.
Tiwari informed that the Parishad will initiate a door-to-door campaign of chanting the 'Ram Vijay Mahamantra' from April 11.
This will increase the spiritual power of Hindus.
Tiwari also remarked that the Ram temple issue is an emotional and civilizational issue for the Hindus and that it cannot be resolved by courts.
Besides the Ram temple issue, Tiwari informed that the Parishad will also initiate campaigns for stopping cow-slaughter, cleaning river Ganga and for providing protection to women.

headline: 2 workers die in sewage treatment plant in East Delhi’s Kondli area
article:
A day after four people died after falling into a sewer another tragic accident took place in the city. Two workers repairing the motor of a sewage treatment plant in east Delhi’s Kondli area died after they fell into the pit on Wednesday evening. The deceased have been identified as Nitesh (25), a resident of Bulandshahr in Uttar Pradesh and Yashdev (35), a resident of Tigri Rathol.

According to a senior police official, a police control room (PCR) call  regarding two persons working in a plant in Dallupura having fallen in a pit was received at around 5 PM following which an Emergency Response Vehicle was dispatched to the spot.

“After reaching the spot, the police team found that two persons had fallen in a sewerage treatment plant in the Delhi Jal Board (DJB), Kondli. The two were taken out with help of the fire department and sent to hospital but were both declared brought dead,” said the senior police official adding that the legal action is being taken.

“Around 8 PM fire department units returned and it is reported that the two men who fell into the pit were lifted out by Delhi Fire Services (DFS) and rushed to hospital where they were declared brought dead by the doctors,” said Atul Garg, the Chief Fire Officer.
summary:
A day after four people died after falling into a sewer another tragic accident took place in the city.
Two workers repairing the motor of a sewage treatment plant in east Delhi's Kondli area died after they fell into the pit on Wednesday evening.
The two were taken out with help of the fire department and sent to hospital but were both declared brought dead," said the senior police official adding that the legal action is being taken.

headline: Supreme Court relief to CRPF aspirants
article:
Eight aspirants to the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) were denied the benefit of the Other Backward Classes quota merely because the government depended on a private book, ‘Swamy’s Compilation on Reservations and Concessions’, to decide that their castes did not merit reservation. The Supreme Court found that the government had preferred Swamy’s list of Other Backward Classes (OBC) over its own official OBC list, and, even the Resolutions of the National Commission for Backward Classes (NCBC).

The government’s choice of research, the apex court concluded, led to the denial of fundamental rights to the young men. They had to suffer a prolonged litigation.
summary: the SC reliefed the 8 aspirants of OBC as gov. choice of research was swamy's list which lead to suffer of young men

headline: Woman dies after taking abortion pills
article:
An eight-month pregnant Odisha woman reportedly died after consuming pills to abort foetus as she feared complications post delivery.

The tragedy took place in Chennai, where Kumari Kanjakam (23) had migrated from Odisha with her husband Pratap Ulaka and niece Geetha Kanjaka. According to police sources, Kumari had recently came to Odisha along with her niece to attend funeral of a woman who died due to delivery-related complications.

As she was pregnant, she returned to Chennai in a disturbed mind on September 20. She had a fall in bathroom, complained of stomach ache, following which she was hospitalised.  Doctors found that Kumari had a serious infection in her womb. With consent of her family, a surgery was conducted to remove her uterus. But she did not recover from illness and died.
summary:
An eight-month pregnant Odisha woman reportedly died after consuming pills to abort foetus as she feared complications post delivery.
She had a fall in bathroom, complained of stomach ache, following which she was hospitalised.
 Doctors found that Kumari had a serious infection in her womb.

headline: Pakistan’s videotapes
article: Kulbhushan Jadhav has become a tool in the hands of Pakistan to score points over India (“Pak releases Jadhav video, India terms it propaganda”, January 5). Every opportunity is being used to show India in a bad light by using Mr. Jadhav as a pawn. Whatever pressure we seem to be exerting on Pakistan to try to free him is proving to be of little use. When loud diplomacy has failed, it is time to explore whether other means such as back channels or third party diplomacy would be of use. Perhaps we can work out a mutually acceptable solution to the problem. This is a humanitarian issue that concerns a person’s life and we should keep politics out of it.
summary: pakistan is using mr Jadhav as a pawn to put India in a bad light

headline: GDP growth seen slowing to 4-year low of 6.5% in 2017-18
article:
The Central Statistics Office (CSO) on Friday forecast that GDP growth in the current financial year ending March 31 will slow to a four-year low of 6.5%, from the provisional 7.1% pace seen in 2016-17, dragged down by deceleration in the agriculture and manufacturing sectors.

Gross Value Added (GVA) was also projected to expand by 6.1% in 2017-18, slowing from 6.6% in the preceding fiscal year, according to the first advance estimates of national income for 2017-18, released by the CSO.
summary: CSO forecast GDP at the end of march 31 will be lowest in the 4 year

headline: Train coaches to paint 30,000 Mail, Express coaches in new colour
article:
Indian Railways would be repainting all Mail and Express trains, except Rajdhani, Shatabdi, Duronto and newly launched Tejas, Gatimaan and Humsafar Express, with a new color scheme - beige and brown.
The new color scheme will replace the dark blue color, which was introduced in 1990s replacing the brick red color introduced earlier.
The first train to sport the new look will be Delhi-Pathankot Express, 16 coaches of which have been repainted with the new colour scheme. The freshly-painted train will be rolled out by this month-end.
Railways would be repainting about 30,000 conventional coaches manufactured at the Integral Coach Factory in Chennai.
"A complete makeover of coaches was long overdue and the new colour scheme was applied in trains after it was finally approved by Railways Minister Piyush Goyal," IANS quoted a Railways Ministry official as saying.
Railways has been working to improve the exterior and interior of the trains better passenger experience. Some of the interior changes include replacement of old train toilets with bio-toilets, mobile charging ports and reading lights at each berth, comfortable seats, improved ladders for access to upper berth, LED berth indicators and clean blankets.
Railways had roped in National Institute of Fashion Technology and National Institute of Design in 2015 to provide designs for modern coaches.
summary: Indian Railways is giving Mail and Express trains a new beige and brown color scheme, replacing the 1990s dark blue. The upgrade includes 30,000 coaches from the Integral Coach Factory in Chennai. The Delhi-Pathankot Express will be the first to feature this change. Railways Minister Piyush Goyal approved the decision for an improved passenger experience, which also encompasses bio-toilets, charging ports, reading lights, comfortable seats, better access to upper berths, LED indicators, and clean blankets. Designs for modern coaches were contributed by the National Institute of Fashion Technology and the National Institute of Design in 2015.

headline: Withdraw FIR in Aadhaar case: Congress
article:
The Congress on Monday said if the Modi government believed in freedom of speech and expression, it must instruct the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) to withdraw immediately criminal proceedings against the journalist and the newspaper that exposed Aadhaar data leaks.

“If the government believes in the freedom of the press, then the true test of it is that UIDAI must withdraw the FIR. The Aadhaar authority comes under the Central government and it must unilaterally withdraw the FIR. That is where the proof of the pudding would be whether this government believes in the freedom of speech and expression or the freedom of the press,” former Information and Broadcasting Minister Manish Tewari said at a Congress briefing.
summary: congress said that Modi gov. should take back the FIR against journalists and newspaper who exposed Aadhar data leaks

headline: Epidemic breaks down in Mumbai
article:
MUMBAI: Maharashtra government today declared outbreak of epidemic in municipal areas of Mumbai and Kalyan-Dombivali in neighbouring Thane district.%0D%0ASixty six people have died of suspected Leptospirosis in the city and Thane district following torrential rains and subsequent floods last month, Health Minister Vimaltai Mundada said here today.
Thirty seven cases of suspected Leptospirisis were reported from city alone and 29 in Kalyan-Dombivali municipal limits, she told reporters.%0D%0AIn view of increasing cases of high fever and suspected Leptosporisis, the government has declared outbreak of epidemic in these areas, the Minister said.
summary: The Maharashtra government has declared an epidemic outbreak in the municipal areas of Mumbai and Kalyan-Dombivali in Thane district. This decision comes after heavy rains and subsequent floods led to suspected cases of Leptospirosis, causing 66 deaths in the city and Thane district. Health Minister Vimaltai Mundada reported 37 cases in Mumbai and 29 in Kalyan-Dombivali. Due to the rising cases of high fever and suspected Leptospirosis, the government took this step to address the situation.

headline: Pakistan releases 147 fishermen
article:
In one of the biggest “goodwill” gestures in recent months, Pakistan on Monday sent back 147 Indian fishermen.

The repatriation came a week after both sides exchanged the names of prisoners in each other’s custody, as part of confidence-building measure.
summary: Pakistan releases 147 Indian Fishermen as a goodwill gesture, and both shared names of the prisoners in other's custody

headline: Vehicles to soon 'overtake Goa population'
article:
Even as the vehicle population in Goa is increasing rapidly, deaths due to road accidents have come down by 14 per cent.

According to police statistics, last year from January to April, 121 persons were killed in road accidents while this year during the same period, 104 persons lost their lives on roads.



The number of road accidents, however, has remained similar to mishaps that occurred last year during this period with only one per cent decrease. In 2017, a total of 1,358 road accidents were reported whereas this year, 1,345 accidents have been reported between January and April.



The number of two-wheeler riders dying in road accidents has decreased by around 19 per cent. A total of 64 riders have died in road accidents during the first four months this year, while 79 riders lost their lives during the same period last year.



The vehicle population of Goa will soon be equal to human population in the state and the number of vehicles in the state is expected to surpass the population within three months.



While the population stands at approximately 14.59 lakh, the number of registered vehicles in the state is now 14.30 lakh.



By implication, this indicates at least one vehicle owned per family in the state, and in many cases, a combination of either a four-wheeler or two-wheelers.



The number of vehicles in the state increased by 7.6 per cent in 2017-18 with 72 per cent registered vehicles being two-wheelers. There has been an average growth of 7-8 per cent in vehicle registration year-on-year which touches upto 40 per cent during the festive season.



According to the transport department, everyday over 200 vehicles are added to the population of the vehicular traffic. Out of this, 160 are two-wheelers and remaining vehicles include four-wheelers and other commercial vehicles.



A transport department official admitted that this has led to massive traffic management issues in most parts of the state and also an increase in pollution. The increase in vehicle population also leads to traffic rule violations.



"In the state, two-wheelers outnumber four-wheelers, and bikers are the main victims in road
summary:
Even as the vehicle population in Goa is increasing rapidly, deaths due to road accidents have come down by 14 per cent.
According to police statistics, last year from January to April, 121 persons were killed in road accidents while this year during the same period, 104 persons lost their lives on roads.
In 2017, a total of 1,358 road accidents were reported whereas this year, 1,345 accidents have been reported between January and April.
The number of two-wheeler riders dying in road accidents has decreased by around 19 per cent.
A total of 64 riders have died in road accidents during the first four months this year, while 79 riders lost their lives during the same period last year.
The number of vehicles in the state increased by 7.6 per cent in 2017-18 with 72 per cent registered vehicles being two-wheelers.

headline: Parties pad up for ‘semi-finals’ in Rajasthan
article:
Battle lines have been drawn for the byelections in Rajasthan later this month, with both the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Opposition Congress announcing their candidates for the Alwar and the Ajmer Lok Sabha seats, and the Mandalgarh Assembly seat.

Karan Singh Yadav of the Congress filed his nomination papers from Alwar on Monday.
summary: BJP and congress ready for the elections in Rajasthan,  both announced their candidates from Alwar and Ajmer

headline: Brands from Apple to IKEA seen gaining on retail fillip
article:
International single brand retailers from Apple Inc. to furniture giant IKEA, Nike and Dell would find it attractive to set up shop or expand existing operations in India in the wake of the government’s move to allow 100% foreign direct investment (FDI) in single brand retail via the automatic route and ease sourcing norms, according to analysts.

Rajesh Thakkar - Tax & Regulatory Partner, BDO India said the Indian marketplace was likely to witness a stiffer fight between Indian and global brands.
summary: Retail companies like IKEA, Nike , apple,etcc. are attracted to india and are planning to set up shops in india as gov. allows 100% FDI

headline: Air quality in capital city of Panaji deteriorating
article:
The data has exposed an alarming reality, revealing that the inhalable particulate matter (PM10) of less than ten microns in diameter (a fifth the width of a human hair) in the air in Panaji was of unacceptable level for almost half of the monitoring days, that is, out of the total 23 days of monitoring for three months, 12 days reported 'moderate' air quality, posing a health risk to people.

The main contributors towards the increase in the PM10 levels have been identified as the ongoing road construction, building demolition, fire smoke, vehicle and truck exhaust and other human activities. Since the situation has become worse over the last three months, the pollution control board has urged for swift action to reduce the pollution level.

High levels of PM10 recorded in the last three months

Panaji

With Panaji recording high levels of inhalable particulate matter (PM10) multiple times in the last three months, the capital city's air quality deteriorated to the 'moderate' category for a maximum number of the monitoring days in the air quality index.

The air quality in Panaji has fallen from the 'satisfactory' and 'good' category to the 'satisfactory' and 'moderate' category, according to the Goa State Pollution Control Board (GSPCB).

'Moderate' air quality level indicates minor discomfort to sensitive people, while the 'satisfactory' level indicates minor discomfort to children and older people with lung and heart diseases. The GSPCB has noted that the PM10 levels in the city for January, February and March this year have been significantly higher than those recorded during the corresponding period last year. Surprisingly, from January to March this year, there was not a single day with 'good' air quality in Panaji.
summary:
The data has exposed an alarming reality, revealing that the inhalable particulate matter (PM10) of less than ten microns in diameter (a fifth the width of a human hair) in the air in Panaji was of unacceptable level for almost half of the monitoring days, that is, out of the total 23 days of monitoring for three months, 12 days reported 'moderate' air quality, posing a health risk to people.
Since the situation has become worse over the last three months, the pollution control board has urged for swift action to reduce the pollution level.
High levels of PM10 recorded in the last three monthsPanajiWith Panaji recording high levels of inhalable particulate matter (PM10) multiple times in the last three months, the capital city's air quality deteriorated to the 'moderate' category for a maximum number of the monitoring days in the air quality index.
Surprisingly, from January to March this year, there was not a single day with 'good' air quality in Panaji.

headline: 11 killed in Maoist attack in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada
article:
Multi-Utility Vehicle (MUV) carrying ten DRG jawans was blown up between Aranpur and Sameli villages, the IGP said. All ten jawans and the civilian driver of the vehicle were killed on the spot, he added. The MUV had been rented by the security personnel, said another official.

Reinforcement was rushed to the spot and the bodies of the deceased were brought to Dantewada, the IGP said. Security personnel have launched a search operation in the area, he added.

Another senior police official posted in Dantewada said that around 200 security personnel had set out from Dantewada district headquarters on Tuesday night after getting information about the presence of Maoists belonging to the Darbha division in the area.

On Wednesday morning, there was an exchange of fire between the patrolling team and Naxals near Nahadi village, around seven km from Aranpur, following which two suspected Naxals were held, he said on the condition of anonymity.

Subsequently, security personnel were returning to their base in a convoy of vehicles, he said. There was a gap of around 100-150 metres between vehicles, and the Naxals targeted the second vehicle in the convoy, he said.

After the blast, the security personnel in the leading and following vehicles took positions and opened fire on both sides of the jungle, the official said. Visuals from the spot showed a huge crater across the road at the blast site, almost ten-feet deep.

Dantewada

Ten police personnel and a civilian driver were killed after Naxals blew up a vehicle, which was part of a convoy carrying security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Wednesday, an official said.

This was the biggest strike by the Maoists on the security forces in the state in the last two years.

The blast, carried out using an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) containing an estimated 40 kg of explosive material, took place under Aranpur police station area between 1 p.m. and 1:30 p.m. when a team of the state police's District Reserve Guard (DRG) was out on an anti-Naxal operation, Inspector General of Police (Bastar Range) Sundarraj P. said.

Personnel of DRG are mostly recruited from the local tribal population and trained to combat Maoists. Sometimes surrendered Maoists are also recruited in the DRG. The area where the blast took place is around 450 km from state capital Raipur.

Police vehicle blows up in blast carried out using IED
summary:
Multi-Utility Vehicle (MUV) carrying ten DRG jawans was blown up between Aranpur and Sameli villages, the IGP said.
All ten jawans and the civilian driver of the vehicle were killed on the spot, he added.
Security personnel have launched a search operation in the area, he added.
Visuals from the spot showed a huge crater across the road at the blast site, almost ten-feet deep.
DantewadaTen police personnel and a civilian driver were killed after Naxals blew up a vehicle, which was part of a convoy carrying security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Wednesday, an official said.
This was the biggest strike by the Maoists on the security forces in the state in the last two years.

headline: World Bank projects 7.3% growth for India
article:
India’s growth rate in 2018 is projected to hit 7.3% and 7.5% in the next two years, according to the World Bank, which said the country has “enormous growth potential” compared to other emerging economies with the implementation of comprehensive reforms. India is estimated to have grown at 6.7% in 2017 despite initial setbacks from demonetisation and the Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to the 2018 Global Economics Prospect released by the World Bank here.

“In all likelihood, India is going to register higher growth rate than other major emerging market economies in the next decade. So, I wouldn’t focus on the short-term numbers. I would look at the big picture for India and big picture is telling us that it has enormous potential,” Ayhan Kose, director, Development Prospects Group at the World Bank, told PTI in an interview.
summary: according to world bank in next 2 years india's growth rate will go from 7.3% to 7.5%

headline: Arunachal: Mayor Tame Phassang inspected under-construction IMC Office Building
article:
ITANAGAR-  To take stock of  the under-construction Office Building  of  Itanagar Municipal Corporation (IMC), Mayor -Tame Phassang along with Commissioner-IMC  Likha Tejji , corporators and Engineers today inspected the office building at Chimpu.
 While interacting with the Engineers, Mayor advised the official not to compromise the quality of the work.
‘As of now there is no permanent office building for IMC, and running in a rental building at Niti Vihar, due to which the public even IMC staff has to face various problems. So we are trying our best to complete the offices soon as possible for the convenience of the public, added Mayor while speaking to the Media. He also informed that, by the next 15-20 days remaining work of the building will be completed.
Earlier, responding to the allegation leveled by Arunachal Jankalyan Sanghathan (AJS) claiming corruption in the IMC, Mayor categorically stated that the ‘allegation is baseless and he well-come every investigation, provided there should be proper substantial documents about the allegation and the person should be apolitical. One should not malign the hard-earned image of others for the sake to gain publicity or for personal benefits, added Mayor.


Phassang also asserted that not a single penny of the 15th  or 14th  Finance Commission was misused by the IMC, even the funds of the 14th Finance Commission are still with the authority. Some Funds under the 14th FFC were used by the authority for a different project in the capital region only, that too when IMC was in a dormant stage due to the halt of the election process, and the new IMC team hasn’t used any new funds as of now, informed Mayor.
summary:
ITANAGAR-  To take stock of  the under-construction Office Building  of  Itanagar Municipal Corporation (IMC), Mayor -Tame Phassang along with Commissioner-IMC  Likha Tejji , corporators and Engineers today inspected the office building at Chimpu.
He also informed that, by the next 15-20 days remaining work of the building will be completed.
Earlier, responding to the allegation leveled by Arunachal Jankalyan Sanghathan (AJS) claiming corruption in the IMC, Mayor categorically stated that the 'allegation is baseless and he well-come every investigation, provided there should be proper substantial documents about the allegation and the person should be apolitical.
Phassang also asserted that not a single penny of the 15th  or 14th  Finance Commission was misused by the IMC, even the funds of the 14th Finance Commission are still with the authority.

headline: Arunachal: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao launched in Papum Pare
article:
YUPIA- Papum Pare DC Cheechung Chukhu called for data mapping of various girl  child  welfare schemes in Education, WCD and Health department to get an overview of the implementation  of the schemes and its reach to the beneficiaries in the last mile.


He said this while launching the Beti Bachao Beti Padhao campaign for Papum Pare district from the DC Conference, Hall Yupia on Tuesday last.

This excercise will provide us a ready reference and facilitate necessary interventions wherever the indicators such enrollment  and drop out rates in the schools, registrations under Dulari Kanya, Vidya scheme etc are low,” He added.

DC Chukhu also called for intensified IEC activities on govt initiatives to improve the girl child sex ratio and exhorted the health, WCD, Education and Panchayat Raj departments for convergence on IEC related activities.

DD , ICDS Smt. Aroty Tayeng while highlighting the objectives of the campaign informed that the campaign seeks to prevent ‘gender baised sex selection; ensure survival and protection of the girl child and to ensure education for the girl child.’


She further informed that the District Task Force for Beti Bachao Beti Padhao with DC as chairman; SP,DMO,DDSE, DLSA,AD( Economic s and Statistics),DPDO as members will monitor the implementation of the scheme at the circle level .

DMO Dr. Komlin Perme and DDSE T.T.Tara highlighted the girl child oriented schemes under Health and Education department respectively.



DDSE Tara also informed that Papum Pare with four Netaji  Subhash  Chandra Bose  𝙰𝚊𝚠𝚊𝚜𝚒𝚢𝚊 Vidyalaya girls residential schools , one each at Yupia, Nonpu, Sagalee and Mengio has improved the girls enrollment to schools.

PD cum DPDO Bengia Yakar, representative from DLSA  also attended the meeting.
summary:
YUPIA- Papum Pare DC Cheechung Chukhu called for data mapping of various girl  child  welfare schemes in Education, WCD and Health department to get an overview of the implementation  of the schemes and its reach to the beneficiaries in the last mile.
He said this while launching the Beti Bachao Beti Padhao campaign for Papum Pare district from the DC Conference, Hall Yupia on Tuesday last.
DC Chukhu also called for intensified IEC activities on govt initiatives to improve the girl child sex ratio and exhorted the health, WCD, Education and Panchayat Raj departments for convergence on IEC related activities.
Aroty Tayeng while highlighting the objectives of the campaign informed that the campaign seeks to prevent 'gender baised sex selection; ensure survival and protection of the girl child and to ensure education for the girl child.

headline: Arunachal: ’56th Engineers Day’ Celebrated at Himalayan University
article:
ITANAGAR- In a vibrant celebration that paid tribute to one of India’s most esteemed engineers, M. Visvesvaraya, the Department of Civil Engineering at Himalayan University organized its 56th Engineers Day with great fervor. The event was inaugurated with the traditional lighting of the lamp by Dr. K. Karthikeyan, the esteemed Registrar of Himalayan University.


The occasion was graced by distinguished faculty members and students who gathered to commemorate the birth anniversary of Sir M. Visvesvaraya, a luminary in the field of engineering. The event opened with a warm welcome speech delivered by Mr. Rashidul Alam, Assistant Professor in the Department of Civil Engineering. In his eloquent address, he shared words of wisdom and set the tone for the day’s festivities.


Dr. Karthikeyan, in his address, shed light on the remarkable journey of Sir Visvesvaraya and his invaluable contributions to the world of engineering. He motivated the students present to harness their creativity and innovation, encouraging them to follow in the footsteps of this engineering icon.

The event continued with insightful speeches by Dr. Malam, Assistant Dean (Academic), and Dr. Dipong, who both shared their perspectives on the significance of Engineers Day. Their words resonated with the audience, emphasizing the importance of engineering in shaping the modern world.

One of the highlights of the day was the captivating cultural performances presented by the talented students from the Department of Civil Engineering. The audience was treated to a mesmerizing display of cultural diversity through music, dance, and drama, showcasing the unity and talent within the department.



In the spirit of friendly competition, the event culminated in a thrilling cricket match between the faculty and students of the Civil Engineering department. To everyone’s surprise, the students demonstrated their exceptional skills and teamwork by clinching victory with 6 wickets to spare. It was a match filled with camaraderie and sportsmanship, demonstrating that engineering minds are not just sharp in the classroom but also on the field.

The entire program was orchestrated seamlessly under the guidance of Mr. Talkeshwar Ray, Assistant Professor and Coordinator of the Department of Civil Engineering at Himalayan University. His meticulous planning ensured that the event proceeded smoothly and left a lasting impact on everyone in attendance.

The proceedings came to a close with a heartfelt vote of thanks delivered by Miss Meenali Modi, Head of Department (in charge) for Civil Engineering. She expressed her gratitude to all the participants, organizers, and attendees, acknowledging their collective effort in making the 56th Engineers Day celebration a resounding success.

The day’s events were not just a tribute to a legendary engineer but also a testament to the spirit of innovation and camaraderie that thrives within the Department of Civil Engineering at Himalayan University. It was a day filled with inspiration, celebration, and the promise of a bright future for budding engineers.


As we reflect on this memorable occasion, we are reminded of the immense potential that engineering holds in shaping a sustainable and innovative world for generations to come. Himalayan University’s 56th Engineers Day celebration serves as a shining example of how engineering excellence and a sense of community can go hand in hand.
summary:
ITANAGAR- In a vibrant celebration that paid tribute to one of India's most esteemed engineers, M. Visvesvaraya, the Department of Civil Engineering at Himalayan University organized its 56th Engineers Day with great fervor.
The occasion was graced by distinguished faculty members and students who gathered to commemorate the birth anniversary of Sir M. Visvesvaraya, a luminary in the field of engineering.
In the spirit of friendly competition, the event culminated in a thrilling cricket match between the faculty and students of the Civil Engineering department.
The day's events were not just a tribute to a legendary engineer but also a testament to the spirit of innovation and camaraderie that thrives within the Department of Civil Engineering at Himalayan University.
Himalayan University's 56th Engineers Day celebration serves as a shining example of how engineering excellence and a sense of community can go hand in hand.

headline: Rotary Club offers to buy GPS for Kolkata police
article: kolkata: in the usa, when a kidnapping happens for a ransom, the first thing that the police uses is a gadget called the global positioning system (gps). in india, only the mumbai police uses it. in kolkata the police have only heard of it, and it may take decades and 20 more kidnappings before it is acquired, feels senior criminologist, raman khanna. khanna has worked as consulting criminologist with police forces not only in major cities in india and abroad. he did his doctoral research in criminology from oldham college, england, where he resided before deciding to finally return to india and settle in kolkata. "if a person is kidnapped and a relative is taking the ransom money to a pre-decided place, the police would provide him with a bag in which to carry the money. the bag is nothing but a part of the gps gadget. a computer with the police are able to trace the position of the bag as it moves and finally the police are able to identify the spot", khanna explains, adding that this is just one of the many popular ways in which a gps is used by the police. he compares the geographical position of bengal with that of usa, "just as a kidnapper here might cross the border and take his hostage to bihar or orissa, similarly, a kidnapper in texas generally crosses the district and goes into hiding in minnesota." but while it takes a long time for the police of our two states to co-ordinate and crack down on the criminals, "there all kidnapping cases are handled by the fbi alone, so naturally communication is much speedier, naturally their results are much better." khanna feels that after the roy burman case the police in bengal have suddenly sat up, "but this should have happened long ago. though the people are generally aware of the two kidnappings - that of the exide boss s.b. ganguly and this one, actually there have been quite a few kidnappings in this city involving businessmen in the past five years. though these haven't got much publicity, the police were aware of each individual case and by now they should have been better prepared to handle kidnappings". kidnapping as a crime is about five years old in this city, khanna says, adding that apart from gadgets, what the police require is also a trained negotiator to talk to the kidnappers over ransom. "what can be more primitive than leaving it on desperate family members to do it." khanna says that while in mumbai, where the incidence of kidnapping is the highest, the police have already started cataloguing patterns of crime, criminal gangs and their areas of operation. "no such thing exists here." khanna works in close association with the enforcement branch of the city police, to nab people who manufacture items or drugs duplicating trademarks of corporates houses, in his capacity as director of hawk intelligence services private limited. khanna, an assistant governor of the rotary club, says, " rotary clubs have ample funds to buy interceptive gadgets like gps for our police, because on consulting senior officers of the police over this i have been told that though they are eager, they hardly have funds. i will soon meet the chief minister and discuss the matter with him."
summary: In the USA, the police use a gadget called the Global Positioning System (GPS) to track kidnappings for ransom. However, in India, only the Mumbai police have adopted this technology. Kolkata, for instance, is yet to acquire and implement GPS for such purposes, which senior criminologist Raman Khanna believes may take decades and more kidnappings before it is adopted. GPS can be crucial in tracking ransom payments and identifying the location of the ransom drop. Khanna highlights the importance of GPS in resolving kidnapping cases and mentions the need for trained negotiators to communicate with kidnappers during ransom negotiations. He also emphasizes the need for better coordination and data cataloging within the police force to effectively combat kidnapping crimes. Khanna intends to discuss funding for GPS technology with the Chief Minister to support law enforcement efforts in Kolkata.

headline: Three killed in bus mishap in Bihar
article: muzaffarpur (bihar): three persons were killed and over 24 injured, three of them seriously, when a mini bus overturned here friday, police said. the ill-fated bus was on its way to muzaffarpur from sahebganj. the injured were admitted to the shrikrishna medical college hospital here, they said.
summary: In Muzaffarpur, Bihar, a tragic accident occurred when a mini-bus en route from Sahebganj to Muzaffarpur overturned. This accident resulted in three fatalities and left over 24 individuals injured, with three of them in serious condition. The injured passengers were promptly transported to the Shrikrishna Medical College Hospital for medical care.

headline: Three children die in fire
article: midnapore: three children were burnt to death after a kerosene stove burst in a hut in kolgachia village in midnapore district thursday night, police said friday. two others of the family and the cook were admitted to hospital with serious burns, they said.
summary: In a tragic incident in Kolgachia village, Midnapore district, three children lost their lives when a kerosene stove in their hut burst into flames. Two other family members and the cook also sustained serious burns and were admitted to the hospital for medical treatment.

headline: Face-recognition: Breakthrough in crime fighting
article: washington: face-recognition is the latest technique being tried out in fighting crime in several other countries, including the us and china. face-recognition software analyses the spaces and angles of up to 80 key points on a person's face. data from only 14 to 20 such points are enough to create a unique digital "face print" that can then be compared with an existing database of face prints. joseph atick, chairman and ceo of visionics corp and an inventor of face-recognition technology, said used with survellance cameras, the monitoring system can scan faces in a store, on a street or at a sporting event for those wanted by the police. the technology was used at this year's super bowl (football finals) to scan for criminals and possible terrorists. atick told reporters his company was doing business in roughly 50 to 60 nations. one aplication being considered in china is at bank teller machines where one's face becomes one's password. it is especially useful when not all account-holders are literate. atick said that the company would not sell the system to iraq, libya or iran because these are "states of concern" to the us. the system has been used in mexico on a small scale to prevent voter fraud. in newham, a neighbourhood in london, incidents of crime have dropped by 40 per cent since the system was installed two years ago, he claimed. the us congress plans a hearing on the issue next month
summary: Face-recognition technology is being used in various countries, including the US and China, to combat crime. This technology involves analyzing key points on a person's face to create a unique digital "face print" that can be compared with a database of such prints. It is employed with surveillance cameras to scan faces in public spaces for individuals wanted by the police. The technology was even used at events like the Super Bowl to identify potential criminals and terrorists. Some potential applications include using face-recognition at bank teller machines, where a person's face serves as their password, making it accessible for illiterate account holders. However, there are restrictions on selling this technology to certain countries considered concerns by the US government, such as Iraq, Libya, and Iran. In some areas, like Newham in London, the implementation of face-recognition systems has led to a significant reduction in crime. The US Congress is planning a hearing on this technology in the near future.

headline: China's first cloned cattle in January
article: beijing: china's first cloned cattle is expected to be born by january next year, the state media reported on saturday. a group of cloned cattle embryos have been growing well for three months and they are under close supervision, xinhua news agency reported. researchers removed some cells from the ears of a fine-breed beef bull and a high-yield milk cow, combined them with the oocytes of a cow from west shandong and successfully implanted the cloned embryos in cows. the crucial technological problems of cloning cattle have been solved, and the success of this experiment will bring great benefits to china's livestock husbandry industry, said an expert with the biological centre in the shandong academy of agricultural sciences.
summary: China is expecting its first cloned cattle to be born by January of the following year. A group of cloned cattle embryos have been developing well for three months, with close supervision from researchers. The cloning process involved removing cells from a fine-breed beef bull and a high-yield milk cow's ears, combining them with the oocytes of a cow from West Shandong, and successfully implanting the cloned embryos in cows. This successful experiment marks the resolution of crucial technological challenges in cloning cattle and holds great promise for China's livestock husbandry industry.

headline: 8 ultras, securityman killed in Kashmir
article: srinagar: eight militants and a security jawan were killed in separate encounters, while security forces unearthed three arms dumps in the kashmir valley since friday night, a defence spokesman said on saturday. three pakistani militants were killed in an operation launched by the security forces in shrinkar forests near suntwari in machil sector of frontier district of kupwara. a large quantity of arms and ammunition were recovered from the militants who were killed during the clash with the security forces. two militants were killed by the security forces in another encounter which took place at samsin village in badgam district of central kashmir on friday night. two ak assault rifles, an under-barrel grenade launcher, two wireless sets, four grenades and some ammunitions were recovered from them, kesman said. he said troops gunned down two more militants in separate encounters at charkote-gagal in kupwara and saloosa-pattan in baramulla on friday night. three ak assault rifles, a hand grenade and some ammunition were recovered from the slain militants. a security jawan was killed during the encounter in which a house where the militants had taken shelter was razed to the ground, official sources said. bsf troops killed a militant of pakistan-occupied kashmir in an encounter at santosh post in kupwara district early on saturday. a rifle, four magazines with 120 rounds and two grenades were recovered from him, the sources said. another militant was arrested by bsf and two rockets and four explosive sticks were recovered during search operations at satpora-tutigund in kupwara on friday night. the police arrested six youths along with their guide at shola in border town of uri in north kashmir while they were trying to cross the loc, the sources said. a militant hideout was busted by bsf and six lethal anti-tank rifle grenades recovered from chan mohalla locality in sringar on friday. army troops destroyed two more hideouts, one each at lash dat nar near the loc in kupwara and watlab-shiva in sopore area of baramulla on friday, the sources said, adding seven kgs of rdx, 25 grenades, 10 rpg rockets with boosters, four solar rockets with two fuses, one remote control device and 54 explosive sticks were recovered from there.
summary: In a series of security operations in the Kashmir Valley, eight militants and one security jawan were killed in separate encounters. The incidents occurred in various locations, with several Pakistani militants among those neutralized. Security forces also discovered three arms dumps during these operations, confiscating a significant amount of arms and ammunition. These encounters and discoveries are part of ongoing efforts to maintain security in the region.

headline: College admission marks, but only on demand
article: lucknow: the admission process is again under a cloud. this follows complaints of lack of transparency by guardians and students alike. the common refrain of candidates seeking admission was that college authorities declared lists of admitted candidates sans marks and merit of the applicants. while in lucknow university the practise was that the list of selected candidates mentioned the percentage numbers and the merit of the student simultaneously, the practise followed in colleges was that only the names of the admitted candidates were displayed on the notice boards with no mention of other details. this, the candidates complained, was creating confusion. out of 28 odd associated degree colleges of lucknow university, few had adopted admission tests as the basis for selecting candidates. others still followed the method of admissions on the basis of marks secured by the student in his/her intermediate board examinations. however, most of the colleges did not mention merit details alongside the names of selected candidates as displayed on the college lists. some guardians called up this newspaper on friday and complained that they suspected a possibility of manipulations in admissions. "why have the marks obtained in the admission test by selected candidates not been mentioned on the admission list?" said an infuriated a c shukla, an employee of a private firm whose daughter had applied for admissions in a leading girls' college. some candidates also made similar complaints to the lu students' union. reacting to these complaints, lusu general secretary bajrangi singh bajju said that lusu would ask the vice-chancellor to direct college authorities to make public all the details regarding admissions. he said that there were also complaints that despite repeated requests, college authorities were not providing candidates with their admissions result details. when contacted, principal of jnpg degree college g s trivedi said that 'marks' were not mentioned with the admission list because of various complexities. "while on the one hand we have to sort out candidates as per reservation quota, on the other they have to be categorise as per the examination boards," he said. "but," he said, "we provide all the details to the candidate on demand."
summary: The admission process in Lucknow is facing criticism due to a lack of transparency. Students and guardians have raised concerns about the absence of merit and marks information in admission lists published by colleges. While Lucknow University typically includes percentage marks and merit alongside the list of admitted candidates, colleges have been displaying only the names of selected applicants, causing confusion. Some individuals suspect possible manipulations in the admission process due to this lack of information. The Lucknow University Students' Union (LUSU) plans to request the Vice-Chancellor to ensure that colleges provide complete admission details to maintain transparency. College authorities have cited complexities as the reason for not including marks on the admission lists.

headline: Students lack in-depth knowledge'
article: kolkata: a recent survey conducted by the national council of education research and training (ncert) among toppers from schools in kolkata reveal that despite scoring more than 90 per cent marks in the madhaymik examination, students lack in knowledge that they ought to have learned in the schools. none of the students, selected from students of seven well-known schools all over the city, fared badly. students from these schools, all under west bengal board of secondary education, showed a lack of in-depth knowledge and understanding of all the main subjects that constitute the syllabus of the madhyamik examination. the examination was conducted on physical science, life science, history and geography. according to ncert officials, the study was done as a part of the central government's policy of bringing about some uniformity among the different state boards. "the study is the first phase of this exercise. the second phase would be evaluating efficacy of the state boards" an ncert official said. the study was done by indian institute of bio-behavioural science in kolkata, on behalf of ncert. principal investigator of the study, ranjit basu, a professor of applied psychology in the university of kolkata, said "though there is no dearth of intelligence, but our education system is such, it does not allow the student to actually learn and understand the subject. we selected best of schools and only those students who scored above 90 per cent but the results of the test were quite appalling and horrifying." schools selected for the study are patha bhawan, loreto day, town, alipore multipurpose, bidyabharati girl's school and cit bagmari boy's. "the method we used for evaluation is called 'the structure of observed learning (solo) taxonomy' developed by biggs and collis (1982) and aimed at finding out the discrepancies between formal learning and the quality of learning among the student population. we wanted to determine efficiency of formal school education or school effectiveness. though there are different yardsticks, we took the madhyamink as an index of formal learning" he said. the study classified the 297 (161 male and 137 female) students in five categories. the highest category students are expected to provide a comprehensive explanation including content both from the text as well as knowledge outside the text. (students able to give references, common experiences, opinions, suggestions) no student could score enough to be in the highest category. "questions were not tough, but they were framed differently and were not the straight forward subjective ones" basu said. maximum students belonged to the medium category, 52 per cent in physical science, 56 per cent in life science, 32 per cent in history and 42 per cent in geography. the study reveals that quite few students fared so bad that they could not even cross the most primary level of response. since last two years, ncert have been trying to standardise the education system of the country and make the education system more uniform and synchronised. the same study is being done in all the states and the findings are send to ncert. the study on west bengal state will be submitted to ncert in next few weeks before it starts the second phase action. "the project started in late 1998 and it now is providing us with a database. only after analysing the data, we will decide on what to do in the next phase" claimed an ncert official.
summary: A survey conducted by the National Council of Education Research and Training (NCERT) in Kolkata revealed that high-achieving students with over 90% marks in the Madhyamik examination lacked in-depth knowledge and understanding of their subjects. The survey assessed students from seven renowned schools under the West Bengal Board of Secondary Education. It focused on subjects like physical science, life science, history, and geography. The study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of the state boards and promote uniformity in the education system across India. The results showed that most students fell into the medium category, indicating a lack of comprehensive knowledge, and very few students reached the highest category. The NCERT's initiative seeks to standardize and synchronize the Indian education system.

headline: Lok Dal extends support to Rajnath govt
article: lucknow: the nine-member lok dal has decided to extend its support to the rajnath singh government, state unit president kailash nath singh yadav said here on saturday. crisis in up"we have spoken to all the legislators and there is no difference of opinion in the party over the issue of extending support to the state government", yadav said. he said that a formal meeting of the party's legislature group would be held soon in this regard. yadav said his party would fill the gap created by the withdrawal of support by the loktantrik congress party to the uttar pradesh government and maintained there was no threat to the ministry. claiming support of four independents to the bjp-led government, yadav said they had also agreed to join the lok dal.
summary: The nine-member Lok Dal party in Uttar Pradesh has decided to extend its support to the Rajnath Singh-led state government. Kailash Nath Singh Yadav, the state unit president of Lok Dal, stated that there is unanimity within the party regarding the decision to support the government. The party intends to hold a formal meeting of its legislative group soon to formalize this support. Lok Dal aims to fill the gap created by the withdrawal of support from the Loktantrik Congress party, and Yadav expressed confidence that there is no imminent threat to the stability of the government. Additionally, Lok Dal claims the support of four independent legislators who have agreed to join the party.

headline: TTK makes a 'Smart' move in cookers world
article: bangalore: in the boring old world of pressure cookers, market leader ttk prestige believes it has unleashed a pressure cooker which will make the stagnant market grow. the innovation - prestige smart - comes after many years of silence from the company and a flat turnover. but t.t. jagannathan, cmd, ttk prestige ltd, said smart, with its sleek good looks and new features like a three-way control knob, a double life gasket and a unidirectional weight valve which ensures that the steam is released in one direction only, will rekindle static sales. at a press conference here on friday, ttk prestige officially launched prestige smart, priced at rs 797 onwards across a range of 12 models of cookers and pans with various combination packs. smart will be available across karnataka from next week and a replacement scheme will also be announced soon. and once the product consolidates its presence, ttk plans to introduce two more innovative pressure cooker models that are currently under development. these new products are expected to be unveiled next year. ttk prestige has a 30 per cent market share in pressure cookers in india but turnover has been flat for the last few years at around rs 150 crore. the company intends to maintain its current export level of 20 per cent of production and has already begun exports of another version of smart. it sells pressure cookers in the us under the mantra brand name and has sold 1.2 million units in that country so far. the losses of rs 3 crore which ttk prestige recorded last fiscal are expected to be wiped out in a couple of years with the new launches, jagannathan said.
summary: TTK Prestige, the market leader in the Indian pressure cooker industry, has introduced an innovative pressure cooker called Prestige Smart. This new product features a sleek design and various improvements, such as a three-way control knob, a double-life gasket, and a unidirectional weight valve. These enhancements are expected to reinvigorate the stagnant market, as the company aims to increase its market share and boost revenues. TTK Prestige also plans to introduce two more innovative pressure cooker models in the near future as part of its strategy to expand and reposition itself in the industry.

headline: Tharoor sets record straight on Nehru controversy
article: At a hurriedly convened press conference on Sunday morning for which he turned up late because of extended fire-fighting telephone conversations with the Prime Minister and other Congress leaders, Mr. Tharoor came out all guns blazing. A day after reports about Shashi Tharoor’s purported criticism of Congress icons Nehru and Gandhi prompted some party leaders to censure him, the Minister of State for External Affairs came down heavily on the media for misquoting his remarks and demanded an apology from three newspapers. Mr. Tharoor chaired a talk by Lord Bhikhu Parekh at the Indian Council of World Affairs on Friday. The next day, some newspapers and TV channels said Lord Parekh had “blasted” Nehru and Gandhi and that the junior foreign minister had endorsed his negative assessment of the impact they had had on the conduct of Indian foreign policy.
summary: Shashi Tharoor, the Minister of State for External Affairs, criticized Congress icons Nehru and Gandhi at a press conference, causing some party leaders to censure him. Tharoor criticized the media for misquoting his remarks and demanded an apology from three newspapers. He chaired a talk by Lord Bhikhu Parekh at the Indian Council of World Affairs, which was later criticized by some newspapers and TV channels for "blasting" Nehru and Gandhi and endorsed his negative assessment of their impact on Indian foreign policy.

headline: Need to work in mission mode to help artisans: PM Modi
article:
Stressing the need for working on "time-bound mission" to help artisans and small businesses, PM Modi on Saturday said that crores of jobs have already been created by skilling the youth under the Skill India Mission and setting up Kaushal Rozgar Kendras, and that skilled craftsmen are symbols of the true spirit of self-reliant India. Modi was addressing the 12th and the last post-Budget webinar on 'PM Vishwakarma Kaushal Samman'.
Highlighting importance of empowering rural India for the nation's growth story, Modi said: "For this, we will have to work in a time-bound mission mode." He added that PM Vishwakarma Yojana is aimed at handholding of artisans and people associated with small businesses, besides preserving the nation's rich traditions.
He also reiterated the government's commitment to provide a holistic institutional support to every artisan to ensure that they get access to easy loans, skilling, technical support, digital empowerment, brand promotion, marketing and raw material.
"Our aim is that Vishwakarmas (artisans and craftsmen) of today become entrepreneurs of tomorrow. For this, sustainability is essential in their business model," Modi said, adding that the industry can increase production by linking these people with their needs. "This can be a win-win situation for every stakeholder. Corporate companies will get quality products at competitive prices. Banks' money will be invested in schemes which can be trusted. And this will show the widespread effect of the schemes of the government," he said.
summary: PM Modi asserted that their government had put in good efforts to employ the youth of India through schemes like skill India mission. Likewise,  they plan to train and support the artisans (vishwakarmas) through PM vishwakarma yojana as the artisans are the pillars of development.

headline: G-20 nations arrive at consensus on issues of cultural heritage
article:
The G-20 nations on August 26 arrived at a consensus on cultural issues such as the need to address the destruction of cultural heritage in situations of conflict, the curbing of illicit trafficking of artefacts, the restitution of cultural property and the need to protect living heritage, specially of indigenous people.
However, there was no unanimity on “geopolitical issues” like the war in Ukraine. Russia and China rejected inclusion of references on the war in the outcome document released after the meeting of G-20 Culture Ministers in Varanasi.

“The Outcome Document comprises the entire text, which was unanimously agreed to by all G-20 members, except for Paragraph 15 (dealing with Ukraine),” the document titled ‘Kashi Culture Pathway’ said.

The document said the nations were united against destruction of cultural heritage “whether intentional or collateral, notably in situations of conflict”.
summary: The news is about participating nations in G-20. They , instead of concluding on geopolitical issues, they had dwelt on cultural issues such as cultural heritage in situations of conflict, the curbing of illicit trafficking of artefacts, the restitution of cultural property and the need to protect living heritage, specially of indigenous people.

headline: Two injured as train hits mini-lorry in Kayamkulam
article: A mini-lorry carrying fish was hit by a passenger train after the lorry attempted to cross an unmanned level crossing before the train passed the tracks near Ramapuram in Kayamkulam around 6.30 p.m. on Saturday. The passengers in the lorry, Ranjith and Suresh, were injured and shifted from the damaged lorry to the Kayamkulam Taluk Hospital by locals who rushed to the spot upon hearing the loud sound of the collision. The Ernakulam-Kollam Passenger train, which was involved in the accident, also sustained damages to the engine.
summary: A mini-lorry carrying fish was hit by a passenger train near Ramapuram in Kayamkulam. The passengers, Ranjith and Suresh, were injured and rushed to the hospital. The Ernakulam-Kollam Passenger train also sustained engine damage. Locals rushed to the scene after hearing the collision's loud sound. The incident occurred around 6:30 p.m. on Saturday.

headline: NEET and negative-marking idea
article: There seems to be no unanimity of views on the recommendation to scrap negative marking in the proposed National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test for MBBS admissions across the country. Abdul Latheef Naha tries to feel the pulse of the medical fraternity on the issue. When it comes to medical education, the prime concern is quality. Any changes in the entrance examination will naturally be viewed critically. The move of the Medical Council of India to scrap negative marking in the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET) proposed for MBBS admissions across the country from next year has evoked mixed reactions from the medical fraternity. When some welcome the proposal, many frown upon it saying that it will help only average students and not aid to improve quality in the selection process. Negative marks have been there for almost all medical entrance examinations in the country, including the test conducted by the Commissioner for Entrance Examinations, Kerala. Thousands of students have been taking the entrance tests every year, and negative marks for wrong answers have been posing a big challenge for them.
summary: The Medical Council of India's recommendation to remove negative marking in the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test for MBBS admissions in India has sparked mixed reactions from the medical fraternity. Some welcome the move, while others argue it will only benefit average students and not improve the quality of the selection process. Negative marks have been present in almost all medical entrance exams in the country, including the test conducted by the Commissioner for Entrance Examinations, Kerala. Thousands of students take these tests annually, and negative marks for wrong answers pose a significant challenge. The medical fraternity's concerns are reflected in the mixed reactions towards the proposed change.

headline: FAT myths
article: Fats are feared by the health conscious, favoured by the gourmet lover and ferociously penned by the medical bodies on its vices or virtues. Fats are let us say, less temperamental unlike carbohydrates that can instantly spike one’s blood sugar or proteins that can give you a sudden allergic reaction. Their effects remain unobtrusive until a blood test or heart attack alerts you to take note of it in your diet. When nutritionists talk about eating low fat the message gets misunderstood, because what they mean is to lower one’s bad fat intake or a presently unhealthy fat diet. They certainly do not mean eating fat free! There are several people who, on being diagnosed with high cholesterol or triglycerides eat without fat and then complain that despite eating no fat, blood lipids do not improve on a long term. A totally fat free diet is unhealthy. It serves no good to the purpose behind it which may be to reduce weight or decrease total or LDL cholesterol.
summary: Fats are often feared by health-conscious individuals, but they are also favored by gourmets and medical professionals due to their less temperamental nature compared to carbohydrates and proteins. They can cause subtle effects until a blood test or heart attack is detected. Nutritionists often talk about eating low fat, which is not about reducing bad fat intake or a currently unhealthy fat diet. Some people with high cholesterol or triglycerides may eat without fat but still experience long-term improvements in blood lipids. A fat-free diet is unhealthy and does not serve the purpose of reducing weight or lowering total or LDL cholesterol.

headline: Breaking ranks with BASIC, South Africa calls for legally binding protocol on climate change
article: South Africa has formally demanded that the new global agreement on climate change be in the form of a protocol with targets, commitments and actions for all parties. The move breaks the united stand the BASIC group of countries — Brazil, India, China and South Africa — had taken to keep the options open on the legal form of the new agreement, to be signed by 2015 and made operational from 2020. At the Durban conference of the U.N. Framework Convention on Climate Change in 2010, with India especially insisting, it was decided that the legal form of the new agreement would not be decided until the content of the new deal is well known. To keep with this, the options on the table were left open with the countries deciding that the new agreement would be in the form of ‘a protocol, another legal instrument or an agreed outcome with a legal force’.
summary: South Africa has demanded that the new global agreement on climate change be a protocol with targets, commitments, and actions for all parties. This move breaks the united stand of the BASIC group of countries, which had kept options open on the legal form of the new agreement. The legal form of the new agreement would not be decided until the content of the deal is well known. The countries decided to keep the options open, deciding whether the new agreement would be a protocol, another legal instrument, or an agreed outcome with legal force.

headline: AFG vs NZ ODI World Cup: Predicted playing XIs, live streaming, pitch report and weather forecast of Chennai
article:
New Zealand is set to face Afghanistan in the 16th match of the ODI Cricket World Cup at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai on October 18. New Zealand has been in impressive form, winning both of their matches and currently holding the second position in the standings. On the other hand, Afghanistan has managed to secure one victory out of their three games and currently sits in the sixth position in the rankings.In their recent encounter, New Zealand clashed with Bangladesh, winning the toss and choosing to bowl first. Bangladesh had a rocky start, losing their first wicket on the very first ball. However, the experienced pair of Mushfiqur Rahim and Shakib Al Hasan contributed crucial runs after the early wickets fell. Despite their efforts, Bangladesh could only muster 245 runs on the scoreboard, New Zealand also lost an early wicket but quickly built strong partnerships, leading them to a comfortable eight-wicket victory.

Meanwhile, Afghanistan faced England in their recent match, with England winning the toss and electing to field. Afghanistan got off to a strong start, with Gurbaz leading the way with his impressive 80-run performance. They faced some challenges during the middle overs but finished strongly, posting a total of 284 runs. England, on the other hand, struggled to get going and lost wickets at regular intervals, preventing them from forming significant partnerships. This ultimately resulted in a 69-run loss for England. It promises to be an exciting clash between New Zealand and Afghanistan, with both teams looking to make their mark in the ODI Cricket World Cup.
summary: New Zealand is set to face Afghanistan in the 16th match of the ODI Cricket World Cup at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai on October 18. New Zealand has been in impressive form, winning both of their matches and currently holding the second position in the standings. On the other hand, Afghanistan has managed to secure one victory out of their three games and currently sits in the sixth position in the rankings.

headline: Rahul Gandhi holds meeting with Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee leaders
article:
Rahul Gandhi held a meeting with Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee leaders here on Monday.

Gandhi landed at MBB Airport here en route to Mizoram. He held a brief organizational meeting with Tripura Congress leaders at the airport lounge, a senior party leader said.Rahul Gandhi held a meeting with Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee leaders here on Monday.

Gandhi landed at MBB Airport here en route to Mizoram. He held a brief organizational meeting with Tripura Congress leaders at the airport lounge, a senior party leader said.

ADVERTISEMENT

"Rahul Gandhi today arrived here by a charted flight from Delhi. After a brief meeting with party leaders at the airport lounge, he left for Aizwal for the election campaign in Mizoram", Congress Working Committee (CWC) member Sudip Roy Barman told reporters here.

"Rahul ji had a brief meeting with party leaders and wanted to know the condition of people in Tripura. He also gave suggestions on organizational matters. Gandhi will visit the state after completion of Assembly elections in five states - Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Telangana, Chhattisgarh and Mizoram", he said.
summary:
Rahul Gandhi held a meeting with Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee leaders here on Monday.

Gandhi landed at MBB Airport here en route to Mizoram. He held a brief organizational meeting with Tripura Congress leaders at the airport lounge, a senior party leader said.

headline: India rides on Yuvraj knock
article: Yuvraj Singh made a mockery of the Australian attack with his trademark audacious hits. On a perfect batting strip Yuvraj Singh scripted a grand comeback story by steering India to a handsome six-wicket win over Australia in the one-off Twenty20 international at the Khanderi stadium near here on Friday.Showing remarkable composure and appetite to score quickly, the left-hander (77 not out) took charge after Virat Kohli’s fall in the 12th over.
summary: Yuvraj Singh, a skilled and fearless batsman, led India to a six-wicket victory over Australia in a Twenty20 international match. He demonstrated exceptional skill and fearlessness, dismantling the Australian bowling attack with audacious strokes. Singh's composure and desire to score quickly were evident as he took control of the innings after Virat Kohli's dismissal in the 12th over.

headline: Astronomers map exoplanet’s weather
article: Using the Nasa Hubble Space Telescope, a team of scientists — including an Indian-origin researcher — has made the most detailed map ever of the temperature of an exoplanet’s atmosphere and traced the amount of water it contains. The planet targeted for both the investigations was the hot-Jupiter exoplanet WASP-43b. It is a planet the size of Jupiter but with double the mass and an orbit much closer to its parent star than any planet in the solar system. It has one of the shortest years ever measured for an exoplanet of its size — lasting just 19 hours.
summary: Scientists, including an Indian researcher, have created the most detailed map of an exoplanet's atmosphere temperature and water content using the Nasa Hubble Space Telescope. The hot-Jupiter exoplanet WASP-43b, with a mass double of Jupiter's and a closer orbit to its parent star than any other planet in the solar system, has one of the shortest years ever measured, lasting just 19 hours.

headline: Mahua Moitra files defamation suit against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, advocate Jai Dehadrai
article:
New Delhi, Oct 17: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has moved the Delhi High Court against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, lawyer Jai Anant Dehadrai, and several media organisations, following what she alleges are false and defamatory accusations against her.

The defamation suit, which comes after Moitra issued a legal notice to Dubey, Dehadrai, and several media outlets, vehemently denying any wrongdoing.

Dubey had lodged a complaint with the Lok Sabha Speaker, claiming that Moitra had accepted bribes in exchange for raising questions in Parliament. According to Dubey, the allegations stemmed from a letter addressed to him by Dehadrai.

“By way of background, it is stated that Defendant No. 2 (Dehadrai) was a close friend of the Plaintiff and recently, the cessation of this friendship soon took an acrimonious turn. Defendant No. 2 resorted to sending vile, threatening, vulgar messages to the Plaintiff and also trespassed into Plaintiff’s official residence and stole some personal possessions of the Plaintiff,” Moitra’s plea reads.

Moitra had then allegedly filed two police complaints dated March 24 and September 23 against Dehadrai and the same were later withdrawn by her on account of settlement talks.

“Despite the aforesaid, Defendant No. 2 went ahead and decided to tarnish and malign the reputation of the Plaintiff by approaching credible journalist to run damaging stories against the Plaintiff, however, none of such journalists agreed to participate in his malicious and vindictive designs,” the plea states.

Moitra’s defamation suit has been listed for hearing on Friday.

Her legal notice said that Dubey, for immediate political gains, regurgitated the false and defamatory allegations contained in the letter sent to the Speaker of the Lok Sabha. It further claimed that both Dubey and Dehadrai are directly responsible for tarnishing Moitra’s reputation for their own personal and political motives.

The notice went on to clarify that Moitra has never accepted any form of remuneration or gifts related to her duties as an MP, including the questions she raises in Parliament. Regarding the alleged links between the questions raised by Moitra and private individuals, the legal notice dismissed these claims as “laughable” and lacking any specificity or concrete evidence.
summary:
New Delhi, Oct 17: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has moved the Delhi High Court against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, lawyer Jai Anant Dehadrai, and several media organisations, following what she alleges are false and defamatory accusations against her.

The defamation suit, which comes after Moitra issued a legal notice to Dubey, Dehadrai, and several media outlets, vehemently denying any wrongdoing.

Dubey had lodged a complaint with the Lok Sabha Speaker, claiming that Moitra had accepted bribes in exchange for raising questions in Parliament. According to Dubey, the allegations stemmed from a letter addressed to him by Dehadrai.

“By way of background, it is stated that Defendant No. 2 (Dehadrai) was a close friend of the Plaintiff and recently, the cessation of this friendship soon took an acrimonious turn. Defendant No. 2 resorted to sending vile, threatening, vulgar messages to the Plaintiff and also trespassed into Plaintiff’s official residence and stole some personal possessions of the Plaintiff,” Moitra’s plea reads.

Moitra had then allegedly filed two police complaints dated March 24 and September 23 against Dehadrai and the same were later withdrawn by her on account of settlement talks

headline: IIT-M researchers develop solar-thermal steam based medical equipment steriliser
article:
A team of researchers at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras has developed a solar-thermal steam-based system that can help sterilise medical equipment in remote and rural areas, where access to electricity and water could be an issue.

Funded by the Department of Science and Technology, the project uses portable steam cylinders charged by renewable energy-based stations (like solar energy) that are placed strategically in rural areas for power generation, steam generation and other uses. The team also designed special sterilisation chambers to utilise such portably stored steam and effectively sterilise the tools.
