summary: ICICI Direct, a brokerage house, has expressed confidence in Mahindra Logistics (MLL) and considers it a top investment idea for the next 6 to 12 months. They have set a target price of ₹450 for the stock, suggesting a potential gain of 18%. It's worth noting that the stock had faced a significant decline of 25% over the past year. Additionally, in the current calendar year of 2023, it experienced a negative return in 7 out of the 10 months so far. However, it did perform well in August (up 8.7%), June (up 6.3%), and April (up 4.4%). On the other hand, it had its largest drop in February, declining by more than 21%.

headline: Wipro posts flat Q2 profit, cuts Q3 revenue growth guidance on weak demand
article:
Information technology (IT) services major Wipro on Wednesday reported almost flat growth in net profit and a marginal decline in revenue for the second quarter of 2023-24 (Q2FY24) amid an uncertain global economic outlook and weak client demand.
The Bengaluru-based firm also forecast that its third-quarter revenue might drop 3.5 per cent to 1.5 per cent sequentially on a constant currency basis, and attributed it to a “significant” slowdown in discretionary spending by clients. This is lower than the Q2 guidance of -2 per cent to +1 per cent.
summary: Wipro, a major IT services company, announced its financial results for the second quarter of the fiscal year 2023-24 (Q2FY24). They reported almost stagnant growth in net profit and a slight decrease in revenue. These results were influenced by a challenging global economic situation and subdued demand from their clients. The company also anticipates a decline in revenue for the third quarter, estimating a drop of 3.5% to 1.5% on a constant currency basis. They attribute this decline to a significant reduction in discretionary spending by their clients, which means clients are cutting back on non-essential expenses. This projection is lower than the guidance they had provided for the second quarter, which was in the range of -2% to +1%. In essence, the company is bracing for a more substantial revenue decline in the upcoming quarter due to client spending constraints.

headline: Dengue’s escalating economic toll on India: Time for urgent action
article: Dengue, a mosquito-borne viral disease, continues to exact a growing toll on India, not only in terms of public health but also economically. While our healthcare system grapples with the surge in cases, the often-overlooked economic ramifications of dengue demand our immediate attention. It is imperative that we confront this silent crisis head-on and proactively seek solutions to alleviate the economic burden it imposes on our nation.
summary: Dengue, a viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes, is increasingly affecting India, impacting not only public health but also our economy. As we struggle with the rising number of cases within our healthcare system, it's crucial to recognize that dengue has significant economic consequences that need our urgent consideration. We must address this hidden crisis directly and actively work on finding solutions to reduce the economic burden it places on our country.

headline: Delhi-Meerut RRTS: Sahibabad-Duhai Depot journey ticket price revealed ahead of launch; check details
article: The priority section of India's first Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) corridor is set to be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 20. It will be open for passengers from next day on October 21. Ahead of the launch, the ticket price of the journey has been revealed. The one-way journey from Sahibabad to Duhai Depot station on the 17-km priority section of the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut RRTS Corridor will cost Rs 50, while the fare for the same route will be Rs 100 in a premium-class coach, officials said on Wednesday. The priority section between Sahibabad and Duhai Depot has five stations -- Sahibabad, Ghaziabad, Guldhar, Duhai and Duhai Depot. The segment from Duhai to Duhai Depot is a spur from the main corridor.
summary: The first section of India's Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) corridor is all set to be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 20. Starting from October 21, passengers will be able to use this newly opened section. Prior to the launch, the ticket prices for the journey have been disclosed. If you're traveling one way from Sahibabad to the Duhai Depot station on the 17-kilometer priority section of the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut RRTS Corridor, it will cost you Rs 50. However, if you opt for a premium-class coach on the same route, the fare will be Rs 100. This priority section has five stations between Sahibabad and Duhai Depot, which include Sahibabad, Ghaziabad, Guldhar, Duhai, and Duhai Depot. It's worth noting that the Duhai to Duhai Depot segment is a spur branching off from the main corridor.

headline: PPP in Arunachal’s Health Sector: Is it Privatization or Value-Addition?
article: Path-breaking decisions by the Government of Arunachal Pradesh, in the year 2005, started a new era from January 2006 as sixteen Primary Health Centers (PHCs) were brought under the Public Private Partnership (PPP) project of the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM). Four voluntary organizations were chosen to manage these PHCs, one in every district, which were quite dysfunctional till the end of 2005. NGO-managed PHCs not only provide curative services; but also they focus on preventive medicines and organize different outreach activities. Besides reducing morbidity and mortality in PHC areas, NGOs have been able to empower the community to demand quality healthcare that should match Indian Public Health Standards (IPHS) and here the PHC Management Committees play a vital role. Ignoring the hardships, NGO-staff provide services in a 24 x 7 manner and when there are complicated cases they smartly refer these to large hospitals by using PHC-Ambulance. Decentralized planning, promoting team spirit amongst staff, responsible supervision, timely supply of drugs and pro-poor approach are some of the trade secrets of NGOs' success. However, the credit primarily goes to the community residents of PHC areas because their cooperation, constructive criticisms, and caring attitude towards the staff help achieve the immediate goal, although there are miles to go for ensuring sustainability. NRHM has been effective in the country; however, several PHCs and CHCs of the Government still do not perform well. Therefore, the PPP model of the Government of Arunachal Pradesh has emerged as the best solution in this context. Now, after a 42-month period, sixteen NGO-managed PHCs have not only become functional but also many NRHM-implementing States have started similar initiatives by learning from Arunachal. In fact, the Government of Arunachal Pradesh is planning to hand over the management of a few CHC-cum-FRU to NGOs too which would certainly help improve the quality and quantity of health-service. The name PPP sometimes creates confusion among the common people; however, it's truly Public-Nonprofit-Partnership. Here, NGOs do not make a profit like other PPPs of the infrastructure sector. Moreover, this is not at all privatization of Government Hospitals. If one looks at it objectively, then it's found that PPP in Arunachal's Health Sector is essentially a value addition. Government only handovers the management of its hospitals for a short period, and if any NGO does not provide quality service then the contract can be easily terminated. Moreover, all the assets created under the PPP project belong to the Government of Arunachal Pradesh but not to the NGOs. PHCs and CHCs do not lack resources since NRHM is operational; however, proper utilization of men, money, and materials is still a matter of great concern in some of these institutions. The responsible Government cannot sit idle by seeing the poor utilization of resources, so its decision to hand over the management of PHCs and CHCs to NGOs would always be remembered in the golden history of Public Health. Everyone deserves quality healthcare as it's his or her right, and it hardly matters who the service providers are.
summary: In 2005, the Government of Arunachal Pradesh started a new era by introducing a Public Private Partnership (PPP) project under the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM). Four voluntary organizations in each district were chosen to manage sixteen primary health center(PHCs) which. Despite the challenges, NGO staff provide round-the-clock services and also direct critical cases to the largest hospitals using PHC-Ambulances. Decentralized planning, promoting team spirit amongst staff, responsible supervision, timely supply of drugs and pro-poor approach contributed to NGOs' success. This PPP model offers a successful solution within Arunachal's Health Sector, which has inspired other states. The government is now planning to hand over the management of a few CHC-cum-FRU to NGOs too which would certainly help improve the quantity of health-services. The decision of the government to hand over PHCs and CHCs to NGOs will always be remembered in the golden history of public health.

headline: President of India to address nation on eve of 76th Independence Day
article:
President Droupadi Murmu will address the nation tomorrow (August 14, 2022) on the eve of the 76th Independence Day, the President Secretariat stated.

The President's Address will be broadcast from 7 pm on the entire national network of All India Radio (AIR) and telecast over all channels of Doordarshan in Hindi followed by the English version, the President Secretariat stated in a release on Saturday.


Broadcast of the address in Hindi and English on Doordarshan will be followed by broadcast in regional languages by regional channels of Doordarshan.


AIR will broadcast regional language versions at 9.30 pm on its respective regional networks.
summary: On 14 qaugust 2022 president droupadi murmu will adress the nation through doordarrsham channel.

headline: Myanmar Government releases 10 Indian prisoners
article:
The Myanmar Government released 10 Indian prisoners through Integrated Check Post at Moreh-Tamu border on Wednesday, sources said.

The sources said that the released 10 prisoners included three females and seven males. Five of them are from Tengnoupal district, one each from Ukhrul district, Chandel district and Assam's Cachar district and two are from Mizoram.


The released Indian prisoners are:


1. Amoni Jeet Das, 33 of Moreh Ward No 7,


2. Lunjalal Haokip, 21 of Moreh ward No 1.


3. Phaningkhul Kapal, 40 of Paoyei, Ukhrul


4. Thongminlal Baite, 22 of Joldam, Chandel


5. Thoibi Devi, 49 of Moreh ward No 2


6. Laldugkima Kanear, 36 of Sumsul vill, Aizawl


7. Lalchhnuanawma Mar, 42 of Champhai Mizoram


8. Ninaghoi, 33 of Moreh ward No 1


9. Lal pu Pedimchin,27 of  Moreh ward No 1.


10. Niang boi, 42 of Moreh ward No 1.


They were received by DC Tengnoupal Mannuamching, Y Anand (Senior immigration officer), Anand (OC Moreh Police station) and officials of Land Custom Station Moreh, Integrated Check Post, 5 Assam Rifles and a medical team from Moreh Hospital.


Medical team from Moreh Hospital conducted health check up of all the 10 persons at ICP. Later, the Moreh police transported them to Moreh police station and handed them over to their respective families, the sources added.
summary: !0 Indian prisoners were released by myanmar government.

headline: Har Ghar Tiranga Manipur Marathon: Ngaopulou, Bhumeshwory triumphant
article:
H Ngaopulou of Senapati and H Bhumeshwory Devi of SAI/NCOE grabbed the top spot in the Mens and Womens category of Har Ghar Tiranga Manipur Marathon, 2022 held at Khuman Lampak Main Stadium.

Ngaopulou clocked 1 hour 16 minute and 13 seconds for the top spot while Bhumeshwory Devi touched the finishing line with a timing of 1 hours 37 minute and 22 seconds. In the Mens section, Y Arjit Singh of Waiton and Nahtei N Wangna of Nagaland came second and third among the top 15 while in Women’s category, A Sai Chanu of Mayang Imphal and Lily Phangchopi of Assam bagged the second and third spot among the top thirteen runners.


Army shooters trial
The Manipur Rifle Association has informed that the Indian Army Marksmanship Unit is scouting sportspersons for shooting trial for enrolment in Army Marksmanship Unit, Mhow from August 27-31.

The shooting trial will be held in 50 meter Rifle 3 Position, 10 meter Air Rifle, 25 meter Pistol, 10 meter Air Pistol, Trap and Skeet shooting. Interested shooters are to submit bio data, willingness letters including events and contact details to amu_india@gmail.com.
summary:
At Har Ghar Tiranga Manipur Marathon, 2022 held at Khuman Lampak Main Stadium the top ten spot were grabbed by H Ngaopulou of Senapati and H Bhumeshwory Devi of SAI/NCOE.
from 27-31 august army shooters trial will take place.

headline: Conducive atmosphere for return to peace'
article:
Manipur Governor Anusuiya Uikey, on her third visit to Churachandpur since the outbreak of the unrest in Manipur since May, 2023, reiterated the commitment of the Central and state governments to bring back normalcy.


The Governor visited two relief centres at ECA Premises, M Songgel and ECA compound, Tuibong, Churachandpur District on Wednesday, the Raj Bhavan said in a press release.


Interacting with the IDPs at the two camps, Anusuiya Uikey said that she feels the sentiments of the IDPs and she is very much aware of their wishes and aspirations to be back home and lead normal life. She conveyed that the Governments at the Centre and State are fully committed to bring back normalcy.


She also acknowledged the cooperation of the public which facilitated the minimization of violent incidents in recent times thus paving a conducive atmosphere for peace to return.


The Governor also planted saplings at M Songgel ECA Church campus.


Uikey, in collaboration with Indian Red Cross Society, Manipur unit distributed relief items to the inmates of both camps including blankets, pillow, mattresses, hygiene kits, kitchen utensils, mosquito nets. She also gave monetary assistance to pregnant women, lactating mothers and patients with serious ailments. A total of 755 inmates from 167 families benefited with the relief items distributed today, the Raj Bhavan said.
Dharun Kumar, DC, Churachandpur; Immanuel Infimate, Addl SP; SDOs, other DLOs and officials accompanied the Governor during the visit
Later, the Governor held a meeting with CSO leaders at Headquarters 27 Sector Assam Rifles, Tuibong.
The Governor, on her return from Churachandpur District, visited Phubala High School relief camp, Bishnupur district where she met and interacted with Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and heard their grievances. She said that her purpose of visiting the relief camp is to give a healing touch and instill a confidence in the minds of the affected people, the Raj Bhavan said in the release.
While speaking with the inmates, the Governor assured them that they will be shifted to their respective homes permanently once normalcy is restored in the state. She informed that central and state governments are continuously working for peace and rehabilitation to their permanent residence. The relief and rehabilitation committee headed by Justice Geeta Mittal has also visited the state to look into this matter, she informed.
The Governor also appealed to the public to cooperate in the peace process and not to take law in their own hands and not to resort to any forms of violence that will hamper the peace process. She asserted that with the support and cooperation from the people of Manipur, normalcy and peace has been returning slowly in the State.
summary: Anusuiya Uikey, governor of manipur went to a visit to Churachandpur District,. Planted samplings, distributed food, drinks, blankets. This was the first visit since the unrest in may.

headline: Time to recall heroic deeds of forefathers by present leaders: O Joy
article:
Terming that the present political scenario of Manipur is in a sorry state of affairs due to the alleged degradation in quality and moral of state leaders, veteran politician O Joy said that it is the high to remember and recall the dedication made by the then King and freedom fighters who fought to free the land from British's hand and seven year’s devastation.
He stated this while paying tribute to the freedom fighters and the then King of Manipur in an annual religious ceremony of offering fruits and flowers to departed souls (last day of tarpon) at Lishang Hiden, place near the memorial complex of Gambhir Singh.
Addressing the media at the sidelines of the function, Joy said that it is unfortunate to see the worsening political trends of Manipur. The present government is a complete failure that is unable to fulfil their promises, he added.
He continued and said that when BJP came into power, they affirmed to take development work within 14 months which Congress-led government could not do in 15 years. However, the deplorable condition of the road from Canchipur to Lilong shows that this government is just good enough in lip service.
He said that in his recent visit in Manipur, Vice President Venkaiah Naidu not mentioning a single word about the murder of Athuan Abonmai is very unfortunate.
As the investigation is about to begin by the NIA, the chief minister should resign from his post and SP and DC of Tamenglong who took charge at the time of incident should be suspended to get fair justice, he reiterated.
summary: veteran politician remembered the heroic deeds done by indian freedom fighters to free the land while present scenario is in a sorry state, especially in manipur. he called the present government a complete failure.

headline: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu in Manipur: India's development is incomplete without development of Northeast region
article:
Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu who arrived in Imphal on Tuesday as a part of his visit to Northeast India, said that India's development is incomplete without the development of Northeast region. 

Naidu was speaking as the chief guest during the inauguration of a Phytopharmaceutical Lab at the Institute of Bioresources and Sustainable Development (IBSD) in Imphal and one-day ‘National seminar on Bioeconomy from Bioresources of North Eastern Region of India.’ 


Naidu also called upon all political parties to support the various developmental projects taken up by the Centre regardless of their political affiliations.


India's development is incomplete without the development of Northeast and Himalayan regions, he said, highlighting the various work and programmes initiated in the region for all round development to make India a strong and developed nation.
Highlighting that the government is directly transferring the funds for all the welfare schemes directly to the beneficiaries without any diversion or dilution, Naidu pointed out the need of opening a bank account by every individual. He also pointed out the need of translating the names of the various welfare schemes in local dialect and to make advertisements in a wide scale to make the local populace become more aware about the schemes.
The basic communication and primary education should also be in mother tongue so that children should be able to think creatively, he added. He also extended his compliment to IBSD for its sterling efforts to sequence the SARS CoV 2 positive samples for not only Manipur state but also for other states of the Northeastern region.
Observing that the Northeastern region is a biodiversity hotspot with its rich variety of ecosystems, Naidu further praised IBSD for managing the bioresources of the region for sustainable development using modern biotechnological tools.
Noting that the Phytopharmaceutical Mission of IBSD will focus mainly on therapeutic areas like antiviral, anti-bacterial, anti-fungal and insect repellents, the vice President opined that this would help in popularising traditional healthcare practices and would also aid in the development of effective alternative herbal medicines to combat diseases like COVID-19.
Maintaining that the further progress of the country rests in the hands of the able scientists, he urged the researchers and scientists to work shoulder to shoulder along with other important groups in pushing India towards development.
summary: india's development is incomplete without the development of north east region said vice president M Venkaiah Naidu during his visit to manipur. he further suggested education to be done in mother tongue to promote creativeness.

headline: Athuan Abonmai Murder: Movement will continue until justice is delivered, says JAC
article:
The Joint Action Committee Against the Brutal Murder of Athuan Abonmai on Monday stated that the peoples’ movement against the state government will continue until justice is delivered to late Athuan Abonmai.
The JAC in a release, appealed to all to continue participating and extending support and cooperation in the days ahead as the JAC is determined to continue the movement.
However, the JAC is surprised to see some individuals trying to mislead the general public by uploading and circulating misleading information on some social media groups, which in fact, is an intentional and deliberate attempt to sabotage the people’s protest movement, it stated. Despite these attempts, the people’s movement can neither be sabotaged nor defeated and the 24-hour statewide total shutdown called by the JAC was successful, it added.
The JAC will continue with democratic forms of protests until the charter of demands placed by the JAC are fulfilled. It is high time for the people of the entire state to rise above caste and creed that the lives of the people are not put to risks anymore but to put an end to this kind of killing by any individual or groups in the future, the JAC stated.  
The JAC also expressed deep appreciation and gratitude to all the leaders of various leading civil organisations particularly UCM, AMUCO, IPSA, MMWO, UPF, MAPI COUNCIL, CLK, PANDM, HERICOUN, ACOAM-LUP, AMKIL, Nupi Samaj, Tammi Chingmi, Nongpok  Leingak  Apunba Nupi Lup, ANUL, NIMPAL, Thoubal Ima, UMO, THANIL NIPCO, CADA, UPACO, AMPFA, EECHAL, EEVFAM, Macha Leima, AMSU, DESAM, MSF, KSA, SUK, AIMS, TUC, MCM, NCHRO etc, and various Women’s Organisations, different youths and students organisations, local clubs and Meira Paibis and associations and every right thinking people of the state for their participation and extending support and cooperation to the total shutdown called by the JAC.
The peoples’ participation, support and cooperation extended to the JAC calls for justice for the departed leader is a clear manifestation of the united voice of the people reflecting the people’s anguish and sentiment and at the same time sending a clear message to all to shun violent activities as the people are fed up of killing people by armed groups, it added.
summary: A democratic form of protest will be continued by Joint Action Committee(JAC) against the brutal murder of Athuan Abonmai until their demands are met. the organisation thanked people's participation, leaders of various leading civil organisations for their cooperation to avail justice.

headline: Union Minister John Barla meets minority leaders in Imphal
article:
Union Minister of State for Minority Affairs John Barla met with various minority leaders and communities at a function held at Mantripukhri on Friday, and urged all to fulfill the aspirations of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

“We all must strive together to fulfill the aspirations of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ‘Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas," Barla said.


Barla mentioned that the government under the dynamic leadership of Modi has introduced many welfare schemes for the upliftment of women and minority communities. He urged the people to take advantage of such welfare schemes meant for them.


Later, the minister visited the construction site of Sadbhavna Mandap at Saitu-Gamphazol, Kangpokpi and Imphal and inspected the projects running under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram (PMJVK).
summary: at a function in mantripukhri john barla, union minister of state for minority affairs with minority leaders. he urged people to take advantage of welfare schemes intoduced under Prime minister modi.

headline: Nagamapal Murder Case: Accused released on interim bail
article:
An accused involved in the Nagamapal midnight murder case of 2018 was released on an interim bail for three months under medical grounds by the Court of Session Judge, Imphal West on Wednesday.
The accused Haobijam Dilip alias Taibanganba ,45, son of (L) H Kunjababu Singh of Bishnupur Mamang Awang Leikai was released on bail on interim bail for three months under medical ground on furnishing a PR bond of Rs 1 lakh.
The counsel of the accused submitted that he was arrested on March 8, 2018 in connection with the FIR case. After completion of the investigation, the prosecution had submitted the final report of the FIR case, and subsequently, the case has been pending in the court for trial.  The counsel further submitted that so far, the prosecution had produced only one witness, which was partly examined in connection with the trial. It was also submitted that he has been languishing in judicial custody for over three years and the trial of the case is not likely to be concluded speedily.
The counsel further submitted that the accused had been experiencing chest pain and his health had not improved as he was unable to get proper medical treatment inside the jail and thus prayed for allowing the accused to go on bail to get proper medical treatment outside jail.
Meanwhile, the additional public prosecutor submitted that as per the diagnosis reports and medical report, the MO of Manipur Central Jail, Sajiwa never mentioned any severe illness which may endanger the life of the accused person. The additional public prosecutor also reiterated that if the health condition of the accused person was actually severe, then he may be admitted in the security ward of JNIMS Hospital for his treatment.
However, the court found that the medical report submitted by the MO, MCJ Sajiwa mentioned that the accused had been suffering from severe depression with suicidal ideation with unstable angina with hypertension.
The court found that the charges were framed on July 1, 2019 and were at the stage of examination of prosecution witnesses. So far, one prosecution witness has been partly examined in the year 2019. It was also observed that the failure of examination of the prosecution witnesses could be due to the COVID-19 pandemic which is still in concern. 
The court after considering the findings and views of counsel stated that it is proper to give a chance to the accused person to enable him to get a proper medical treatment outside jail. 
It may be mentioned that in 2018, Imphal West district police had nabbed four individuals in connection with the death of one Thokchom Tony alias Jagat who was shot dead in the night of March 3 at Nagamapal. 
Father of the victim Thokchom Suresh lodged a written complaint to Imphal police station mentioning that on the same day at around 1.20 am, his son Thokchom Tony alias Jagat was shot with a firearm by some unknown miscreants just in front of their house at Nagamapal Phugeisangbam Leikai while Tony was returning home after taking part in a Thabal Chongba event at Kakwa.
summary: Accused of Nagamapal midnight murder case of 2018 was released on an interim bail for three months under medical grounds by the Court of Session Judge. the public prosecutor submitted a diagnosis reports suggesting that the accused had not reported any severe illness prior.

headline: 24 Myanmar nationals caught with fake Aadhaar cards
article:
As many as 24 Myanmar nationals were caught with fake Aadhaar cards at Army Checkpoint, Khudengthabi in Tengnoupal district, Manipur on Thursday, sources said.
The 24 arrested Myanmarese, including 14 females, seven males and three minors, were travelling in three passenger vehicles (Eeco Vans) when the personnel of 20 Assam Rifles at Khudengthabi caught them around 3 pm, October 5, the sources said.
Khudengthabi Army Check Point is located along Moreh-Imphal road in Tengnoupal district, Manipur on India-Myanmar border.
They were accompanied by one Daniel Vanlalawma, son of Pothawmna, resident of Bulin Champhai Mizoram and travelling to Churachandpur, Manipur.
Of the 24 Myanmarese, 21 were found possessing fake or forged Aadhaar cards; nine of them were from Mungswa, Khutan village, Myanmar and the other 15 belonged to Butalen and Toyero village Myanmar.
Daniel Vanlalawma, who accompanied the Myanmar nationals, and three drivers who ferried the Myanmar nationals were also arrested.
The three drivers are identified as Thangkhochon Sitlhou ,30, son of Satkholal Sitlhou, Koite Village, Churachandpur; Lamkholal , 27, son of Lhukam of N Molhoi village, Churachandpur and Monthang , 42, year, son of Dearson of Teiseng Village, Churachandpur. They were driving a Grey colour Eeco Van, MN-06LB 3696; red colour Eeco Van, MN-028 2370 and a blue colour Eeco MN-O4P 0840, police sources said.
An FIR No. 45(10)2021, MRH-PS, U/S 468/471, IPC, 51 (b) D.M.Act & 14 F Act was registered at Moreh police station for further legal process, the police added.
summary: The 24 arrested Myanmar nationals, including 14 females, seven males and three minors were travelling in three passenger vehicles (Eeco Vans) when the personnel of 20 Assam Rifles at Khudengthabi caught them around 3 pm of October 5.

headline: Farmers reap a tidy profit as turmeric prices shoots up
article:
ERODE: The sharp rise in turmeric prices in the past one year has brought prosperity to hundreds of farmers in Erode and nearby areas in Tamil Nadu. Engaged in turmeric cultivation for nearly three generations, the farmers had never seen so much money from one crop in their lifetime. While the farmers expected a return of around Rs 5,000 per quintal when they sowed the plant last year, the prices touched record highs in the first week of this May.

At its peak, a quintal of ‘finger’ turmericold at Rs 15,800 and certain varieties like ‘Salem finger’ touched Rs 16,676 per quintal in Erode market, the second largest turmeric market in Asia, next to Sangli in Maharashtra. At present, the prices are hovering between Rs 15,300 and Rs 15,400. Around 20 to 40 quintal can be cultivated on one acre depending on the quality of yield. The literally nil carryover stocks due to a low output in 2009, average yield and rising global demand are said to be the reasons for soaring prices.

Flush with money, farmers have enrolled their children for engineering studies and renovated their old houses. “We have almost repaid our debts with just one harvest of turmeric last year. With this year’s harvest, we expect to complete repayment of our debts and start saving for the future,” said a farmer in Kodumudi village in Erode. Kodumudi village is a major turmeric growing belt in the district. Nearly one lakh bags (each bag of 75 kg) of turmeric reaches the Erode market from this village Turmeric is usually sown from May till August and harvested from January.
On an average, the region comprising Erode, Bhavani, Salem, Attur and even Chamarajanagar in Karnataka contributes around 15-20 lakh bags to the country’s annual requirement of 40-45 lakh bags. In 2009, around 12 lakh bags were produced in this region. The crop area decreased in 2009 due to low price realisation in the previous year and also because of difficulty in cultivating the crop. While farmers reduced the acreage to 9,000 hectares in Erode region in 2008-09, they increased it by 15% for the current season
summary: In erode area of tamilnadu the sharp raise in prices of turmeric has brought wealth to the society. the farmers have never had this much profit from a crop. at its peak 1 quintal touched 15000, while the farmers were expecting 5000 when they were sowing. with money now they started renovating houses buying cars enrolling their children to engineering. Farmers saying with this years harvest they can complete their debt

headline: Fitting reply will continue: Shah
article: BJP president Amit Shah on Saturday said ever since the BJP-led NDA government came to power, the country’s armed forces were giving a befitting reply to Pakistan whenever it violated the ceasefire. “We will continue to do it if the ceasefire is violated,” Mr. Shah told reporters in Bengaluru.
summary: According to the above article, BJP President Amit Shah stated that since the BJP-led NDA government took office, India's armed forces have been responding effectively to Pakistan's ceasefire violations. He emphasized the commitment to continue this response in the event of future violations. Shah made these remarks during a press interaction in Bengaluru.

headline: Was Coast Guard ship fast enough?
article: ICGS Rajratan , which scrambled from the Indian Coast Guard’s Porbandar base, is a 50-metre-long inshore patrol vessel (IPV) and can achieve a maximum speed of 34 knots, with an economical speed of 16 knots. It carries a 30-mm gun. Questions are being raised about why a Coast Guard vessel should have taken an hour to intercept a fishing boat, but some security experts believe the time taken was not extraordinary. A fishing boat of the type that was intercepted usually clocks 10 to 12 knots per hour. “So it is not unusual that the Coast Guard ship took 45 to 60 minutes to catch up with the boat,” said a former naval official. The time taken for the chase would also depend on the initial distance between the Coast Guard vessel and the boat.
summary: The above article says that, the ICGS Rajratan, a 50-meter inshore patrol vessel (IPV) of the Indian Coast Guard based in Porbandar, with a maximum speed of 34 knots and armed with a 30-mm gun, took around an hour to intercept a fishing boat. While some are questioning why it took this long, security experts suggest that it may not be extraordinary. Typically, fishing boats of this type travel at speeds of 10 to 12 knots per hour, so the Coast Guard ship's 45 to 60 minute chase time may be explained by the initial distance between the two vessels.

headline: DNA samples collected from bodies found in Ganga
article: A day after scores of dead bodies found floating in the Ganga in Safipur area of Unnao district in Uttar Pradesh created a flutter, a team of forensic experts on Wednesday collected DNA samples from 80 bodies. A team of 10 doctors from Unnao were requisitioned by the district administration for the job. The samples have been collected for assessing the cause of death and establishing the gender of the dead. About 100 bodies were found floating near Pariyar Ghat in Unnao. Reports said that the Ganga here, after taking a bend in its course, follows a shallow path, which is why the bodies surfaced. The Unnao District Magistrate has been asked to submit a detailed report to the Home Department. IG (Law and Order) A. Satish Ganesh said since some of the bodies were in an advanced stage of decomposition it was not possible to collect their DNA extract. “The doctors expressed their inability to conduct any examination given the putrid state of the bodies,” Mr. Ganesh told reporters. The IG said prima facie the deaths appear to have been caused by natural causes. “The process of collecting DNA samples is being videographed,” he said.
summary: According to the above article, a team of forensic experts collected DNA samples from 80 bodies found floating in the Ganga in the Safipur area of Unnao district, Uttar Pradesh, a day after the discovery of these bodies. A group of 10 doctors from Unnao was tasked with this job to assess the cause of death and determine the gender of the deceased. About 100 bodies were discovered near Pariyar Ghat in Unnao, likely surfacing due to the shallow path of the Ganga in that area. Some bodies were in an advanced state of decomposition, making it impossible to collect their DNA extract. The preliminary assessment suggests that the deaths may have occurred due to natural causes, and the DNA collection process is being recorded on video. The Unnao District Magistrate has been instructed to provide a detailed report to the Home Department regarding the incident.

headline: Maharashtra clocks one human sacrifice a month ‘It is time to implement Act stringently to curb such inhuman practices’
article:
‘It is time to implement Act stringently to curb such inhuman practices’
Maharashtra, considered one of the most progressive States in the country, has reported cases of at least one human sacrifice per month on an average in the last one year. Of the 104 cases registered in the first year after the previous Maharashtra government passed the Anti-Superstition and Black Magic Act in December 2013, activists have pointed out 15 cases of human sacrifice.The Act, before it was passed by the Maharashtra Legislature, was termed by the then Opposition parties, the Bharatiya Janata Party and the Shiv Sena, anti-Hindu. The Opposition had stalled the Assembly proceedings for several times in protest against the Act.
summary: The article discusses, in the last year, Maharashtra, considered a progressive state in India, has witnessed an average of one case of human sacrifice per month. There were 104 cases registered in the first year following the enactment of the Anti-Superstition and Black Magic Act by the previous Maharashtra government in December 2013, with activists highlighting 15 cases involving human sacrifice. Before the Act was passed, it faced opposition from parties like the Bharatiya Janata Party and the Shiv Sena, who criticized it as anti-Hindu, leading to Assembly proceedings being stalled in protest against the Act. Activists are now calling for stricter enforcement of the Act to combat such inhuman practices.

headline: India, U.S. to jointly fight cancer, Ebola
article:
Three MoUs to be signed on tackling diseases
India and the United States are expected to sign memoranda of understanding on cancer research and Ebola control when U.S. President Barack Obama arrives here later this month. On Wednesday, Union Minister for Health and Family Welfare J.P. Nadda said the two countries had agreed to jointly fight Ebola.
summary: The article says that, India and the United States are set to sign three Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) to address diseases. The MoUs will cover cancer research, Ebola control, and a joint effort to combat Ebola. This collaboration is anticipated to take place during the visit of U.S. President Barack Obama to India later this month.

headline: By-election: BJP’s allies non-committal on support
article:
DMDK leader fails to meet Amit Shah
The high-profile wedding of RSS ideologue S. Gurumurthy’s daughter on Sunday was expected to facilitate an informal meeting among the constituents of the National Democratic Alliance and bring down the simmering heat over the last few months. But that seems to have not materialised. Heavyweights of the BJP, including L.K. Advani, Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh and several other Ministers such as Ravi Shankar Prasad and Venkaiah Naidu flew down to Chennai for the event. While Mr. Advani and Mr. Singh attended the wedding reception on Saturday and flew back to Delhi, the spotlight on Sunday was clearly on BJP national president Amit Shah.
summary: According to the above article, a planned informal meeting among National Democratic Alliance (NDA) constituents at the high-profile wedding of RSS ideologue S. Gurumurthy's daughter did not take place as expected. Heavyweight BJP leaders, including L.K. Advani, Rajnath Singh, Ravi Shankar Prasad, and Venkaiah Naidu, attended the event. However, BJP National President Amit Shah was not able to meet the DMDK leader as initially anticipated.

headline: ‘Media trials put pressure on courts’
article:
‘Govt. plans to introduce limitations on live coverage of security operations’
Making out a case against media trials, Union Information and Broadcasting Minister Arun Jaitley said here on Sunday that technology had made State censorship an exercise in futility. Delivering the first Justice J.S. Verma Memorial Lecture on “Freedom and responsibility of media,” organised by the News Broadcasters Association here, Mr. Jaitley urged the media to introspect as media trials undertaken in television studios bring “tremendous pressure” on courts.
summary: The article says that, union Information and Broadcasting Minister Arun Jaitley expressed concerns about media trials and stated that modern technology has rendered state censorship ineffective. Speaking at the first Justice J.S. Verma Memorial Lecture on "Freedom and responsibility of media," he encouraged the media to engage in self-reflection as televised media trials can exert significant pressure on the courts. Additionally, the government is considering the introduction of limitations on live coverage of security operations.

headline: A must-win game for India
article: With its World Cup preparations derailed by successive losses, India would look to re-ignite the spark and keep itself afloat in the ODI tri-series when it takes on an unbeaten Australia in a must win game here on Monday. With three victories in three matches, the hosts have already qualified for the final in Perth on February 1.
summary: The above article discusses that, India, facing setbacks in its World Cup preparations due to consecutive losses, aims to regain momentum and stay competitive in the ODI tri-series. They are set to face an undefeated Australia in a crucial match. Australia, with three wins in three matches, has already secured a spot in the final scheduled for February 1 in Perth.

headline: Water dues leave SCB coffers poorer by 10 cr.
article:
Water Board puts 8,000 defaulters on notice
Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB) has issued notices to nearly 8,000 defaulters of water bills to collect dues, which are to the tune of Rs.10 crore. There were about 15,000 official water connections in over 300 residential colonies as per the Cantonment records and a four-member team went through the bill books since 2001 to unearth the defaulters.
summary: Article says that, the Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB) has sent notices to approximately 8,000 individuals who have not paid their water bills, amounting to a total of Rs. 10 crore. According to Cantonment records, there were over 15,000 official water connections in more than 300 residential colonies. A team of four members reviewed bill records dating back to 2001 to identify these defaulters.

headline: Tanker operators sense stormy waters ahead
article:
Water Board’s decision to engage new tankers on hiring basis is causing a lot of heartburn among the existing operators, as they see the move as an attempt to virtually throw them out of business
The Water Board’s decision to engage new tankers on hiring-basis is causing a lot of heartburn among the existing operators. They see the move as an attempt to virtually throw them out of business. The Board has planned to hire 50 tankers to supply drinking water in the GHMC areas on a fixed payment of Rs.48,000 per month for a 5,000-litre capacity and Rs. 63,000 for 10, 000-litre capacity deliveries. They are supposed to make 8 trips a day or cover a minimum of 2,000 km per month. Presently, there are about 600 tankers which make both payment and free trips. They are now paid Rs. 240 for each payment trip and Rs. 215 for a free trip. So far 26 tanker owners have applied under the new hire scheme.
summary: According to the article, the Water Board's decision to hire new water tankers on a contractual basis is causing dissatisfaction among existing operators, who perceive it as an attempt to drive them out of business. The board plans to hire 50 tankers to supply drinking water in GHMC areas, offering a fixed payment of Rs. 48,000 per month for 5,000-liter capacity and Rs. 63,000 for 10,000-liter capacity, with a requirement of 8 trips a day or covering a minimum of 2,000 km per month. Currently, around 600 tankers operate, receiving varying payments for both contractual and free trips. So far, 26 tanker owners have applied for the new hiring scheme.

headline: Kohli steers India to a crucial win
article: While the world watched, India turned on the heat against its arch-rival and declared ownership rights to a Sunday night here at the R. Premadasa Stadium. Powered by Virat Kohli’s unbeaten 78, India defeated Pakistan by eight wickets in a crucial ICC World Twenty20 Super Eights Group II match. India finished with 129 for two in 17 overs, a fitting batting riposte following its bowlers’ fine effort that bundled out Pakistan for 128 in 19.4 overs.
summary: Article says that, India secured an impressive victory against arch-rival Pakistan in an ICC World Twenty20 Super Eights Group II match at the R. Premadasa Stadium. Led by Virat Kohli's unbeaten 78, India won by eight wickets, finishing with a total of 129 for two in 17 overs. This win followed a strong bowling performance that restricted Pakistan to 128 runs in 19.4 overs.

headline: Delhi heist: 3 arrested; Rs. 2.36 crore recovered
article: With the arrest of two more persons and recovery of Rs.2.37 crore, the Delhi Police on Sunday claimed to have cracked the sensational daylight heist in the upmarket Defence Colony area within 28 hours. The main accused, now in judicial custody, has been identified as Deepak Sharma (34), the younger brother of prime accused Hari Kishan who is suspected to have masterminded the robbery along with his gang members. Deepak was arrested on Saturday after the police traced his brother’s residence to Pushp Vihar from where they later recovered Rs.1.51 crore, a 9 mm pistol, two magazines, five 9 mm and four .32 bore cartridges besides a mobile phone.
summary: Article says that, the Delhi Police announced that they have made significant progress in solving the high-profile daylight heist in the upscale Defence Colony area within 28 hours. Two more individuals have been arrested, bringing the total arrests to three. The primary suspect, Deepak Sharma, who is the younger brother of the prime accused Hari Kishan, is in judicial custody. The police apprehended Deepak Sharma after tracing his brother's residence to Pushp Vihar, where they found Rs. 1.51 crore, a 9mm pistol, two magazines, five 9mm, and four .32 bore cartridges, along with a mobile phone. In total, they have recovered Rs. 2.37 crore.

headline: Indian ports caught in shallow waters
article: Traffic at Indian ports grew by just 2 per cent in 2011-12 (a sharp contrast from 9.2 per cent CAGR recorded during 2005-06 to 2010-11). Had it not been for the healthy 25 per cent increase in coal traffic and a modest 8 per cent increase in container traffic, overall growth in port traffic may well have been negative during the year. The slowdown in traffic growth, combined with huge capacity additions of around 12 per cent in the sector, resulted in lower capacity utilisation in 2011-12. Despite lower utilisation rates, congestion issues continue to beset ports as turnaround times for most of the major ones still remain significantly high.
summary: The article says that, in 2011-12, traffic at Indian ports saw a modest growth of 2%, a significant drop from the previous years, which had a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 9.2% from 2005-06 to 2010-11. The increase was mainly driven by a 25% rise in coal traffic and an 8% increase in container traffic. Without these, the overall port traffic growth could have been negative that year. This slowdown in traffic growth, along with a substantial 12% increase in capacity, led to lower capacity utilization in 2011-12. Despite lower utilization rates, ports continued to face congestion issues, as turnaround times remained significantly high for most major ports.

headline: Why could Trinamool not stall FDI as we did, asks Karat
article: Communist Party of India (Marxist) general secretary Prakash Karat fired a salvo at the Trinamool Congress here on Sunday asking if the Left could stall Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in multi-brand retail, when they were providing outside support to the first United Progressive Alliance (UPA) government at the Centre, why did the Trinamool fail to do so despite being the ruling coalition’s second largest constituent. “If we could stop it for four years, why couldn’t the Trinamool Congress, whose representative is there in the Cabinet… they are there in the ministries, they are there in the CCPA [Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs, which took the decision on diesel price hike]? Why didn’t they stop it then?” Mr. Karat asked journalists, to queries on Trinamool’s decision to oppose the government measure now.
summary: The above article discusses that, Prakash Karat, the general secretary of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), questioned the Trinamool Congress's stance on Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in multi-brand retail. He pointed out that during the Left's outside support to the first UPA government, they managed to stall FDI in multi-brand retail for four years. Karat raised the question of why the Trinamool Congress, despite being the second-largest constituent of the ruling coalition, didn't take similar action, considering they had representatives in the Cabinet and the CCPA (Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs). He expressed this during interactions with journalists regarding the Trinamool's decision to oppose the government's measures now.

headline: Clips of anti-Islam video still present online
article:
Despite government’s claims that they have been removed
Despite claims by the government that the inflammatory video targeting Islam and Prophet Mohammed had been removed from the Internet, clips of the controversial video are still available on the video-sharing website YouTube. Ironically, the Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson on Sunday said: “Google India [which owns YouTube] has, in compliance with Indian law, blocked access to the offensive material.” Following widespread protests in the Arab world against the uploading of several clips of the controversial video on the Internet, the Ministry of Home Affairs on Wednesday asked the Department of Electronics and Information Technology (DEIT) to immediately block all the webpages containing the objectionable content. However, the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In), the agency under the DEIT which deals with such situations, is yet to ensure the ban.
summary: The article discusses, despite the government's claims that they have removed the inflammatory video targeting Islam and Prophet Mohammed from the Internet, clips of the controversial video can still be found on the video-sharing website YouTube. The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson stated that Google India, which owns YouTube, had blocked access to the offensive material in compliance with Indian law. This action came after widespread protests in the Arab world against the uploading of several clips of the controversial video. The Ministry of Home Affairs had directed the Department of Electronics and Information Technology (DEIT) to block webpages containing objectionable content, but the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In), responsible for implementing the ban, is yet to do so.

headline: Uttarakhand Chief Minister’s son to contest from Tehri
article: Saket Bahuguna, son of Uttarakhand Chief Minister Vijay Bahuguna, was on Sunday declared the Congress nominee for the Tehri Lok Sabha byelection on October 10. He was given a rousing welcome by party workers at Roorkee and Haridwar on his way here by train.
summary: According to the article, Saket Bahuguna, the son of Uttarakhand Chief Minister Vijay Bahuguna, has been announced as the Congress candidate for the Tehri Lok Sabha by-election scheduled for October 10. He received a warm reception from party workers during his journey to the election destination via train, with stops in Roorkee and Haridwar.

headline: PM meet to finalise FDI in pharma
article: In a bid to take a final view on relaxing foreign direct investment (FDI) norms in the pharma sector, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh is likely to soon call a meeting of senior ministers, including Finance Minister P. Chidambaram and Commerce and Industry Minister Anand Sharma. Differences, mainly between the finance and the commerce and industry ministries, on how much FDI in existing domestic units must be approved by the Foreign Investment Promotion Board (FIPB), had led to a delay in relaxation of norms.
summary: The article says that, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh is expected to convene a meeting with senior ministers, such as Finance Minister P. Chidambaram and Commerce and Industry Minister Anand Sharma, to reach a decision regarding the relaxation of foreign direct investment (FDI) norms in the pharmaceutical sector. There have been disagreements, primarily between the finance and commerce ministries, regarding the extent to which FDI in existing domestic units should require approval from the Foreign Investment Promotion Board (FIPB), causing a delay in the relaxation of these norms.

headline: Confident of numbers, Congress is not for humouring Mamata any more
article: The possibility of reconciliation between the Congress and the Trinamool Congress looked remote on Wednesday, 24 hours after a mercurial Mamata Banerjee withdrew her party’s support to the United Progressive Alliance (UPA) government, both parties stuck to their positions. Unmoved by Ms. Banerjee’s strident attack on it, in a second televised press conference, the Congress, instead, focused its energies on mustering the numbers to survive a no-confidence motion, in case the Opposition acts on its threat. The message from the Congress core group, which met for two hours on Wednesday morning, was that the West Bengal Chief Minister was not to be humoured any more, though the lines of communication would remain open. If the Trinamool is prepared to hear the Congress out, Union Finance Minister P. Chidambaram told journalists, he would be ready to explain why the economic reforms had to be pushed through. However, the party was confident, a senior Congress functionary said, that it had the numbers to defeat a no-confidence motion; in case of an accident, it was even prepared to face an early election rather than give in to the Trinamool and the Opposition’s demands for a rollback of its recent decisions.
summary: The article discusses, the possibility of reconciliation between the Congress and the Trinamool Congress appeared unlikely 24 hours after the Trinamool Congress withdrew its support from the United Progressive Alliance (UPA) government. Both parties maintained their positions. The Congress, undeterred by Mamata Banerjee's strong criticism, concentrated on garnering support to survive a potential no-confidence motion, should the opposition act on their threat. While the Congress kept lines of communication open, they made it clear that they wouldn't humor Mamata Banerjee any longer. The Congress was confident that it had the necessary numbers to defeat a no-confidence motion. In the event of an accident, they were even willing to face an early election rather than give in to the Trinamool and the opposition's demands for a rollback of recent decisions.

headline: IAS officers transferred, new Collectors for 5 districts
article: The State government has transferred over 20 officers of the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) and new Secretaries have been posted for the departments of Industries and Health. Five districts will have new Collectors. Vikram Kapur, who belongs to the 1988 batch, will be Principal Secretary of the Industries Department as Dr. Sundaradevan, Additional Chief Secretary looking after the department, will retire on Monday.
summary: The article says that, the State government in India has made significant administrative changes by transferring more than 20 Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officers. New Secretaries have been appointed for the Industries and Health departments. Additionally, five districts will have new Collectors. Vikram Kapur, a member of the 1988 IAS batch, is set to become the Principal Secretary of the Industries Department, as Dr. Sundaradevan, the Additional Chief Secretary in charge of the department, is retiring.

headline: BJP chief serves notice on Anjali
article: BJP president Nitin Gadkari has served a legal notice on RTI activist Anjali Damania for alleging that he told her at a meeting in Mumbai that he would not take a stand on the irrigation scam in Maharashtra since he had business ties with NCP leaders. The notice asked Ms. Damania to either retract her statement and tender a public apology or be prepared to face legal consequences. The BJP unit of Maharashtra was the first to unearth the scam and undertook agitations, besides appropriate legal remedy, the notice said.
summary: According to the above article, BJP President Nitin Gadkari has issued a legal notice to RTI activist Anjali Damania over her allegations that he refused to take a stand on the irrigation scam in Maharashtra due to business connections with NCP leaders. The notice demands that Ms. Damania either retract her statement and publicly apologize or face legal consequences. It is noted in the notice that the BJP Maharashtra unit was the first to uncover the scam and took various actions, including legal measures, to address it.

headline: ‘Facebook arrests unjustifiable, but law not ultra vires'
article:
Bench also seeks response of Maharashtra, West Bengal and Puducherry; the provision is well-intended, says AG.
The Supreme Court on Friday issued notice to the Union Government seeking its response to a petition challenging the Constitutional validity of Section 66A of the Information Technology Act, which many States allegedly misuse for arresting persons sharing messages on social networking websites. But Attorney-General G.E. Vahanvati maintained that the provision was well-intended. A Bench of Chief Justice Altamas Kabir and J. Chelameswar also issued notice to Maharashtra and West Bengal, and the Union Territory of Puducherry, seeking their response in four weeks and rejoinder in two weeks. The Bench asked the Maharashtra government to inform the court of the action taken against police officers who arrested the two women, after one posted on Facebook a message questioning the shutdown in Mumbai after the death of a political leader and the other ‘liked’ it.
summary: The above article says that, the Supreme Court of India has issued notices to the Union Government, as well as the states of Maharashtra, West Bengal, and the Union Territory of Puducherry, in response to a petition challenging the constitutional validity of Section 66A of the Information Technology Act. Section 66A has been controversially used to arrest individuals for sharing messages on social networking websites. Attorney-General G.E. Vahanvati defended the provision as well-intentioned. The court asked Maharashtra to report on the actions taken against police officers who arrested two women—one for posting a Facebook message questioning a shutdown in Mumbai following the death of a political leader and the other for 'liking' the post. Responses are to be submitted within four weeks, and rejoinders within two weeks.

headline: Police shoot down key suspects in Sub-Inspector murder case
article:
Police describe it as an ‘encounter’ when accused escaped
Police on Friday shot dead two men, both key suspects in the October 27 murder of police Sub-Inspector, after they escaped from custody and allegedly attacked a police team that tried to stop them at check post, police said. Prabhu and Bharathi, named as key accused in the killing of Alwin Sudhan, a young Sub-Inspector, were killed in what police described as an “encounter” at Theethankottai in Sivaganga district, on Friday night.
summary: According to the article, police shot and killed two men, who were key suspects in the murder of police Sub-Inspector Alwin Sudhan on October 27. The suspects, Prabhu and Bharathi, escaped from custody and allegedly attacked a police team at a checkpoint in Theethankottai, Sivaganga district. This incident was characterized by the police as an "encounter."

headline: As protests roil Charminar, Hyderabad’s heritage slowly vanishes
article: A small Hindu temple constructed by the side of and abutting one of the four minarets of the 420-year-old Charminar has been at the root of recent troubles in Hyderabad. What started as objections to erecting a temporary structure over the shrine has now grown into a violent protest that questions the legality of the temple. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) -- responsible for protecting this national monument since 1951 -- is blamed for failing to protect Hyderabad’s Islamicate heritage.
summary: The article discusses, a small Hindu temple constructed by the side of and abutting one of the four minarets of the 420-year-old Charminar has been at the root of recent troubles in Hyderabad. What started as objections to erecting a temporary structure over the shrine has now grown into a violent protest that questions the legality of the temple. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) -- responsible for protecting this national monument since 1951 -- is blamed for failing to protect Hyderabad’s Islamicate heritage.

headline: Herald denies ‘paid news’ charge but ball in Press Council court now
article: Armed with recordings, transcripts, emails and cuttings, Mayabhushan Nagvenkar has taken the matter of what he calls “an open and shut case” of ‘paid news' against OHeraldO of Goa to the Press Council of India. The Press Council defines ‘paid news' as “any news or analysis appearing in any media [print or electronic] for a price in cash or kind as consideration.” Mr. Nagvenkar backs his complaint with audios and transcripts of four telephonic conversations with the Herald's marketing manager, Tulshidas Desai, recorded between October 20 and 22. The conversations, he charges, indicate that the newspaper regularly indulges in such paid political news. He also alleges that Mr. Desai could not have pushed a deal like this without the consent, “tacit or otherwise,” of the editorial leadership.
summary: The article says that, Mayabhushan Nagvenkar has filed a complaint with the Press Council of India, alleging a clear case of 'paid news' against the OHeraldO newspaper in Goa. He supports his complaint with audio recordings, transcripts, emails, and cuttings. 'Paid news' is defined by the Press Council as news or analysis that appears in media, whether print or electronic, in exchange for cash or kind as consideration. Nagvenkar provides evidence in the form of recorded conversations with the Herald's marketing manager, Tulshidas Desai, suggesting that the newspaper regularly engages in such practices. He also claims that Mr. Desai could not have initiated such deals without the tacit consent of the editorial leadership.

headline: Goa daily stung by paid news bug Caught offering to publish scripted political interview as ‘news' for Rs. 86,400
article: “First we'll do one interview on TV on HCN [Herald Cable Network] and after that episode next week, we can carry the same kind of write-up [in the Herald] … how it appeared today, no ... for the HCN thing you have to make a payment of 50,000 [rupees] … and this particular size for Herald, it will be 86,400 rupees … Only you will have to prepare from your side which kind of questions you will like to answer comfortably …” Paid news is no stranger to Goa, only this time it's drawing unfriendly attention. Those are excerpts from recorded conversations between Tulshidas Desai, marketing manager of OHeraldO (the Herald) and Goa-based journalist Mayabhushan Nagvenkar
summary: The article discusses that the provided text includes excerpts from recorded conversations between Tulshidas Desai, the marketing manager of OHeraldO (the Herald), and journalist Mayabhushan Nagvenkar. In these conversations, Mr. Desai discusses the process of arranging a TV interview on HCN (Herald Cable Network) and mentions a payment of 50,000 rupees for it. He also talks about the cost of a write-up in the Herald, which would be 86,400 rupees. These excerpts suggest discussions related to 'paid news' practices and the need for Mr. Nagvenkar to prepare questions comfortably. 'Paid news' is not new in Goa, but it is now gaining unfavorable attention.

headline: Greek PM leaves G20 seething Papandreou to hold referendum on agreement
article: It was a deceptive calm. The feeling of confidence generated by the October 27 agreement in Brussels aimed at finding a solution to the Greek debt crisis was shattered on Monday by the surprise announcement by Prime Minister Georges Papandreou that he would hold a national referendum to approve or reject the agreement. European leaders could hardly contain their surprise and anger at Mr. Papandreou's decision which seeks to shore up his weak government by a simulacrum of public consultation. Bourses nosedived on Tuesday with the future of the Euro once again at the heart of market nervousness. The carefully planned agenda of the G20 Summit which opens on Thursday in the Riviera city of Cannes was also turned upside down by this new state of uncertainty. Issues like regulation to curb volatility in commodities and exchange markets, chapters on development, food security, agriculture or global governance are likely to be pushed off the agenda which will in all probability be hogged by the one burning question of the day — the future of the Euro and the fate of large Euro-zone economies like Italy or Spain with its ripple effect on economies across the world.
summary: According to the article, the calm that followed the October 27 agreement in Brussels to address the Greek debt crisis was disrupted when Greek Prime Minister Georges Papandreou unexpectedly announced a national referendum to approve or reject the agreement. European leaders were taken aback and upset by this move, which appeared to be an attempt to bolster his weak government through a semblance of public consultation. Financial markets reacted with a sharp decline on Tuesday, reigniting concerns about the future of the Euro. The G20 Summit's carefully planned agenda, set to begin in Cannes on Thursday, is now overshadowed by this new uncertainty. Issues such as regulating commodity and exchange markets, development, food security, agriculture, and global governance may be sidelined as the primary focus shifts to the future of the Euro and its impact on major Euro-zone economies like Italy and Spain, which, in turn, affects global economies.

headline: Seeking an entry to a book with a trap
article: Some of the testimonies to his craftsmanship are already resting with the American president Barack Obama and the Chinese Premier Wen Jiabo in the form of mementoes given to them during their last visit to India. But C.P. Pradeepan, a wood craftsman hailing from Vallikkunnu near here is on an interestingly different mission now. He wants to challenge the present Guinness record for making the world smallest functioning mousetrap, which is in the name of an Austrian called Franz Rosenberger.
summary: The article discusses, C.P. Pradeepan, a wood craftsman from Vallikkunnu, has a unique mission. He aims to challenge the current Guinness record for creating the world's smallest functioning mousetrap, which is currently held by an Austrian named Franz Rosenberger. Some of his crafted items have been presented as mementoes to prominent figures like American President Barack Obama and Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao during their visits to India.

headline: Dhoni on spot-fixing: If you do worse, be ready for worse
article: India skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni did not seem surprised at the verdict handed out to Pakistani cricketers Salman Butt and Mohammed Asif, saying worse is bound to happen when you do worse. Butt and Asif were found guilty of spot-fixing charges in a London court. The two cricketers are out on bail till the quantum of their punishment is announced.
summary: The article says that, Indian cricket captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni expressed no surprise regarding the verdict against Pakistani cricketers Salman Butt and Mohammed Asif, who were found guilty of spot-fixing charges in a London court. Dhoni's statement suggests that such outcomes are expected when wrongdoing occurs. Butt and Asif are currently out on bail until the announcement of their sentencing.

headline: Keep giving even after living Patients who need organ transplants have long waits, and the surgeries and aftercare are expensive; this foundation wants to change that
article: When Pratima Pal was diagnosed with irreversible liver cirrhosis in 1993, she was just 50. “The doctors told us that she may not survive more than a year,” her husband, Chugh Yoginder Pal says. “They advised us to go for transplant.” Liver transplants were still relatively unknown in India, so in 1995, Mr. Pal took her to Birmingham, U.K., for the surgery. “My wife lived a near-normal life till the time she passed away at the age of 73 in 2016,” he says. After her death, Mr. Pal was looking up data on organ transplants and discovered some disturbing facts. In India, most organ donations are live transplants, like kidneys (each person usually has two, and can function normally with one) and the liver (where the whole organ is not needed, just a slice). But there are very few cadaver donations, from where hearts and eyes and other parts can be transplanted: according to the World Health Organization, only 0.01% of Indians donate their organs after death, compared to up to 80% in more advanced economies. For instance, in Spain, cadaver organ donors per million is 35 per year; it is around 26 in Belgium and 26 in the USA. In India it is an abysmal 0.5.
summary: According to the article, Pratima Pal was diagnosed with irreversible liver cirrhosis in 1993, at the age of 50, with doctors giving her a prognosis of less than a year to live. Her husband, Chugh Yoginder Pal, took her to Birmingham, U.K., in 1995 for a liver transplant, as liver transplants were not well-known in India at the time. Pratima Pal lived a near-normal life until her passing at the age of 73 in 2016. After her death, Mr. Pal discovered that organ donations in India primarily involve live transplants (e.g., kidneys and partial liver), with very few cadaver donations. According to the World Health Organization, only 0.01% of Indians donate their organs after death, in stark contrast to more advanced economies, where the cadaver organ donation rate can reach up to 80%. For instance, Spain has 35 cadaver organ donors per million per year, while India has a significantly lower rate of 0.5.

headline: Team set up for trillion dollar economy Four senior government officers tasked with boosting State’s growth
article: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has set up a high-power committee to make Maharashtra a trillion dollar economy in the next seven years. The Boston Consulting Group (India) has been appointed as advisor to this team of four senior officers tasked with more than doubling the State’s economy from the current $400 billion, at a growth rate of 10%. “If we continue growing at this rate, we are expected to reach $1 trillion in seven years. The plan will be unveiled at the Magnetic Maharashtra summit next week,” Kaustab Dhavse, officer on special duty to the Chief Minister, told The Hindu .
summary: The article discusses that Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has established a high-power committee to propel Maharashtra's economy to reach a trillion dollars within the next seven years. This committee, comprising four senior officers, will receive advisory support from the Boston Consulting Group (India). The goal is to more than double the state's current $400 billion economy at a growth rate of 10%. The plan is set to be unveiled at the upcoming Magnetic Maharashtra summit.

headline: All set for launch, RapidX offers high-speed travel, modern amenities at affordable price
article: Modern amenities and inclusive infrastructure await commuters all set to hop on the high-speed train, RapidX, which will begin services on a 17-km stretch of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) after its inauguration by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday.The train will stop at five stations painted in turquoise and beige — Sahibabad, Ghaziabad, Guldhar, Duhai, and Duhai Depot — on the stretch, which is part of the 82-km Delhi-Meerut corridor that is expected to be fully operational by 2025.The Hindu took a ride on RapidX ahead of its maiden journey and witnessed the train, which boasts an average speed of 100 km/hr, zoom past cars on the Delhi-Meerut Expressway.In Pictures | Aboard RapidX, the high-speed train from Delhi1/15The train has five standard coaches, with one reserved for women, and a premium coach. While a ticket for a seat in the standard coach costs ₹20, passengers have to shell out double that amount to enjoy a ride in the premium coach. End-to-end travel in a standard coach will cost a total of ₹50 and ₹100 in the premium coach. Travel is free for children whose height is below 90 cm.Commuters can enter the stations from gates located on the service lanes of the expressway. Parking space is available for those using personal vehicles to reach the stations. Multiple entry/exit points have been provided on either side of the road at every station. A foot overbridge has been constructed for those who wish to cross the road to take a train ride or reach the bus terminal.QR code-based paper tickets can be purchased from ticket counters or ticket vending machines (TVMs) installed at the stations using currency notes, bank cards, or unified payments interface (UPI).The TVMs can also be used to recharge National Common Mobility Cards (NCMC). The RRTS will allow commuters to use any NCMC card from the first day of operations.Commuters can also travel by purchasing a QR code-based digital ticket using the RAPIDX Connect mobile application.Each station has two floors. All commuters have to enter through the automatic fare collection (AFC) gates on the ground floor, which will deduct the fare amount from their tickets depending on their destination. They will then have to use lifts, escalators or staircases to reach the platform on the second floor.Premium loungePassengers travelling on the premium coach will have to pass through additional AFC gates on the boarding platform, which will deduct an additional amount from the ticket for using the luxury compartment. These passengers will also gain access to the premium lounge, which is furnished with foam, velvet seats, and has vending machines that offer chips, chocolates, fried peanuts, and fruit juices.While all coaches have large windows, seats with velvet finish, the premium coach has reclining seats, extra legroom, and adjustable sun shields.The platforms are equipped with public address systems that will announce the arrival of upcoming trains, route maps of the multiple stops, and a detailed action plan to evacuate commuters during emergencies.Special doorsEvery station has platform screen doors (PSDs) integrated with the train doors and signalling system. The train will leave the station only after the main doors and the PSDs are firmly closed. All doors have first-of-its-kind manual locks that passengers can unlock to open the doors at a station in case they fail to open automatically.Each compartment has two rows of seats on either side of a spacious aisle, where passengers can stand and travel. Safety handles have been provided above and below the seats to ensure passenger safety. Multiple CCTVs are installed in every coach with field officers at the respective stations reviewing the footage and passing on information to the local units during emergencies.All stations have diaper changing stations, separate restrooms for women, and first aid kits. For medical emergencies, ambulance services can be availed through centralised accident and trauma services.The last coach has additional space for stretchers and wheelchairs and a ramp to enter and alight from the train.Women are expected to comprise 50% of the staff at all stations. Preference will be given to residents of the neighbouring areas during recruitment to ensure employment of locals.
summary: The high-speed train RapidX is set to commence services on a 17-km segment of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS). Inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, it will stop at five stations within the 82-km Delhi-Meerut corridor. RapidX features standard and premium coaches with ticket prices at ₹20 and ₹100 respectively, offering an average speed of 100 km/hr. Commuters can use QR code-based paper tickets or digital tickets via the RAPIDX Connect mobile app. Stations are equipped with platform screen doors, spacious seating, amenities for women, and accessibility features. Employment opportunities are prioritized for local residents.

headline: Telangana government weighs options to contain milk prices, seeks legal opinion
article: HYDERABAD: Weeks after targeting the Andhra Pradesh chief minister Chandrababu Naidu founded Heritage Foods with probe into alleged adulteration of milk, the Telangana government is now weighing options to rein in private dairies in a bid to regulating prices. The Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) led government is currently looking into options to invoke provisions of the Essential Commodities Act to contain selling prices of milk and sought legal opinion, said a bureaucrat who did not want to be named. The move assumes significance as most of the private dairy firms selling milk and milk products in the Telangana geography are owned by the entrepreneurs with roots in Andhra Pradesh, including AP chief minister Naidu founded Heritage Foods. While Telangana agriculture minister Pocharam Srinivas Reddy said there was no move so far to regulate milk prices, the bureaucrat quoted above said, “A government order was already issued sometime back constituting district-level committees to control prices of commodities, including milk.” A Srinivas, managing director of AP Dairy Development Corporation Federation that sells milk and milk products under ‘Vijaya’ brand, said the Telangana chief secretary Rajiv Sharma has convened a meeting on January 19 to discuss price control measures. The move by the Telangana government to rein in private dairy sector comes at a time when several global investors were investing in private dairy firms in India, the world’s largest milk producer with nearly a sixth of global milk production. India’s organised dairy sector is currently valued at around $10 billion and is set to grow at a compounded annual growth rate of 13-15% till 2019-20, according to a report by Rabobank. D Sunil Reddy, managing director of Dodla Dairy, said, “The dairy sector in India is no longer controlled by the local players and now has many global players having major interests. Any move to regulate the sector will be negative given the large global private investments into the sector.” Minister Srinivas Reddy said the Telangana government was only keen on strengthening the cooperative sector and accordingly decided to pay an incentive of Rs 4 a litre to those farmers supplying milk to the state-owned cooperatives.
