We will continue to send humanitarian assistance for the Palestinian people. Shared our deep concern at the terrorism, violence and deteriorating security situation in the region. Reiterated India's long-standing principled position on the Israel-Palestine issue," PM Modi tweeted.

PM Modi speaks to Palestine prez: 'Reiterated India's long-standing position'(PTI)
PM Modi speaks to Palestine prez: 'Reiterated India's long-standing position'(PTI)

We're now on WhatsApp. Click to join.

This is the first time PM Modi spoke to the Palestine authorities after the Israel-Hamas war broke out following Hamas's unexpected offensive into Israel on October 7.

PM Modi expressed solidarity with Israel and spoke to Israel Prime Minister Netanyahu earlier. On Wednesday, PM Modi expressed shock and concern over the civilian casualties of the ongoing conflict after thousands were reportedly killed in an attack on a hospital in Gaza. No one took responsibility of the attack though the Israeli Defense Forces cited an analysis report to prove that the attack was a result of a misfired rocket of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, a group branded as terrorist by Israel and the US.

What is India's long-standing position in Israel-Palestine?
After PM Modi posted a message that India stands with Israel, a debate started over India's official position on the Israel-Palestine issue. India has strategic diplomatic ties with Israel. PM Modi is the first Indian Prime minister to visit Israel and Palestine. In 2017, India voted against the US and Israel for declaring all of Jerusalem as the Israeli capital.

The ministry of external affairs earlier said India believes in long-standing support for the establishment of a sovereign, independent and viable state of Palestine. "India always advocated the resumption of direct negotiations towards establishing a sovereign, independent, and viable state of Palestine, living within secure and recognised borders, side by side at peace with Israel. I think that position remains the same," MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said.


India, however, stands firmly against terrorism and condemned the Hamas attack on Israel.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday spoke to Palestine President Mahmoud Abbas amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict and conveyed condolences at the loss of civilian lives at the al-Ahli hospital in Gaza. Assuring that India will send humanitarian assistance to the people of Palestine, PM Modi said he reiterated India's long-standing principles position on the Israel-Palestine issue. "Spoke to the President of the Palestinian Authority H.E. Mahmoud Abbas. Conveyed my condolences at the loss of civilian lives at the Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza. We will continue to send humanitarian assistance for the Palestinian people. Shared our deep concern at the terrorism, violence and deteriorating security situation in the region. Reiterated India's long-standing principled position on the Israel-Palestine issue," PM Modi tweeted.

headline: Fog in Delhi holds up flight traffic in city
article:
CHENNAI: The foggy condition in Delhi airport that threw flight traffic into disarray had a domino effect on Chennai airport on Saturday.
Almost all morning departures and arrivals, including four flights to Delhi, suffered delays from 5.30am because of poor weather in the national capital. Union home minister P Chidambaram and several other Delhi-bound passengers from Chennai were stranded for a couple of hours here because of the unexpected delays, sources said.
Chidambaram, booked on a 10.10am Chennai-Delhi Air India flight, could fly out only by 3.10pm. “The flight was delayed because of the foggy condition in Delhi and it took off after weather became clear and the pile-up of flights eased,” said an Air India official.
The malfunctioning of the CAT III instrument landing system because of a snag in the runway visibility range (used to gauge the visibility on the runway at Delhi airport) worsened the situation. As visibility was poor, a couple of flights were diverted to Kolkata from Delhi.
Schedules of many departing flights from Chennai were affected throughout the day as the flights depended on aircraft arriving from other destinations, especially cities in north India, said an airline official.
“The morning delays in Chennai had a cascading effect on evening departures too. If the schedules do not return to normal, airlines will have to reschedule flights for Sunday,” said an airport official.
Airline officials had a tough time pacifying passengers here, with several of them protesting. A couple of Delhi-bound passengers even created a scene at the airport in the morning when their flights were unexpectedly delayed.
With runway works being carried out in Bangalore, a couple of flights were diverted to Chennai. Fog usually envelops Chennai airport in the days ahead of Pongal every year.
summary: Chennai airport experienced delays in both morning departures and arrivals due to adverse weather conditions at Delhi airport. Foggy conditions in Delhi disrupted flight traffic, affecting passengers like Union Home Minister P. Chidambaram and others traveling to Delhi from Chennai. The CAT III instrument landing system malfunctioned, further complicating matters. Several flights were delayed, and some were even diverted to Kolkata. The scheduling of departing flights from Chennai remained disrupted throughout the day, leading to the possibility of rescheduled flights for the following day if normalcy did not return. Additionally, some flights were diverted to Chennai due to runway works in Bangalore.

headline: Freshers allege ragging in Mumbai medical college
article:
MUMBAI: Ten first-year students of KE Medical College here have alleged that they were ragged by their seniors at a New Year party, after which the college authorities ordered a probe into the charge. (Watch Video)
Sources said the freshers alleged last night that they were ragged at the party organized by the seniors of the physiotherapy department.
College Dean Andy Bhonsle said the allegation would be probed by an anti-ragging committee and action would be taken against anyone found guilty.
summary:
MUMBAI: Ten first-year students of KE Medical College here have alleged that they were ragged by their seniors at a New Year party, after which the college authorities ordered a probe into the charge. (Watch Video)
Sources said the freshers alleged last night that they were ragged at the party organized by the seniors of the physiotherapy department.
College Dean Andy Bhonsle said the allegation would be probed by an anti-ragging committee and action would be taken against anyone found guilty.

headline: Helpline booth at Patna Junction
article:
PATNA: The railways has set up a helpline booth at Patna Junction (0612-2213234) to provide information to family members and relatives of passengers travelling by Magadh Express (2402 Down).
This booth was set up soon after Magadh Express met with accident near Etawah on the mainline New Delhi-Howrah route on Saturday morning, said Danapur DRM Gyan Prakash Srivastava.
Talking to TOI, the DRM informed that the railways has set up three other helpline booths at Hajipur (06224-272230), Muzaffarpur (0621-2215233) and Samastipur (0627-4221741) to help the people know about the welfare of their relatives travelling by two Bihar bound trains New Delhi-Islampur Magadh Express and New Delhi-Samastipur Licchvi Express.
The DRM said that the railways has opened a separate counter at Patna Junction for the refund of tickets by those who were reluctant to carry on their journey due to cancellation of several passenger trains following train mishaps on the mainline. The railways has also put on display reservation charts of the Magadh Express passengers at Patna Junction so that their relatives could see themselves in which bogies they were travelling. Besides, the railways has deployed commercial staff on duty to provide all kind of information to curious people at the assistance booth round-the-clock, he said.
In view of the fact that the passengers coming by Magadh Express could be hungry and thirsty, the railways has provided catering facility at Patna Junction and all other stations under Danapur division. All shops at Patna junction were kept open keeping the needs of the passengers in mind, the DRM said.
Since a large number of passenger trains were stranded at different stations due to the mishap, the railways set up an emergency control cell at the Danapur control room to monitor their movements directly and keep the tracks clear for their smooth run under the division.
There is a special booth functioning at Patna Junction to assist people making any inquiry related to Magadh Express mishap or late running of other passenger trains caused by this mishap, the DRM said.
According to a East Central Railway (ECR) release, two Patna bound trains which were running after Magadh Express, Rajdhani Express and Jansadharan Express were diverted to other route to reach Patna Junction. The railways, however, decided to cancel Magadh Express (2401 Up) from Patna Junction to New Delhi and Licchvi Express from Samastipur to New Delhi on Saturday only, sources said.
summary: Following the accident involving the Magadh Express near Etawah on the New Delhi-Howrah route, Indian Railways has set up helpline booths at several stations to assist passengers' family members and provide information. Helpline booths are established at Patna Junction, Hajipur, Muzaffarpur, and Samastipur. In addition, a separate ticket refund counter is available at Patna Junction for passengers who wish to cancel their journey due to train cancellations. The railways have deployed staff to provide information and catering services, with an emergency control cell overseeing stranded passenger trains.

headline: Ramjas fest saw a lot of action and talent
article:
attle ground of talent and mischief: Named Mosaic Reloaded ’09
(instead of just Mosaic), this year’s fest at Ramjas College saw a lot
of action in the college; what with a rock band competition, street
dance, street play competition, fashion show and the live
performances by the bands, Lazy River, Half Step Down, Astitva
and the Pakistani band Strings.
However apart from all the activities, it was the fight between the
two groups of students, and a student throwing stones at Strings,
that defined the fest.
Many firsts: To begin from the beginning, the students were
thrilled that the fest in their college had been organised on such a grand scale. The fashion show had been
organised for the first time. The contestants displayed some colourful and creative designs.
Maar-Dhaar: While the students were busy cheering, a group of students broke into fight. The teachers and the
principal had to rush to pacify them. A couple of bouncers were also deployed at the venue. This brought only
temporary relief, though, as friends of both the students gathered and started fighting again.
Music ’n’ Masti: Well, the festive spirit was strong enough to overcome the momentary disruption. The fest
continued and students cheered for the college. The students involved in the fight were taken to the principal’s
office while police guarded the venue.
To be Continued... From street dance, to poster making, to rangoli and street play competition, there were many
engaging activities. The fun continued on the second day as well, and so did the disruption. On the second day,
everyone was looking forward to a live concert by Strings. Students were busy looking for space to stand while
armed policemen guarded the venue. Another band, Astitva, kept the students hooked before Strings came on
stage. Amidst much applause and cheer, they belted out their popular numbers like Koi Aanewala Hai and Akhiri
Alvida Naa Ho. The performance came to a halt as someone threw a stone at the band, not once but twice, and
the band walked away to the green room.
Action Abhi Baki Hai: While the band was being offered apologies, students and teachers took turns to use the
gift of the gab to make the erring students realise that the act was shameful. The events took another dramatic
turn when the DUSU president came on the stage and gave a speech. The much-agitated principal gave a
bouquet to the DUSU president and said, “I give this bouquet to the DUSU president to buy peace.” Soon the
band members yielded to the requests and completed the gig while the student volunteers and teachers sat on
the corners of the stage to make sure no more mischief spoilt the fun again
summary: The Mosaic Reloaded '09 festival at Ramjas College featured an array of events, including a rock band competition, street dance, street play, fashion show, and live performances by bands like Strings, Lazy River, Half Step Down, and Astitva. However, the fest was marred by student fights and an incident where someone threw stones at the band Strings. Despite the disruptions, the festival continued with engaging activities and a live concert by Strings. Apologies were offered, and the event concluded with the band's performance.

headline: In call with Abbas, PM Modi condoles Gaza hospital deaths, reiterates India stand on Israel-Palestine issue
article:
In their first phone conversation since the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel and the retaliatory Israeli strikes that have sent tensions soaring across West Asia, Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas Thursday to convey condolences over the loss of civilian lives at the Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza City.

The Prime Minister reiterated India’s “long-standing principled position on the Israel-Palestine issue”“Spoke to the President of the Palestinian Authority H.E. Mahmoud Abbas. Conveyed my condolences at the loss of civilian lives at the Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza. We will continue to send humanitarian assistance for the Palestinian people. Shared our deep concern at the terrorism, violence and deteriorating security situation in the region. Reiterated India’s long-standing principled position on the Israel-Palestine issue,” Modi said in a post on X.
summary:
In their first phone conversation since the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel and the retaliatory Israeli strikes that have sent tensions soaring across West Asia, Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas Thursday to convey condolences over the loss of civilian lives at the Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza City.

The Prime Minister reiterated India’s “long-standing principled position on the Israel-Palestine issue”“Spoke to the President of the Palestinian Authority H.E. Mahmoud Abbas. Conveyed my condolences at the loss of civilian lives at the Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza. We will continue to send humanitarian assistance for the Palestinian people. Shared our deep concern at the terrorism, violence and deteriorating security situation in the region. Reiterated India’s long-standing principled position on the Israel-Palestine issue,” Modi said in a post on X.

The Palestinians have blamed an Israeli missile strike for the deaths at the Al Ahli Hospital while Israel has maintained that a rocket launched by the Palestinian Islamic Jihad had misfired and landed on the hospital, resulting in casualties.

A day earlier, Modi had reacted to the Gaza hospital incident. “Deeply shocked at the tragic loss of lives at the Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza. Our heartfelt condolences to the families of the victims, and prayers for speedy recovery of those injured.His remarks were in line with the statement earlier by the Ministry of External Affairs whose spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said there was an universal obligation to observe international humanitarian law, and also a global responsibility to fight the menace of terrorism in all its forms and manifestations.

Modi’s call to Abbas came days after he spoke to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to extend solidarity. On October 10, Modi thanked Netanyahu “for his phone call and providing an update on the ongoing situation” and said  “people of India stand in solidarity with Israel in this difficult hour”.

headline: City rickshaw drivers go on strike
article:
Pune: Members of the city’s largest rickshaw union, the Rickshaw Panchyat (RP), went on a flash strike on Saturday following the arrest of the their leader Baba Adhav. Adhav and other members of the RP, who had planned a morcha to protest against compulsory uniforms for autorickshaw drivers, were arrested by the police around 12.30 pm on Saturday.
The police later released them around 4.30 pm. The Rickshaw Panchayat has called for an indefinite strike from January 3. Meanwhile, a few other auto unions, including the Pune City Autorickshaw Federation, said they will continue their services.
summary:
Pune: Members of the city’s largest rickshaw union, the Rickshaw Panchyat (RP), went on a flash strike on Saturday following the arrest of the their leader Baba Adhav. Adhav and other members of the RP, who had planned a morcha to protest against compulsory uniforms for autorickshaw drivers, were arrested by the police around 12.30 pm on Saturday.
The police later released them around 4.30 pm. The Rickshaw Panchayat has called for an indefinite strike from January 3. Meanwhile, a few other auto unions, including the Pune City Autorickshaw Federation, said they will continue their services.

headline: Indian coal barons’ $10 billion global mine investments may flounder
article:
About $10 billion worth of investments made by Indian coal barons, including billionaire Anil Ambani, Gautam Adani, L. Madhusudhan Rao, GVK Reddy and G. M. Rao, in buying mines overseas may go down the drain due to declining global prices of the commodity and a surge in domestic output.

Most of these billion-dollar coal mine acquisitions were made between 2008 and 2012 to fuel their power plants in India at a time when the price of coal was at its peak. Since the international prices of coal have declined by almost half to $45 a tonne many of these coal mines have become economically unviable, forcing the coal barons to monetise their coal assets. India's >coal imports may be negligible by 2023 as Coal India, the world’s largest coal producer, is set to double its coal production to one billion tonnes by 2020.
summary: $10 billion dollars investment by many billionaire in india in buying mines

headline: Deccan Chronicle
article:
New Delhi: The chairman of Hyderabad-based English daily Deccan Chronicle T. Venkatram Reddy was on Saturday arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in connection with alleged default of ₹ 357 crore loan from Canara Bank.
CBI sources said the arrest was in connection with a case registered by it against the company Deccan Chronicle Holdings Ltd in July 2013 on the basis of a complaint from Canara Bank, Bangalore.The agency had registered a case of alleged cheating and criminal conspiracy against Venkatram Reddy in 2013. The bank had refused to restructure the loan taken by the company that had remained unpaid.

Reddy was taken into custody by a CBI team from Bangalore after a brief questioning, sources said. Vice chairman and managing director of the company T. Vinayak Ravi Reddy has also been arrested, CBI sources said.

summary:
New Delhi: The chairman of Hyderabad-based English daily Deccan Chronicle T. Venkatram Reddy was on Saturday arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in connection with alleged default of ₹ 357 crore loan from Canara Bank.
CBI sources said the arrest was in connection with a case registered by it against the company Deccan Chronicle Holdings Ltd in July 2013 on the basis of a complaint from Canara Bank, Bangalore.The agency had registered a case of alleged cheating and criminal conspiracy against Venkatram Reddy in 2013. The bank had refused to restructure the loan taken by the company that had remained unpaid.

headline: Corruption, delays hamper startups in India: survey
article:
Corruption and delays are preventing the growth of entrepreneurship in India, according to a new survey.

The survey, undertaken by social media network, LocalCircles, showed nearly 60 per cent of the citizens felt these bottlenecks were some of the biggest hurdles to growth of entrepreneurship in the country while only 14 per cent felt funding to be the main impediment.
summary: according to survey in india the biggest hurdles for startups is corruption and delays

headline: Sri Lanka, Pakistan to expand FTA
article:
Sri Lanka and Pakistan have agreed on the inclusion of services and investment in the bilateral free trade agreement, Pakistan’s Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif said on Tuesday. This would help companies of the two nations to form joint ventures for exports to other nations, Mr. Sharif said, after participating along with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena in an event to mark the signing of several memoranda of understanding at the President’s Secretariat here.

When the FTA came into effect in June 2005, Pakistan’s exports to Sri Lanka were to the tune of $150 million. In 2010-11, they went up to $332 million but dropped to $260 million in 2013-14 and 2014-25, according to Rabiya Javeri Agha, Secretary of the Trade Development Authority of Pakistan. Under the agreement, Sri Lanka’s exports to Pakistan were valued at about $52 million, accounting for around 70 per cent of the country’s total exports to Pakistan, states a document of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.
summary: pakistan and sri lanka will now have a bilateral free trade agreement

headline: Ex-president of PSGPC gets bail in blasphemy case
article:
A former president of Pakistan Sikh Gurdwara Parbandakh Committee (PSGPC), who is facing a blasphemy charge for attacking a Gurdwara in Nankana Sahib, was on Tuesday granted bail by a Pakistani court in the case.

A division bench of the Lahore High Court headed by Justice Mazhar Iqbal Sidhu accepted the application of Mastan Singh and granted him bail.
summary: former president of PSGPC on attack on gurdwara in Nankana sahib gets bail from Lahore HC

headline: Education dept refutes allegation, claims e-studio is a state of art facility
article:
ITANAGAR, 18 Oct: The education department has claimed that the e-studio which is established at the directorate of school education, Itanagar is an excellent example of state of art in Arunachal Pradesh which can cater to the need of the virtual teaching-learning of the students. Therefore, it is neither parachuted nor ill-intended project, said Amjad Tak, commissioner education.

The statement came in response to an investigation published in this daily where it showed that e-learning studio and virtual classroom had failed despite expenditure of lakhs of rupees.

The e-studio is a good resource centre for the state to develop e-content to impart education at all levels inBelow is the full statement from the department.

In line with the Ministry of Education’s guidelines and the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, online education is a crucial component of the current educational policy in Arunachal Pradesh. The COVID-19 pandemic made physical classes unfeasible, necessitating the adoption of open-source digital learning solutions and e-learning management software, the statement read.

A location within the new block of the secondary education directorate building was identified for the e-learning project. Collaboration with IIT Madras and NPTEL, known for their expertise, was considered. Detailed project estimates were submitted by Krishnan Krishnamurty from IIT Madras after extensive discussions. However, the proposed Memorandum of Understanding had some issues and was under consideration with modifications.

IIT Madras sent experts to Arunachal Pradesh, highlighting the need for a resilient network for successful e-learning implementation.

Apart their proposals were not rejected by the govt. of Arunachal Pradesh and were kept for consideration with some modifications in the proposals.
summary:
ITANAGAR, 18 Oct: The education department has claimed that the e-studio which is established at the directorate of school education, Itanagar is an excellent example of state of art in Arunachal Pradesh which can cater to the need of the virtual teaching-learning of the students. Therefore, it is neither parachuted nor ill-intended project, said Amjad Tak, commissioner education.

The statement came in response to an investigation published in this daily where it showed that e-learning studio and virtual classroom had failed despite expenditure of lakhs of rupees.
