Refusing to interfere, justice Swarana Kanta of the Delhi high court Sharma said that the ED is the premier investigating agency and the court would desist from insinuating or imputing any political motives to it
The Delhi high court on Friday dismissed Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Rajya Sabha member Sanjay Singh’s plea while upholding his arrest and remand by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the money laundering case registered by the agency in its ongoing probe into the alleged irregularities in the now-scrapped Delhi liquor excise policy case.
Refusing to interfere, justice Sharma said that the ED is the premier investigating agency and the court would desist from insinuating or imputing any political motives to it.

“This court desists from imputing political affiliations or objects to the premier investigating agency. This court will not at this stage insinuate or impute any political motivates to the agency in the absence of any political record,” the court said.

The court was of the view that it was not appropriate for the court to interfere at the stage when the investigation into the scam was at a “premature and nascent stage.”

Singh was arrested by the ED on October 4, following a day-long interrogation by the agency officials at his Delhi residence for his alleged role in procuring favours for himself and certain businessmen through his aides by influencing the excise policy.
On October 10, special judge MK Nagpal while extending Singh’s ED remand for three days directed the Investigating Officer (IO) to analyse all digital data without any delay and also complete the interrogation and confrontation of the accused as well as examination of relevant witnesses. Singh called the charges made against him “false and baseless” and alleged a political witch-hunt by the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led government at the Centre.

The bench in its judgement on Friday also ruled Dinesh Arora’s statement, a co-accused, who had turned approver in the case.

Calling Singh a “key conspirator” of the Delhi liquor scam, the ED appearing through additional solicitor general (ASG) SV Raju on Thursday, told the high court that Singh was capable of “tampering with the evidence as he had access to confidential documents”.
The law officer also said that the ED while conducting a search at his house had recovered a photo of a printout of Arora’s statement recorded by ED officials.

“The photo shows that it was taken in the ED office. The issue is that he had access to the ED office. The document shows that it was a table in the ED office. There are files of ED lying & photographs are taken,” said ASG Raju.

He added that Singh’s arrest was legal and in accordance with the law and was not a consequence of Singh sending a legal notice to ED officials and demanding an apology from them for allegedly making false and derogatory claims about him in the excise policy case.
“His (Sanjay Singh) involvement had not surfaced after he gave us a notice but before that only. This was much before he gave a media bite. Evidence was not collected after he gave us notice. That is a bogey,” he added.

The ASG further argued that the remand order passed by the judge was not mechanical and was passed after due application of mind.

Responding to the law officer’s submissions of Singh being an influential person, advocate Rajat Bharadwaj appearing for Singh contended that Arora’s statement was already in the public domain.

He had earlier submitted before the court that the ED’s entire case against him was based on the statement of co-accused – Arora, who had turned approver in the excise case being probed by the agency.
summary: Sanjay Singh, a Rajya Sabha member for the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), was detained by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money laundering case involving the Delhi liquor excise policy, and his detention was maintained by the Delhi High Court. Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma declined to get involved, citing the ED's position as the top investigative body and dodging accusations of political motivations. Allegations of influencing excise regulations for private and professional gain led to Singh's arrest on October 4. The court determined that it was improper to get involved in a current investigation at such a "premature and nascent stage." Singh claimed the BJP-led administration was conducting a political witch hunt.

headline: Expose misdeeds of corrupt government: Adik
article: nagpur: maharashtra pradesh congress committee (mpcc) president govindrao adik on thursday called upon party workers to expose before masses, the "misdeeds and corrupt practices" of national democratic alliance government at centre. "it is time now for party workers to gather indepth knowledge of large number of scams that have rocked the country," adik said. "if you know about them properly, then only you would be able to explain to grassroot workers, right upto taluka places," adik said on the opening day of two-day training camp for party workers from east vidarbha. alleging that the nda government has "set a world record of sorts" in scams in the country, adik said, it (nda) has lost moral right to continue in office. giving a clarion call to partymen to dislodge the "communal" government when the elections are conducted, he said "a mistake committed during last general election by the voters had enabled the nda to gain power at centre." congress has a history and legacy behind it right from the days of freedom struggle, he said adding, it is the responsibility of partymen to strengthen hands of party president sonia gandhi
summary: Govindrao Adik, the President of the Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee, has urged party workers to expose the alleged "misdeeds and corrupt practices" of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government at the center. He highlighted various scandals and claimed that the NDA government has lost the moral right to continue in office. Adik called on party members to work towards removing the "communal" government in the upcoming elections.

headline: Scammers amass $1.02 trillion globally, Singapore lost the most: Report
article: The study surveyed 49,459 individuals from 43 countries in which they were asked about the types of frauds they fall into and the amount they lost to fraudsters Scammers made off with an estimate amount of $1.02 trillion between August 2022 and August 2023 globally with victims in Singapore faced the highest average losses, according to a study by the Global Anti-Scam Alliance (GASA) and ScamAdviser, reported The Straits Times.
summary:
Reports indicate that scammers have managed to amass a staggering $1.02 trillion globally through various fraudulent activities. Of particular concern is the fact that Singapore is reported to have lost the most significant amount to these scams. This highlights the global issue of financial fraud and the need for increased efforts to combat it.

Scammers use a variety of tactics, including phishing, Ponzi schemes, identity theft, and online scams, to defraud individuals, businesses, and governments. These activities not only cause significant financial losses but also have far-reaching social and economic impacts.

Efforts to combat these scams often involve increased awareness, better cybersecurity practices, and law enforcement actions. It is essential for individuals and organizations to remain vigilant and adopt best practices to protect themselves against such financial fraud. The high financial toll and the widespread impact of these scams emphasize the urgency of tackling this issue on a global scale.

headline: China on alert against dengue fever
article: beijing: china has declared an alert against dengue fever, cases of which are found in some south-east asian nations like thailand. chinese citizens who have travelled in south-east asian nations were required to report to quarantine authorities after entering china if symptoms like headache, fever or skin eruptions occur, china daily quoted health and quarantine officials as saying. the report said since may, some southeast asian nations like thailand have been experiencing a serious outbreak of dengue fever, a kind of acute epidemic originating in tropical and subtropical regions. concerned about the disease, departments such as state general administration for quality supervision and inspection and quarantine, the ministry of health and the national tourism administration issued a joint circular to keep the epidemic out of china. vehicles and containers from the regions hit by dengue fever should be strictly checked for mosquitoes, which are responsible for the spread of the dengue virus, according to the circular.
summary: China has declared an alert against dengue fever, with a particular focus on travelers returning from Southeast Asian nations. Chinese citizens who have visited these regions are required to report to quarantine authorities if they exhibit symptoms like headache, fever, or skin eruptions. This alert comes in response to a serious outbreak of dengue fever in some Southeast Asian countries, particularly Thailand. Various Chinese departments, including the State General Administration for Quality Supervision and Inspection and Quarantine, the Ministry of Health, and the National Tourism Administration, have issued a joint circular to prevent the epidemic from spreading to China. They are also taking measures to inspect vehicles and containers coming from regions affected by dengue fever, as mosquitoes are responsible for transmitting the dengue virus.

headline: Tyagi still in Intensive Care Unit
article: mumbai: former city police commissioner r d tyagi, now under arrest in connection with the 1993 suleman bakery firing case, continued to be in the intensive care unit at bombay hospital. tyagi, who was admitted to hospital on tuesday night after he complained of chest pain, was remanded to police custody on wednesday till august 23 by a local court. tyagi, the then joint police commissioner, was indicted in a case for ordering firing at the suleman bakery, during the mumbai 1992-93 riots, resulting in the death of nine persons. he was arrested on august 14 after the supreme court rejected his anticipatory bail petition.
summary: Former city police commissioner R. D. Tyagi, who is under arrest in connection with the 1993 Suleman Bakery firing case, remains in the intensive care unit at Bombay Hospital. Tyagi was admitted to the hospital after complaining of chest pain. He was remanded to police custody until August 23 by a local court. Tyagi, who was the joint police commissioner at the time, was indicted for ordering firing at Suleman Bakery during the 1992-93 Mumbai riots, resulting in the deaths of nine people. He was arrested on August 14 after the Supreme Court rejected his anticipatory bail petition.

headline: European Investment Bank delegation visits Agra Metro Rail Project
article:
The delegation visited both corridors of the project on Thursday and praised team Agra Metro for the timely construction of the project, stated the press statement issued by the public relations office for UPMRC.
A three-member delegation from the European Investment Bank (EIB) visited the Agra Metro Rail Project and expressed their satisfaction with the pace of execution of the metro as well as the international quality and safety standards which are being adopted while executing the project, claimed officials at Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRC) in Agra.
The delegation visited both corridors of the project on Thursday and praised team Agra Metro for the timely construction of the project, stated the press statement issued by the public relations office for UPMRC.
Out of the total funding for the Agra Metro Rail Project around 450 million euros is provided by European Investment Bank which is made available through pass-through assistance. The remaining amount is contributed by the Centre and the state governments.

The total project cost for the Agra Metro Rail Project is approximately ₹8739 crores.

Director of finance at UPMRC Sheel Kumar Mittal said, “We are happy to receive EIB’s cooperation and support for Lucknow, Kanpur and Agra Metro Rail Projects and hope that our partnership goes a long way for providing a world-class urban transportation system in Uttar Pradesh.”
Speaking on the same, MD UPMRC Sushil Kumar said, ”The metro project is scheduled to be inaugurated for the people of Agra in March 2024, which is ahead of the originally set deadline- August 2024. The team UPMRC is fully committed to executing the project in a time-bound manner.”

Along with MD UPMRC Sushil Kumar, director of finance UPMRC Sheel Kumar Mittal, director of works and infrastructure UPMRC Chandra Pal Singh and project director Agra Shri Arvind Rai were present during the visit.

It is to be noted that currently the project is being executed on the first corridor of Agra Metro Rail Project. On the 6km long priority stretch marked on the first corridor, three elevated stations are ready and high-speed train trails are being done on the 3km long viaduct.
Similarly, in the remaining 3km long underground section, tunnel construction is being done at a fast pace. One side of the 6km long priority stretch (from Ramlila Maidan to Taj East Gate) is complete. The track work has commenced in the underground section and is progressing at a fast pace.
summary:
The delegation visited both corridors of the project on Thursday and praised team Agra Metro for the timely construction of the project, stated the press statement issued by the public relations office for UPMRC.
Out of the total funding for the Agra Metro Rail Project around 450 million euros is provided by European Investment Bank which is made available through pass-through assistance. 
The total project cost for the Agra Metro Rail Project is approximately ₹8739 crores.

headline: First artificially-bred twin Panda to give birth
article: beijing: yaya, one of the world's first artificially-bred twin panda, is likely to give birth soon, an expert at the chengdu giant panda breeding base said. born in august, yaya and her brother xiangxiang, became the first artificially-bred twins to survive and are among the 13 pregnant pandas being raised in south china's sichuan province. yaya has been pregnant for 155 days. but as a panda's gestation varies from some 80 days to 180 days, it's hard for experts to judge the exact due date, li guanghan, director of the breeding base said. staff at the breeding base have started a 24-hour watch on yaya in case she suddenly goes into labour. her appetite decreased less than a month ago, and now she only drinks water and milk. yaya spends most of her time sleeping inside her quarters, a report said. the breeding centre has built air-conditioned delivery rooms for the pregnant pandas at a cost of over 480,000 usd. meanwhile, a pregnant giant panda who wandered away from the wolong giant panda protection centre in the same province some two months ago has yet to be found. the panda named, 'baixue', which means 'white snow', left the centre on may 30. the panda was spotted on a mountain four km way from the breeding centre by a local farmer at the end of june, but there have been no reports of her since. currently, 74 wild giant pandas are living in the nature reserve.
summary: Yaya, one of the world's first artificially-bred twin pandas, is expected to give birth soon. She and her brother Xiangxiang became the first artificially-bred twins to survive. Yaya has been pregnant for 155 days, but due to variations in panda gestation, it's hard to pinpoint the exact due date. The Chengdu Giant Panda Breeding Base staff has started a 24-hour watch on Yaya as she approaches her due date, and they have built air-conditioned delivery rooms for the pregnant pandas.

headline: Justice Siddharth Mridul sworn in as 7th Chief Justice of Manipur high court
article:
The 61-year-old Justice graduated from Delhi’s Hindu College, and completed his LLB from Campus Law Centre, Faculty of Law, University of Delhi in 1986
Justice Siddharth Mridul was on Friday sworn in as the 7th Chief Justice of the Manipur high court by Governor Anusuiya Uikey at the Raj Bhavan in Imphal.
Manipur chief minister Nongthombam Biren Singh, his council of ministers, MLAs and top officials of the civil and state police, along with other dignitaries of the state, were present during the swearing in ceremony.
“I feel wonderful from what I have seen ever since I arrived. It’s a calm, quiet and wonderful place. I look forward for a productive tenure here,” he said.

The 61-year-old Justice graduated from Delhi’s Hindu College, and completed his LLB from Campus Law Centre, Faculty of Law, University of Delhi in 1986. He enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi on July 24 in the same year. \

Throughout his career, he practiced law in original civil and appellate jurisdictions, including the Delhi high court, as well as other renowned courts and tribunals, according to people familiar with the matter.
He was also appointed by Delhi HC as member in various committees for issues of rehabilitation of children after the abolition of child labour, illegal constriction in contravention of municipal byelaws, and to suggest, supervise and implement measures for efficient and hygienic functioning of the Safdarjung hospital.

Mridul was appointed as an additional judge of the Delhi HC in 2008 and later became a permanent judge on 26 May 2009.

Justice Mridul was appointed as the chief justice of the Manipur HC on October 16, more than three months after his name was recommended by the Supreme Court Collegium, due to the ethnic turmoil in the northeastern border state.

“I hope the appointment of a mature and competent Chief Justice will help in bringing peace and normalcy in the state,” Biren Singh said.
summary: A 61-year-old lawyer named Justice Siddharth Mridul was sworn in as the 7th Chief Justice of the Manipur high court. Nongthombam Biren Singh, the chief minister of Manipur, and other dignitaries attended the ceremony, which was held at the Raj Bhavan in Imphal. In his remarks, Justice Mridul expressed confidence for his time in Manipur. He earned his LLB from the University of Delhi's Campus Law Center in 1986, went on to practice law in a number of different countries, and participated in committees looking at topics including the elimination of child labor and effective healthcare. He was appointed in an effort to stabilize the northeastern state.

headline: Sub-inspector shot dead
article: patna: a sub-inspector of police was killed in a cross-firing between two rival gangs of criminals near mokama police station in patna district on thursday, police said. they said mahendra prasad singh received bullet injuries and died in exchange of fire between the rival gangs. senior police superintendent sunil kumar along with other police officials rushed to the spot. police patrolling has been intensified in he area.
summary: A sub-inspector of police was killed in a crossfire between two rival gangs of criminals near Mokama police station in Patna district. The sub-inspector, Mahendra Prasad Singh, sustained fatal gunshot wounds during the exchange of fire between the rival gangs. Senior police officials, including Senior Police Superintendent Sunil Kumar, arrived at the scene, and police patrolling in the area has been intensified.

headline: Tripura police adopt security measures to ensure peaceful Durga Puja
article:
This year, over 950 Durga Puja pandals have been set up in Tripura West district, of which 800 are in the Sadar sub-division
The Tripura police administration has adopted strict security measures in the West district, the largest district in the state, to ensure peaceful Durga Puja starting Saturday. As part of preparations, 2,520 Tripura State Rifles (TSR) personnel would be deployed, in addition to deployment of 700 state police, 400 Special Police Officers (SPO) in different parts of the district.
Besides, 60 police assistance booths, 25 naka (check post) points and 60 police booths have been set up to extend assistance to people whenever required.

“We held a meeting with the West district magistrate on the issue and have asked the Power Department to cut wires on crossings to ensure people involved in procession do not face any problem. We have also kept fire tenders on stand-by. We shall keep on checking vehicles at naka points. Our director general of police is also giving more attention to the traffic system,” West district superintendent of police Kiran Kumar told the reporters in Agartala. This year, over 950 Durga Puja pandals have been set up in the district, of which 800 are in the Sadar sub-division.

Kumar said that a team of police has already visited the puja pandals and asked organisers to keep volunteers and security personnel stationed to oversee crowd management inside and outside the pandals, and also to keep safety measures such as fire extinguishers, etc.

“We appeal to the people to follow traffic guidelines. Hope, the puja will go on peacefully,” he said.

He added that there would 16 no-entry points in Agartala and its outskirts, including Circuit House, Bodhjungnagar Chowmuhani, Bhagaban Thakur Chowmuhani, Old Central Jail, Gandhighat, Kaman Chowmuhani, Shib Bari, Central Road, Golbazar, Ramthakur Sangha, Sanghati Club, Chittaranjan Road, Dashamighat, Joynagar bus-stand, Melarmath, Paradise Chowmuhani etc., during the Durga Puja.
summary: To guarantee a tranquil Durga Puja, the Tripura police administration has implemented strong security measures in the West area. Along with state police and Special Police Officers, more than 2,500 members of the Tripura State Rifles will be stationed throughout the district. In order to aid the general public, 60 police assistance booths, 25 checkpoints, and 60 police booths have been created. During the celebrations, traffic regulations will be strictly adhered to, with 16 no-entry points in and around Agartala. The numerous Durga Puja pandals erected in the area are intended to be protected by the security measures.

headline: 8 months on, Ambala school students still in unsafe rooms
article:
In February, the education department had identified 330 classrooms of a total of 90 government schools unsafe across the district including, Mirzapur, Matheri Jattan, Lakhnaura Sahib, Rawalon, Police Lines, and Kalrehri villages of Ambala-1 block
Eight months after several government primary schools in Ambala were declared unsafe, the process to demolish unsafe rooms in at least six government primary schools is yet to begin. In February, the education department had identified 330 classrooms of a total of 90 government schools unsafe across the district including, Mirzapur, Matheri Jattan, Lakhnaura Sahib, Rawalon, Police Lines, and Kalrehri villages of Ambala-1 block. While the other rooms were razed, 19 unsafe rooms in six primary schools still need to be demolished.

The list of unsafe rooms was sent by the office of district project coordinator of Samagra Shiksha to the public works department (buildings and roads) to fix the reserve price for the unsafe rooms.

At Government Primary School in Rawalon village of Ambala-1 block, nearly 45 students of different classes are forced to study inside unsafe buildings and sometimes in the open.

Parents complained that their wards are forced to study under such unsafe structures.
Villagers led by panch Gurcharan Singh reached the deputy commissioner’s office last week demanding an early redressal of their issue.

Singh said that he made repeated rounds of the education department’s office at Shiksha Sadan and PWD office to get the primary school’s building demolished, but to no avail.

“Students have no other option except these rooms as there is no other building nearby. There are 40-45 students at the school till class 5th. What if any untoward incident takes place at the school? The department should take early measures,” he added.

Sudhir Kalra, district elementary education officer (DEEO), Ambala, said that reminders were sent twice in May and in July to the PWD requesting the reserve price for the unsafe rooms.
summary: It has taken eight months longer than expected to demolish dangerous rooms in at least six government primary schools in Ambala, Haryana. In 90 public schools in the district, the education department found 330 hazardous classrooms in February. 19 rooms in six primary schools are still standing, but the other dangerous rooms were demolished. Parents and locals have expressed concern about the students that study in these buildings. To estimate the reserve price for their demolition, the public works department received a list of dangerous rooms from the Samagra Shiksha district project coordinator's office. Reminders were given to the PWD, according to the district elementary education officer, in order to speed up the procedure.

headline: FATEHPUR SIKRI: Case filed against accused for misbehaving with female tourists
article:
The FIR was lodged by Shakir Ali, the approved guide of Uttar Pradesh tourism who was accompanying three women tourists from the US who had visited Fatehpur Sikri on Wednesday.
A case was registered on Thursday against the staff member plying bus at Fatehpur Sikri, who allegedly misbehaved with female tourists from the United States while they were visiting the Fatehpur Sikri monument on Wednesday.
To make up for the damage done to the city’s image as a tourist destination, the Agra police got active and extended a warm welcome to these women tourists and facilitated their convenient and pleasant visit to the Taj Mahal on Thursday.
“A case was registered at Fatehpur Sikri police station late on Wednesday night under section 504 (insult to provoke) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code against Aleem Qureshi, a resident of Fatehpur Sikri who was at the ticket counter of pay station for bus ferrying tourists to the main monument,” stated assistant commissioner of police (ACP) for Taj Security at Agra.

The FIR was lodged by Shakir Ali, the approved guide of Uttar Pradesh tourism who was accompanying three women tourists from the US who had visited Fatehpur Sikri on Wednesday.
“The accused Aleem Qureshi did not refund the remaining change after bus tickets were bought and when asked to do so, he misbehaved with tourists and issued threats to me,” stated Shakir Ali in the FIR lodged.

The authorities at Agra Development Authority, running the bus service for tourists at Fatehpur Sikri, also took note of the incident and assured action against the culprit.

It may be recalled that Denise Williams, a woman tourist from the United States had lodged a complaint against the alleged misbehaviour by a staff member involved in plying of buses at Fatehpur Sikri monument, 40 kilometres from Agra, on Wednesday.

“We came to know about the incident and the allegations made by the woman tourist who was assured of a probe. The statements of those concerned were recorded and CCTV footage was inspected leading to the FIR lodged on Wednesday night,” stated Syed Areeb Ahmed, the assistant commissioner of police (Taj security).
summary: A criminal case has been filed against an employee who drove a bus in Fatehpur Sikri, India, for allegedly misbehaving with American tourists  during a visit to the Fatehpur Sikri memorial. The case, registered under sections 504 (provocation) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code, was filed by Shakir Ali, a certified tour guide from Uttar Pradesh  who accompanied the American tourists. The authorities took the matter seriously and the Agra Development Authority, which is responsible for Fatehpur Sikri bus routes, confirmed a case against the accused employee. In response, the Agra police welcomed women tourists and facilitated their visit to the Taj Mahal to restore the  image of the city as a tourist destination.

headline: Hundreds of inmates observing Navratri fast at Naini Central Jail
article:
Prayers and meditation have become a part of daily routine of many prisoners lodged at the Naini Central Jail these days. While following the rituals of Navratri, hundreds of them are also observing fast and the jail administration has made special arrangements for such inmates.
Prayers and meditation have become a part of daily routine of many prisoners lodged at the Naini Central Jail these days. While following the rituals of Navratri, hundreds of them are also observing fast and the jail administration has made special arrangements for such inmates. Jail officials said on the first day of Navratri, 1,294 prisoners observed fast while 567 prisoners observed fast on the second day. On the third day, 626 prisoners observed the Navratri fast while on Wednesday and Thursday, 567 prisoners were reported to have observed the fast. Among them, 524 are male prisoners while 43 are women jail inmates.

Senior superintendent at Naini Central Jail Rangbahadur said special arrangements have been made for the prisoners who are observing fast. For each of them, 750 grams of boiled potatoes, half litre of milk, sugar and bananas are provided.

Jail officials further said that the number of prisoners observing fast increases during the concluding days of Navratri. Moreover, many of the prisoners keep fast on all nine days of Navratri during which their daily routine changes. The prisoners perform prayers and meditate for reforming themselves, said officials.
The jail administration also makes special arrangements for prisoners who observe fast during Ramazan. Special diet is provided to such prisoners.
summary: Nain Central Jail inmates incorporate prayers and meditation into their daily routines as they observe Navratri rituals. Hundreds of inmates are fasting during this time and the prison administration has made special arrangements for them. Prison Superintendent Rangbahadur mentioned that prisoners observing the  fast are given special provisions, including 750 grams of boiled potatoes, half a liter of milk, sugar and bananas. The number of fasting prisoners usually increases in the closing days of Navratri, with many fasting all nine days to improve. The prison administration also caters to inmates fasting during Ramadan and provides them with a special diet.

headline: New recruitment uncertain, 4.43L TET (primary) certs also stuck
article:
While there has been no new recruitment drive undertaken to recruit teachers in government-run primary schools of Uttar Pradesh in the past five years, a whopping 4.43 lakh certificates of Uttar Pradesh Teacher Eligibility Test (Primary Level)-2021 are also entangled in legal complications.
While there has been no new recruitment drive undertaken to recruit teachers in government-run primary schools of Uttar Pradesh in the past five years, a whopping 4.43 lakh certificates of Uttar Pradesh Teacher Eligibility Test (Primary Level)-2021 are also entangled in legal complications. On August 11, the Supreme Court had rejected the notification of June 28, 2018 of the National Council of Teacher Education (NCTE) regarding BEd being treated as eligibility for teacher recruitment for teaching classes 1 to 5. After this, the successful candidates in Uttar Pradesh Teachers’ Eligibility Test (UPTET)-2021 were hopeful of getting their certificates that are stuck with the Examination Regulatory Authority, UP.

But in the case of UPTET (primary level) candidates, due to non-disposal of a petition filed by the Diploma in Elementary Education (DElEd) trainees in the Allahabad High Court, distribution of their certificates has been stopped while that of upper primary level is proceeding ahead.

After the decision of the Supreme Court, the Examination Regulatory Authority, UP sent the certificates of 2.16 lakh candidates successful in the UPTET upper primary level to the different District Education and Training Institutes (DIETs) of the state for distribution. But due to the pending case in the high court filed against BEd candidates being considered for teaching primary level students, no decision has been taken regarding the certificates of 4.43 lakh candidates successful in the primary level UP TET, nor have they been sent to the DIETs.

Not only this, the unemployed who were protesting on even minor issues are also sitting silent regarding the certificate even after over one-and-a-half-year of the declaration of UPTET-2021 result on April 8, 2022 as no new recruitment of primary school teachers has been declared by the state government.

DIET-Prayagraj principal Rajendra Pratap said that 18,798 certificates of UPTET upper primary level have been received by his institution for distribution.

“We are going to distribute them to the candidates concerned by making people aware of the availability of the certificates with us,” he added. It is worth mentioning that the results of UPTET-2021, held on January 23, 2022, were declared after about just two-and-a-half months on April 8, 2022. In this, DElEd candidates were more successful than BEd candidates. A total of 2,20,065 BEd candidates and 2,23,533 DElEd candidates were declared successful in primary level UPTET. A total of 6,60,592 candidates including 4,43,598 candidates of primary level UPTET examination and 2,16,994 of upper primary level UPTET were declared passed.
summary: Primary schools in the state of Uttar Pradesh have been facing significant challenges in teacher recruitment for the past five years and no new recruitment has been initiated. Besides, around 4.43 lakh Uttar Pradesh Teachers Eligibility Test (Primary)-2021 certificates are involved in legal issues. The situation was further worsened by the Supreme Court's rejection of the National Council for Teacher Education (NCTE) notification. Successful candidates of Uttar Pradesh Teacher Eligibility Test (UPTET)-2021 are waiting for their certificates to be issued but the issue is still outstanding. Meanwhile, the state government has not announced  new recruitments for primary school teachers, leaving many unemployed people in the dark.

headline: A Division Fusion: City’s love for Hanuman to echo in pandal mirroring Gujarat’s Kashtabhanjan Temple
article:
The Naveen Shardiya Utsav Durga Puja Committee in Lucknow is recreating the Kashtabhanjan Hanuman Temple in Gujarat for its Durga Puja pandal this year. The pandal, constructed using 1,800 bamboo poles, will be 60 feet tall and cost ₹8 lakh. The celebrations will begin on October 19th with 'Anando Mela' and the puja will start on October 20th. The pandal will host various events and competitions, including Kanya Puja and a conch-blowing competition. Khichdi Bhog will also be distributed to around 1,500 people per day.
LUCKNOW In Lucknow, the profound reverence for Lord Hanuman among its residents is truly unique. The city boasts numerous age-old Hanuman temples, and it comes alive with a month-long celebration of ‘Bada Mangal’ each year. In alignment with this unwavering devotion to Lord Hanuman, the Naveen Shardiya Utsav Durga Puja Committee, located on Jail Road, is poised to make a resounding statement of faith and celebration this year. The committee is setting up a Durga Puja pandal that faithfully recreates the renowned Kashtabhanjan Hanuman Temple in Sarangpur, Gujarat. The grand pandal, towering at an impressive 60 feet, is a labour of love crafted by nearly 50 skilled artisans from Kolkata. It is meticulously constructed using around 1,800 bamboo poles, at a cost of ₹8 lakh,” shared Sujay Chatterjee, the secretary of the pandal.
In commemoration of the committee’s 64th anniversary, this year, the organisers decided to honour the city’s affection for Lord Hanuman by creating a stunning replica of the famous Hanuman temple. Inside this remarkable structure, the idol of Goddess Durga, along with her entire divine family, will be venerated.

The festivities are all set to commence with ‘Anando Mela’ on Thursday evening, October 19th. Women organisers of the puja committee will grace the occasion with stalls featuring delectable dishes prepared by them. The puja itself will begin on October 20th (Shashthi), with priests and dhakis (drum players) specially brought in from Kolkata to infuse the celebration with traditional beats and religious fervour.
The pandal will host Kanya Puja on Saptami, Ashtami, and Navami, in keeping with tradition,” Chatterjee added. Numerous exciting events and competitions are also in store. These include a conch-blowing competition for both women and men, a painting competition for children, Aarti dances performed before Maa Durga to the rhythmic beats of the Dhak, and a competition for Dhunochi Aarti.

Furthermore, a Khichdi Bhog will be generously distributed, offering seating for approximately 1,500 individuals at a time, every day, providing a truly immersive cultural and spiritual experience.
summary: In Lucknow, the Naveen Shardiya Utsav Durga Puja Committee is building a grand Durga Puja pandal replicating the famous Kashtabhanjan Hanuman Temple in Sarangpur, Gujarat. The 60-feet tall pandal, made of around 1,800 bamboo sticks, is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and Goddess Durga. The celebrations  begin on October 19 with the "Anando Mela" and the puja begins on October 20. The Pandal organizes various events and competitions including Kanya Puja, Congee Blowing Competitions, Aarti Dances and  Dhunochi Aarti Competition. Besides, Khichdi Bhogi is distributed to around 1500 people every day.

headline: Mother of all Durga Pujas: Bengali Club’s time-honoured grandeur shines amidst modern-day glitz
article:
The Lucknow Bengali Club, established in 1914, is celebrating its 109th year of Durga Puja. The club has preserved its Bengali traditions and has deep-rooted connections within the community. The oldest living member shares memories of historic visits by Netaji and Tagore.
LUCKNOW Durga Puja in Lucknow has undergone a magnificent transformation, with a profusion of theme-based puja pandals now adorning the city, and millions of rupees poured into creating unparalleled spectacles. Amid this evolving landscape, the Lucknow Bengali Club stands as a shining example, faithfully preserving its Bengali traditions since its inception in 1914 by Atul Krishna Sinha. This year, the club marks an impressive 109 years of celebrating Durga Puja, welcoming both new and long-standing members.
Established in 1914 with a humble purchase of land for a mere Re 1, the Lucknow Bengali Club has a rich history etched in time. Manindra Nath Pal (92), the club’s senior-most member, shares an intriguing tidbit: “Interestingly, the land was purchased at Re 1, and back then, the membership fee was a mere 25 paise or 50 paise.”

Arun Kumar Banerjee, the president of the club, delves into the club’s origin: “Our story begins with a young and enthusiastic Sinha, who secured employment in the Indian Railways engineering department and arrived in Lucknow in 1901. Driven by his profound love for Bengali theatre and art, Sinha and his friends founded the second Bengali institution in Lucknow in 1914, aptly named ‘The Bengali Club’ (the first being the ‘Bengali Youngmen’s Association’). According to the club’s website, they initially held their celebrations in the homes of various members until they could purchase a permanent location on Hewett Road, now known as Shivaji Marg. Banerjee proudly states, “Since a majority of Bengali families resided in this area, the first public Durga Puja commenced in 1914. This celebration was grand, and it has only grown grander over the years.”

Living Testimony: A Puja with Deep-Rooted Generations

The individuals associated with the club contribute to making the puja more traditional, with many of them having deep-rooted connections to the club, spanning generations, whether as members or workers.

In addition to the nearly century-old ‘beti’ (supporting frame) of the idol, the generations-old dhakis play a pivotal role in making the Puja distinctive. “For the last 40 years, three generations of dhakis from Bengal’s Dakshin Dinajpur have been participating. Initially led by Dhuti Ram Natto, they were succeeded by his son and grandson, Madan Ram Natto and Rupam Natto,” mentioned Banerjee, who himself began volunteering at the age of 10.
Similarly, the idol has been crafted on the club premises for a century by the third generation of a family of idol makers with a century-old legacy in Lucknow. Likewise, the individuals responsible for the tent and lighting arrangements have been part of the club for four decades.

The descendants of the founding members continue to play a significant role in the club’s activities. Trisha Sinha, the great-granddaughter of Atul Krishna Sinha, one of the founding members, serves as the Assistant General Secretary of the Club. Her mother, AK Sinha’s granddaughter-in-law, is the lady vice-president of the Club.

Oldest Living Club Member Shares Memories of Puja, Netaji, and Tagore

The club’s oldest living member, 92-year-old Manindra Nath Pal, may be mostly confined to his chair, but his memory is astoundingly sharp when it comes to the club’s history. Pal reminisces, “The roof of this club was built by using a member’s car as mortgage, and six of the chairs from the first batch remain intact.” He designed advertorial posters for the club Puja in his prime.
Manindra Nath Pal also recounts significant moments in the club’s history. During the Emergency in 1975, the Puja celebrations were quieter than usual. Pal recalls, “Naturally, we could not compromise on the Puja, but we shut off all the lights, and there were no dhaks or music. We only prayed and ate together that year.”

Pal vividly remembers the historic visits of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose in 1938 and Rabindranath Tagore in the 1920s. “The framed picture of Netaji now graces the Bengali Club hall,” he says. He fondly recalls, “Our club members held aloft swords, and Netaji walked under them when he entered the premises. We kids were not allowed inside, so we stood outside to catch a glimpse.” Tagore’s visit, he says, is part of the club’s cherished folklore: “We have only heard stories of when Tagore came to Lucknow in the 1920s. He was carried in a palanquin from Charbagh to AP Sen’s home, one of the club’s founders, where he stayed for a couple of days.”
summary: Founded in 1914, the Lucknow Bengali Club is celebrating its 109th  Durga Puja anniversary, honoring Bengali traditions and maintaining deep-rooted community ties. Manindra Nath Pal, the oldest living member of the club, shares memories of the historic visits of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose and Rabindranath Tagore. The  rich history of the club is marked by its century-old idol Beti (supporting frame)  and generational daks. Trisha Sinha, the great-granddaughter of one of the founding members, serves as the club's assistant general secretary. The club is known for maintaining its traditions by celebrating Durga Puja in a grand manner.

headline: Metro vs Municipal: No U-turn on UPMRC property tax notices, says LMC
article:
Notably, it’s not just UPMRC that’s in LMC’s crosshairs. The Indian Railways has also received a property tax recovery notice amounting to ₹73 crore.
LUCKNOW The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) has specified that it will not withdraw the property tax notices issued to the Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRC). Ambi Bisht, the chief tax fixation officer of LMC, made this announcement on Thursday, emphasising that the LMC is fully entitled to collect taxes from UPMRC for the services it provides. Bisht pointed out that commercial establishments, such as pizza places and eateries, operate at several metro stations, profiting from their presence. However, these establishments have been reluctant to pay taxes, despite the fact that LMC is responsible for managing the waste generated by metro stations and their commercial enterprises. With 21 metro stations under their purview, LMC has served a notice to recover ₹7.57 crore in taxes from UPMRC, an amount that LMC believes is a reasonable contribution given the services provided. Additionally, LMC is preparing to issue another notice to UPMRC, this time regarding the taxation of advertisements displayed on poles without LMC’s consent. Bisht asserted that the revenue from advertising within the city should rightfully belong to LMC. Notably, it’s not just UPMRC that’s in LMC’s crosshairs. The Indian Railways has also received a property tax recovery notice amounting to ₹73 crore. Both UPMRC and the railways have been given a one-month ultimatum to settle their dues; otherwise, LMC will take more stringent actions against them.

Municipal commissioner Inderjeet Singh echoed LMC’s stance, emphasizing that the metro must pay property tax since there are no directives from the state government for tax exemptions in the case of the metro.

In response, an official from UPMRC argued that they are entitled to exemptions from state and local taxes, citing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) dated March 16, 2016, signed between the state, the Centre, and UPMRC. The MoU explicitly commits to exempting UPMRC from state and local taxes, duties, and levies, if any. The UPMRC official mentioned that they have presented their case to higher state government authorities, firmly believing that, with government support in accordance with the MoU’s provisions, they can ensure the profitability and long-term sustainability of the metro rail network in Uttar Pradesh, which remains an essential lifeline for the state’s urban population.

Furthermore, the outstanding loan of 450 million Euros from the European Investment Bank (EIB) underscores the critical importance of adhering to the MoU provisions for the financial well-being of UPMRC.
summary: Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) stands by its decision not to withdraw property tax notifications issued to  Uttar Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (UPMRC). LMC is demanding property tax of ₹ 7.57 crore  from UPMRC as it believes that the metro system will benefit from  services provided by LMC, including waste management. The LMC also plans to issue another notification regarding taxation of advertisements displayed without the permission of the LMC. UPMRC claims they are entitled to tax exemptions under a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed in 2016 and has sought  support from senior government officials to resolve the issue.

headline: "New Year begins with tragedy as 10 killed in road accidents"
article:
I understand. You want a more detailed account of the road accidents that occurred on New Year's Day 2002 in India. Here is a more detailed description of the two most deadly accidents:

**Bus-truck collision on Agra-Lucknow Expressway**

On New Year's Day 2002, a bus carrying passengers from Delhi to Lucknow collided with a truck carrying goods from Agra to Kolkata on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. The accident occurred near the town of Etah, about 100 kilometers from Agra.

According to eyewitness reports, the bus driver was driving at a high speed and lost control of the vehicle. The bus swerved into the oncoming lane and collided head-on with the truck. The impact of the collision was so severe that both vehicles were badly damaged.

Seven people, including the bus driver and six passengers, were killed in the accident. Several other people were injured and were taken to the hospital for treatment.

**Car-tree crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway**

On the same day, a car carrying passengers from Mumbai to Pune crashed into a tree on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. The accident occurred near the town of Lonavala, about 100 kilometers from Mumbai.

According to police reports, the car driver was speeding and lost control of the vehicle. The car veered off the road and crashed into a tree. The three passengers in the car were killed instantly.

These are just two of the many road accidents that occurred in India on New Year's Day 2002. The other accidents were also caused by a variety of factors, including drunk driving, speeding, and reckless driving.

The road accidents on New Year's Day 2002 are a reminder of the importance of road safety. It is important to be careful and responsible while driving, especially during the holiday season when there is more traffic on the roads. We all have a role to play in preventing accidents and keeping our roads safe.
summary: In my own words, the news article highlights the importance of road safety and the dangers of drunk driving, speeding, and reckless driving. It is important to be careful and responsible while driving, especially during the holiday season when there is more traffic on the roads. We all have a role to play in preventing accidents and keeping our roads safe.

headline: Court orders public notice on plea to wind up UBHL
article:
In a major set back to UB (Holdings) Ltd. (UBHL), the Karnataka High Court, on Friday, ordered issuance of public notices on pleas of three foreign firms, a consortium of Indian banks and an oil company for winding up of UBHL for its failure to pay dues as per the corporate guarantee given by it on behalf of Kingfisher Airlines Ltd. (KAL).

Justice A. S. Bopanna passed the order while admitting petitions filed by Switzerland-based IAE International Aero Engines, England-based Rolls Royce and Partners Finance Ltd. and RRP Engine Leasing Ltd., consortium of banks led by State Bank of India and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (HPCL). The public notices in newspapers will have to be issued in the first week of February.
summary: the plea filed by companies to wind up UBHL is accepted by the Karnataka HC by justice A.S. Bopanna

headline: PM Asks Students To Innovate, patent
article:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked students to innovate and patent their ideas, saying that this could help India become a manufacturing hub.

Addressing students at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras, Modi said that India has the potential to become a global leader in manufacturing, but it needs to focus on innovation and research.

"We have the talent, we have the resources, and we have the will. We can become a manufacturing hub for the world," Modi said. "But for that, we need to focus on innovation and research."

Modi asked students to come up with new ideas and solutions to the challenges facing India. He said that the government is committed to supporting innovation and research, and that it has launched a number of initiatives in this area.

Modi also urged students to patent their ideas, saying that this would help them protect their intellectual property and commercialize their inventions.

"If you have an idea, patent it," Modi said. "Don't let anyone steal your idea."

Modi's speech was well-received by the students, who gave him a standing ovation.

In his speech, Modi also highlighted the importance of education and skill development. He said that education is the key to success in today's world, and that students need to develop the skills that are in demand in the job market.

Modi also urged students to be patriotic and to work for the betterment of India. He said that India is a great country with a rich culture and heritage, and that it is the duty of every Indian to contribute to its development.

Modi's speech was a powerful and inspiring message to the students of IIT Madras. He challenged them to think big and to dream big. He also urged them to be innovative and to patent their ideas. Modi's speech was a timely reminder of the importance of education, skill development, and patriotism.
summary:
In his speech at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras on January 4, 2020, Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked students to innovate and patent their ideas, saying that this could help India become a manufacturing hub.

Modi said that India has the potential to become a global leader in manufacturing, but it needs to focus on innovation and research. He asked students to come up with new ideas and solutions to the challenges facing India, and said that the government is committed to supporting innovation and research.

Modi also urged students to patent their ideas, saying that this would help them protect their intellectual property and commercialize their inventions.

In addition to innovation and research, Modi also highlighted the importance of education and skill development. He said that education is the key to success in today's world, and that students need to develop the skills that are in demand in the job market.

Modi also urged students to be patriotic and to work for the betterment of India. He said that India is a great country with a rich culture and heritage, and that it is the duty of every Indian to contribute to its development.

headline: "President Kalam calls for 'new vision' for India"
article:
President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam has called for a "new vision" for India, one that is based on science and technology and that will lead to the country becoming a developed nation by 2020.

In his address to the nation on New Year's Day, President Kalam said that India had the potential to become a global leader in science and technology. He urged the nation to focus on education and research, and to create a conducive environment for innovation and entrepreneurship.

President Kalam also called for a change in mindset among Indians. He said that Indians needed to be more confident and assertive, and to believe in their own abilities. He also said that Indians needed to be more united and work together to achieve their common goals.

President Kalam's vision for India is a bold and ambitious one. However, it is a vision that is achievable if the nation is united and committed to working towards it.

Here are some of the key points from President Kalam's speech:

* India has the potential to become a global leader in science and technology.
* The nation needs to focus on education and research.
* A conducive environment needs to be created for innovation and entrepreneurship.
* Indians need to be more confident and assertive.
* Indians need to be more united and work together to achieve their common goals.

President Kalam's vision for India is one that is shared by many Indians. It is a vision of a prosperous and developed India, where all Indians have the opportunity to reach their full potential.
summary:
In his New Year's Day address to the nation in 2002, President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam called for a "new vision" for India, one that is based on science and technology and that will lead to the country becoming a developed nation by 2020.

President Kalam urged the nation to focus on education and research, and to create a conducive environment for innovation and entrepreneurship. He also called for a change in mindset among Indians, saying that they needed to be more confident and assertive, and to believe in their own abilities. He also said that Indians needed to be more united and work together to achieve their common goals.

President Kalam's vision for India is a bold and ambitious one, but it is a vision that is achievable if the nation is united and committed to working towards it.

headline: Terror Trio Goes On Punjab Rampage
article:
Three heavily armed terrorists on Tuesday attacked a police station in Punjab's Gurdaspur district, killing four policemen and three civilians before being shot dead in a 12-hour gun battle.

The attack began at around 5.30am when the terrorists, dressed in army uniforms, opened fire on a bus on the highway near Dinanagar town in Gurdaspur district. They then hijacked a taxi and drove to the police station, where they opened fire on the policemen on duty.

The four policemen killed in the attack were Superintendent of Police (SP) Baljit Singh, Sub-Inspector (SI) Raminder Singh, Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Jagjit Singh and head constable Amarjit Singh. The three civilians killed in the attack were identified as Satpal Singh, Gurdeep Singh and Rajesh Kumar.

Security forces immediately surrounded the police station and launched a counter-assault. The gun battle lasted for over 12 hours, and all three terrorists were eventually killed.

The attack was condemned by all political parties in India and Pakistan. Prime Minister Narendra Modi described it as a "cowardly attack" and said that the perpetrators would be brought to justice.

The attack in Gurdaspur was the third major terrorist attack in Punjab in the past two years. In January 2014, six people were killed in a terrorist attack on a railway station in Pathankot. In May 2015, two people were killed in a terrorist attack on a bus in Amritsar.

The attacks in Punjab have raised concerns about the security of the state and the country as a whole. The Indian government has said that it is determined to crush terrorism and bring the perpetrators to justice.
summary:
Three terrorists attacked a police station in Punjab's Gurdaspur district, killing four policemen and three civilians before being shot dead in a 12-hour gun battle. The attack was condemned by all political parties in India and Pakistan, and the Indian government has said that it is determined to crush terrorism and bring the perpetrators to justice.

The Indian government has said that it is determined to crush terrorism and bring the perpetrators to justice. However, the attacks in Punjab raise questions about the government's ability to protect its citizens from terrorism.

The attack in Gurdaspur is a reminder that terrorism is a serious threat to India and other countries around the world. It is important to remain vigilant and to take steps to protect ourselves from terrorism.

headline: India to launch new satellite in January
article:
The Indian Express article "India to launch new satellite in January" reports that the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is planning to launch a new satellite in January 2024. The satellite is expected to be launched on board the PSLV-C56 rocket from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota.

The new satellite is a remote sensing satellite that will be used for a variety of purposes, including monitoring agriculture, forestry, and coastal areas. It will also be used for disaster management and urban planning.

The ISRO has been developing a number of new satellites in recent years, as part of its efforts to boost India's space capabilities. The launch of the new satellite in January will be a significant milestone for India's space program.
summary:
* ISRO is planning to launch a new satellite in January 2024.
* The satellite will be launched on board the PSLV-C56 rocket from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota.
* The new satellite is a remote sensing satellite that will be used for a variety of purposes, including monitoring agriculture, forestry, and coastal areas. It will also be used for disaster management and urban planning.
* The launch of the new satellite will be a significant milestone for India's space program.

headline: Spacecraft Begins 40-Days Journey
article:
India's first interplanetary spacecraft, Aditya-L1, was launched on July 15, 2023, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, Andhra Pradesh. The spacecraft was launched by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on a Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle (GSLV) Mk-III rocket.

Aditya-L1 is a solar observatory spacecraft that will study the Sun from a unique vantage point. The spacecraft will orbit the Sun at a distance of 1.5 million kilometers from Earth, at a point known as the Lagrange point L1.

The spacecraft will carry seven scientific payloads to study the Sun's corona, chromosphere, and photosphere. Aditya-L1 will also study the Sun's magnetic field and its impact on Earth's climate.

The spacecraft is expected to take 40 days to reach its final orbit around the Sun. Once it reaches its destination, Aditya-L1 will begin its scientific mission, which is expected to last for at least seven years.

The launch of Aditya-L1 is a major milestone for India's space program. It is the first time that India has launched a spacecraft to study the Sun. The spacecraft is expected to provide valuable data about the Sun that will help scientists to better understand our nearest star.
summary:
India's first interplanetary spacecraft, Aditya-L1, was launched on July 15, 2023, on a 40-day journey to study the Sun from a unique vantage point. The spacecraft is expected to provide valuable data about the Sun that will help scientists to better understand our nearest star.

Aditya-L1's mission is to study the Sun's dynamics, including its magnetic field, solar flares, and coronal mass ejections. The spacecraft will also study the Sun's impact on Earth's climate, including the effects of solar storms on Earth's atmosphere and magnetosphere.

The launch of Aditya-L1 is a major milestone for India's space program. It is the first time that India has launched a spacecraft to study the Sun. The spacecraft is expected to provide valuable data about the Sun that will help scientists to better understand our nearest star and its impact on Earth.

headline: India and Pakistan agree to resume dialogue
article:
India and Pakistan have agreed to resume dialogue after a two-year hiatus, according to a joint statement issued by the two countries on Friday, October 19, 2023. The agreement was reached during a meeting between the foreign ministers of the two countries in Islamabad.

The statement said that the two sides "agreed to resume a comprehensive bilateral dialogue covering all issues of concern, including Jammu and Kashmir." The dialogue is expected to begin in early 2024.

The resumption of dialogue is a significant development in India-Pakistan relations. The two countries have been nuclear-armed rivals since their independence in 1947, and they have fought three wars over Kashmir.

The decision to resume dialogue comes as both countries face a number of challenges, including economic instability and terrorism. The two countries have also been under international pressure to improve their relations and to resolve their outstanding disputes peacefully.

The resumption of dialogue is a positive step, and it is hoped that it will lead to a more peaceful and prosperous relationship between India and Pakistan.

Here are some of the specific issues that are likely to be discussed during the dialogue:

* **Kashmir:** Kashmir is the most contentious issue between India and Pakistan. Both countries claim the entire territory, and it has been a major source of tension and conflict for decades.
* **Terrorism:** India and Pakistan have both been victims of terrorism. The two sides have accused each other of supporting terrorist groups, and this has been a major obstacle to improving relations.
* **Trade:** India and Pakistan have a lot of potential for trade, but it has been limited by political tensions. The resumption of dialogue could lead to an increase in trade and economic cooperation between the two countries.
* **People-to-people ties:** There are many cultural and historical ties between India and Pakistan. The resumption of dialogue could lead to an increase in people-to-people exchanges, which would help to promote understanding and goodwill between the two peoples.

The resumption of dialogue is a welcome development, and it is hoped that it will lead to a more peaceful and prosperous relationship between India and Pakistan.
summary: India and Pakistan have agreed to resume dialogue after a two-year hiatus. The dialogue, which is expected to begin in early 2024, will cover all issues of concern, including the disputed territory of Kashmir. The resumption of dialogue is a significant development in India-Pakistan relations, and it is hoped that it will lead to a more peaceful and prosperous relationship between the two countries.

headline: Rajnath: PLA's Violent conduct completely violates all Norms
article:
Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said that the Chinese People's Liberation Army's (PLA) violent conduct completely violates all norms and agreements between India and China.

"The PLA's violent conduct completely violates all norms and agreements between India and China. India has taken strong measures to safeguard its borders. We are committed to resolving the issue peacefully," Singh said in a statement.

Singh's statement comes after a violent clash between Indian and Chinese troops in Galwan Valley, Ladakh, on June 15, 2020, in which 20 Indian soldiers were killed. The PLA also suffered casualties, but the exact number is unknown.

The clash was the deadliest between Indian and Chinese troops since 1975. It has led to a significant increase in tensions between the two countries.

Singh said that India has taken strong measures to safeguard its borders. He said that the Indian Army is fully prepared to deal with any challenge from the PLA.

"Our armed forces are fully prepared to deal with any challenge. We are committed to resolving the issue peacefully. However, we will not compromise on our national security," Singh said.

The Indian government has said that it is committed to resolving the issue with China through dialogue and diplomacy. However, it has also said that it will not be intimidated by the PLA's aggressive behavior.

The clash in Galwan Valley has raised concerns about the possibility of a war between India and China. However, both countries have said that they do not want war.
summary:
Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the Chinese People's Liberation Army's (PLA) violent conduct in Galwan Valley, Ladakh, on June 15, 2020, completely violates all norms and agreements between India and China.

Singh said that India has taken strong measures to safeguard its borders and that the Indian Army is fully prepared to deal with any challenge from the PLA. He said that India is committed to resolving the issue peacefully, but will not compromise on its national security.

headline: Explosives-laden Pak fishing boat intercepted
article:
Reviving memories of the 26/11 terror strike on Mumbai, the Coast Guard on December 31 night intercepted a Pakistani fishing boat with explosives near the maritime boundary off the Porbandar coast in the Arabian Sea.

At least four persons, who were seen on the boat but disregarded all warnings by the Coast Guard to stop, are believed to be dead, after the crew “blasted” the ship.
summary: 26/11 terror strike the coast guard found a boat with lot of explosives but ignored it, later the boat was blasted by crew member

headline: Suspicious boat: BJP flays Pakistan
article:
Accusing Pakistan of repeatedly aiding terror activities in India, BJP on Friday said it reflects “frustration” of the neighbouring country and complimented the armed forces for foiling a bid similar to the 26/11 terror attacks off the Gujarat Coast.

The party also lauded the alacrity displayed by the forces in foiling the bid and said it was a result of Prime Minister Narendra Modi giving more powers to them in dealing with terror activities of its own instead of looking up to Delhi.
summary: the BJP flays pakistan for the boat blast near gujarat coast and praises PM Modi for giving more powers to deal with it

headline: India can be a beacon to the world: Bhagwat
article:
The world is turning to India for a new path of peaceful co-existence in these difficult times and we have a responsibility to guide the world, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat said here on Sunday.

“Due to the decline of religions, the world is facing a crisis. Everything from theism to atheism and science has been tried. But the problems remain. Thinkers worldwide are saying that a new path is needed. They are turning to India,” Mr. Bhagwat said in his address to thousands of RSS workers on the concluding day of the organisation’s three-day conclave. “This country, with its non-imperialist past and steeped in tradition, can give a lesson in peace and happiness to the world. Those born in India have a responsibility to be a beacon to the world. It is important that we lead our lives in such a way as to set an example.”
summary: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that the world turning towards india because of peaceful co-existence in difficult times

headline: U.S. aid ignores LeT, JeM rallies, Lakhvi bail
article:
Despite the fact that both the LeT and JeM have resurfaced visibly in the past year in Pakistan and the founders of both, Hafiz Saeed and Masood Azhar, have held public rallies in Pakistan in 2014, the U.S. Secretary of State has signed off on a certification that the Pakistan government has “prevented al-Qaeda, the Taliban and associated terror groups such as Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammad from operating in the territory of Pakistan” for the year.

The certificate is a condition for the U.S. to disburse funds under the Kerry-Lugar Bill for civilian aid to Pakistan that was co-authored by Mr. Kerry in 2009. This year’s grant of $532 million to Pakistan will be disbursed shortly.
summary: US ignores LeT , JeM rallies held in pakistan by founders of both terroist organisation in pakistan

headline: Defence lab catches fire
article:
One of the testing laboratories of the Dehradun-based Defence Electronics Application Laboratory (DEAL) caught fire, on Sunday morning.

Abul Kalam, Station House Office (SHO) of the Raipur police station, said that police was informed about the incident at about 7 in the morning, on Sunday.
summary: Testing lab in Dehradun based DEAL caught fire on sunday later police was informed

headline: Meerut villagers to move PMO against Godse temple
article:
The controversy over the Hindu Mahasabha’s plan to build a temple for Nathuram Godse, the assassin of Mahatma Gandhi, took an interesting turn on Sunday when thousands of villagers resolved at a rally that they would not allow the temple to come up.

The development comes a day after civil society activists sought to counter the Mahasabha’s “propaganda” against Mahatma Gandhi and the historical facts about his assassination. The villagers also decided to approach the Prime Minister’s Office.
summary: The villagers decided to approach PMO against the godse temple build by the Hindu Mahasabhas of nathuram Godse the assassin of mahatma gandhi

headline: 36000 RTI queries pending as CIC remains headless
article:
At a time when transparency and access to information have emerged as prerequisites of good governance, there are over 36000 pending Right to Information (RTI) queries pending at the Central Information Commission (CIC), which has been functioning without a Chief Information Commissioner for almost four months now.

According to information furnished by the Department of Personnel and Training (DoPT), 203 people, including all seven serving Information Commissioners and a former DoPT secretary, have applied for the top post, lying vacant since 22nd August.
summary: there are around 36000 pending RTI in CIC which is functioning without a chief information commissioner

headline: Absent from duty for 25 years, CPWD official dismissed
article:
An official of the Central Public Works Department (CPWD), who has been on furlough for the past 25 years, has been dismissed from service. On Thursday, Urban Development Minister M. Venkaiah Naidu issued orders to dismiss A.K. Verma for unauthorised absence from duty.

Mr. Verma, who joined the CPWD as an assistant executive engineer in 1980, went on leave in December 1990 and did not report to work thereafter. According to the Ministry, he continued extending his leave and defied directions to report to work.
summary: A CPWD assistant executive engineer who went on leave on 1980 and is on leave from then since 25 years is fired from his job by minister

headline: Rajnath rejects Punjab appeal
article:
The Union Home Ministry has ruled out premature release of those convicted for life in heinous crimes like the assassination of Punjab Chief Minister Beant Singh, but is willing to examine other proposals of the Punjab government for release of prisoners.

Punjab Deputy Chief Minister Sukhbir Singh Badal, accompanied by Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee president Avtar Singh Makkar, met Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday and handed to him a list of names seeking their release.
summary: Rajnath Singh refused the proposal of release of prisoners of muuder of fromer CM by the CM of Punjab and SGPC president

headline: Fuel efficiency, safety most important factors for Indian car buyers
article:
Fuel efficiency and safety innovations are the most important consumer considerations while purchasing a car for Indians, according to a survey. Globally too such considerations were valid, it said.

The latest annual KPMG `Global Automotive Executive Survey’ 2015, now in its sixteenth year, found that for the next five years, respondents see consumers still fixated on traditional product issues that will drive their purchasing decisions.
summary: according to survey the indian customers prefer car with high fuel efficiency and high safety

headline: SIT quizzes Tharoor’s domestic help
article:
The Special Investigating Team of Delhi Police probing the death of Sunanda Pushkar, wife of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, on Thursday interrogated his domestic help.

Sources said Mr. Tharoor’s domestic help Narayan Singh was interrogated at an undisclosed location in South Delhi. He was interrogated by police at least twice earlier.
summary: the SIT of delhi police in case of shashi tharoor wives daeth interrogated the domestic helper narayan singh in an undisclosed location in south delhi

headline: The explosion of digital uncertainty
article: Recent advances in Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) have captured the imagination of the public, businesses and governments alike. The Government of India has also, very recently, released a comprehensive report on the opportunities afforded by this current wave of AI. Leaders of the IT industry in India are almost certain that this wave of AI will lead to fundamental changes in the skills landscape, and implicitly, in terms of underlying threats and dangers.
summary: In recent times, the incredible progress in Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) has generated significant interest and excitement among the general public, businesses, and governments worldwide. Even the Indian government has recently published a comprehensive report outlining the potential opportunities presented by this ongoing AI revolution. It's evident that India's IT industry leaders are strongly convinced that this AI wave is set to bring about profound transformations in the job market, which, in turn, will introduce new challenges and risks. In simpler terms, the recent advancements in AI, which can create content and understand human language, have everyone's attention. The Indian government has also recognized the potential in AI and shared a detailed report about it. People who lead the IT sector in India believe that AI will change the types of jobs available and could also bring new problems and threats.

headline: NEET & JEE Results 2023 - Students of Aakash deliver top ranks
article: Year after year Aakash Institute has proved its excellence in NEET-UG and JEE (Advanced) 2023 being no less. Among the Top 10 AIR in NEET-UG, Aakash Institute's classroom program students have secured AIR 3, 5, 6, and 8, which mirrors the dedication and hard work of both the students and the institute. In JEE (Advanced) too, classroom students of Aakash have secured a total of 6 ranks in the Top 50 AIR including AIR 27, 28, 29, 31, 36, and 42. The outstanding performance of the students at Aakash in both of the highly competitive examinations is a testament in itself to the quality of education and training being imparted by the institute.
summary: Aakash Institute has once again shown its excellence in the NEET-UG and JEE (Advanced) exams of 2023. In the NEET-UG, their classroom program students have achieved remarkable ranks, including AIR 3, 5, 6, and 8. This is a clear reflection of the hard work and dedication of both the students and the institute. Similarly, in the JEE (Advanced) exams, Aakash's classroom students have secured an impressive total of 6 ranks within the Top 50 AIR, including AIR 27, 28, 29, 31, 36, and 42. These outstanding results speak volumes about the quality of education and training provided by Aakash Institute. In simpler terms, Aakash Institute's students have done exceptionally well in the NEET-UG and JEE (Advanced) exams of 2023. Their success is a testament to the high-quality education and training they receive at the institute.

headline: #MandelaDay: Gandhi was not the only Indian to inspire Madiba
article: The inspiration that the anti-apartheid leader drew from the political struggles of Gandhi has been widely acclaimed. Deeply inspired by Gandhi’s philosophy of ‘satya’ and ‘ahimsa’, Mandela often referred to the Mahatma as his ‘role model’. But Mandela’s connections with India was hardly limited to his admiration for Gandhi. Once he was released from jail in 1990, he visited India many times and considered the country his place of pilgrimage. While much has been written about the Mandela’s devotion to Gandhi, hardly ever do we hear about the influence that other Indians had upon the South African president.
summary: Nelson Mandela, the prominent anti-apartheid leader, was widely known for drawing inspiration from the political struggles of Mahatma Gandhi. His deep admiration for Gandhi's principles of 'satya' (truth) and 'ahimsa' (non-violence) led him to view Gandhi as his role model. However, Mandela's connection with India extended beyond his reverence for Gandhi. After his release from prison in 1990, he made several visits to India and regarded it as a place of great significance and spiritual importance to him. While we often hear about Mandela's respect for Gandhi, we rarely explore the influence that other individuals from India had on the South African president.

headline: Bengal government issues flood alert for seven districts ahead of heavy rain forecast
article: The Bengal government has alerted West Burdwan, Bankura, Birbhum, East Burdwan, West Midnapore, Hooghly and Howrah as the authorities apprehend a high possibility of floods in these seven districts ever since the Met department has predicted heavy rainfall in the upper catchment areas of the Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC), a central utility, in Jharkhand till October 5. “In the past, floods had hit the state whenever the DVC released additional water from Durgapur Barrage. This time, there is a high possibility that the DVC would release additional water because of heavy rainfall in the upper catchment areas of Maithan dam,” said a senior official.
summary: The government of Bengal has issued a warning for seven districts, namely West Burdwan, Bankura, Birbhum, East Burdwan, West Midnapore, Hooghly, and Howrah. This alert comes as a response to the predictions from the Meteorological Department, indicating heavy rainfall in the upper catchment regions of the Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC), which is a central authority, located in Jharkhand. These conditions are expected to persist until October 5. Historically, the state has experienced floods whenever the DVC released additional water from the Durgapur Barrage. This time around, there's a significant likelihood of the DVC having to release extra water due to the heavy rainfall in the upper catchment areas of the Maithan dam. This is the reason for the concern and the alert in these districts.

headline: Blue-eyed boys: Shaik Rasheed and Nirvetla Rishith Reddy
article: Team India defeated England by four wickets in the ICC U-19 World Cup final in Antigua to clinch a record-extending fifth U19 World Cup title.
